loans.name: Mei

texts.en:
Mei R., 54, is a humble, widowed mother blessed with three children. All three of them are now married and live together in the family home.

Mei R. has her own small business, the main operation of which is to buy merchandise in bulk from market suppliers and gain a profit by retailing them to regular clients who are fellow villagers living around the community. By doing this, she is able to generate $7 each day.

Mei R. has applied for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her son-in-law to use to pick up passengers for a fee. Through this, Mei R. is hopeful that she will have more income to pay the family’s expenses and her loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to start her son-in-law's transportation business

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert B. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Gilbert owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Gilbert joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. Gilbert plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech P., 32 years old, owns a small wooden house and a grocery shop, where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets, soft drinks, and gasoline. Pech P. retails her inventory to people who are passers-by and are also her neighbors living near her house. She has been running a grocery investment for a long time and earns an average of $2 a day. To ensure the entire family has financial stability, her husband works in construction. This couple now lives with three children who are going to school or to work. 

Beside their current businesses, Pech P. and her husband wish to fish around the river in order to raise additional income for their family but this action requires many tools. Because she has no money, Pech P. has asked for a loan to buy a boat, nets, and traps to begin fishing.

loans.use: To buy a boat, nets, and traps to begin fishing.

loans.name: Felilia

texts.en:
Felilia A. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 69 years old. Felilia is widowed. To make a living, Felilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Felilia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Felilia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; ella tiene 38 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende leche, ella compra a una señora la leche todos los días a primera hora y los lleva a vender a todo el pueblo hasta que se le acabe, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor la leche y pagar una pequeña deuda con su proveedora y está pensando en comprar una vaquita.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the community bank "Señor de Ccoyllority Yungaqui". She lives in the district of Anta in the Anta province in the state of Cusco. Felicitas is 38 years old and is a native of Iscuchaka. She is married and has four children. Felicitas alternates her home activities with her retail business tasks of buying and selling milk. She buys milk from the same woman early in the morning each day and brings it to sell in the town until it runs out. Felicitas is requesting this loan so that she can purchase the milk at wholesale and pay back a small debt that she has with her provider. She is also thinking about purchasing a cow. Luisa values and is very grateful for the loan granted to her since it allows her to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Likewise, she promises to pay back her installments in the time period stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk at wholesale and pay back a small debt that she has with her provider

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Cirila tiene un restaurante en su domicilio en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco, donde vende desayuno, almuerzo, cena, gaseosas y cerveza.  La pueden encontrar en su restaurante, que está equipado con mesas y sillas, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de comida.  Un flujo regular de clientes visita su restaurante y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora del desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Cirila también se dedica a la crianza de animales de menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas y vende sus animales en el mercado “Vino Canchón” los días domingos.  
	
Con su próximo préstamo, Cirila espera recibir $ 500 USD. Por el momento, su restaurante está equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo gaseosas y cervezas. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Cirila es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Cirila was born in the city of Cusco and still lives there with her husband and four children. Cirila has an eatery in her home located in the San Jerónimo district, Cusco province. She sells breakfast, lunch, dinner, soft-drinks and beer. She can be found tending to her restaurant, which is equipped with tables and chairs, seven days a week from 6am until 9pm or until her supply of food runs out. A regular flow of customers visits her establishment and the business keeps her on her toes during breakfast, lunch and dinner. Cirila also raises small farm animals, like guinea pigs and chickens, to sell at “Vino Canchón” Market on Sundays. Cirila expects to get $500 USD in her next loan. For the moment the restaurant is equipped with all the basics. She’d like to use the funds to buy merchandise like soft-drinks and beer. The “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo” (San Jerónimo Lionesses) communal bank has been in operation for 10 loan cycles and Cirila is one of the bank’s founding members; she does quite well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like soft-drinks and beer.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. K. N., age 49, is the village bank president. She was selected by the bank's 21 members. The bank and its members live in Ta Reab Doun S. village, Kandal province. The members of this group will use the money to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different businesses.

Mrs. K. N. and her husband, Mr. Chhin Sao, are farmers. They own a plot of land that they use to cultivate lotus and cucumber in order to earn a living. With the farm, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.

In order to support the farming crop, Mrs. K. N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to cultivate lotus and cucumbers. 

The couple has five children. Two are seamstresses in a garment factory. The other three children are students who also help their parents on the farm. 

Mrs. KoemsE. Chorn is a group guarantee. All members are shown in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to cultivate lotus and cucumbers.

loans.name: Las Flores De Yanacona Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Las Flores de Yanacona”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yanacona, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nicolasa; ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 3 Hijos; La socia trabaja en crianza de animales menores y tiene una tienda de abarrotes y también tiene una pequeñas tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y arvejas, sus animales menores y los productos que cosecha lo vende en las diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Izcuchaca y en algunas oportunidades lo lleva a vender a la ciudad de Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y para comprar animales menores como pollos y chanchos.

Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de artefactos, venta de ropa en el mercado, carpintería, venta de carne y animales menores, siembra.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This are the members of the Banco Comunal “Las Flores de Yanacona” (“Yanacona’s Flowers” Community Bank), which is located in Yanacona, a district in the Urubamba province of the Cusco region. Nicolasa is one of the members of the bank: she is 42 and has 3 children. She engages in breeding small animals as well as in a grocery store, and she also owns some land where she plants maize, potatoes and peas. She sells her animals and her crops in different fairs taking place in the Izcuchaca district, and in some occasions she also goes to the town of Cusco to sell them. She is requesting a loan to buy products for the grocery store and to buy small animals such as chickens and piglets. The other members of the group engage in sowing, selling arts and crafts, clothes sale, carpentry, meat and small animals’ sale. Nicolasa is thankful to those who will help making her dream come true through this loan, and she commits to comply with repaying her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery store proucts and to buy chickens and piglets.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 37-year-old married man.  He is a hardworking man who sells clothes to earn a living.  Having been in the business for four years, he hopes to open several boutiques in the future.  Samuel is a member of Faulu Kenya in Rukaka group.  He had previously serviced two loans through the group.  His living standards have improved since he joined the Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy trousers, shirts and other types of clothes.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts and other types of clothes

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu I. is a trader at Nyinasi, near Abura. Salamatu is a widow with four children. She trades in cereals like beans and groundnuts, and apart from that also sells charcoal. She will use the loan she is requesting to expand her business. She will add the loan to the capital she already has to buy more beans and groundnuts to sell. She will then use the profits she gets to cater for her children, to further their education, and also pay the utility bills and other expenses of her home.

loans.use: buy more beans and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Topister

texts.en:
Topister is 25 years old. She is married with three children who are between the ages of 1 and 8. Two of the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has has been farming for one year. She also runs a charcoal business in a nearby market. Her farm currently produces eggs only which she sells at the local market. She says her biggest problem has been poultry diseases.

She recently repaid her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to expand her poultry project. She says the proceeds from this project will go a long way in the education of her children who are in a private school. She says that in future, she would like to expand her farm size to accommodate at least two dairy cows.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to build up her business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old. Annie is married and has 3 children aged 5, 4 and 1. Annie is a farmer and so is her husband. They both cultivate their land for planting and harvesting rice crops. Annie also makes sure she takes good care of her young children. She works hard to be able to sustain her family.

Annie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Annie is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Las Novatas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Novatas está formado por 9 mujeres quienes viven en la vecina ciudad D. Azogues, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza D. la estructura D. su ciudad estando su iglesia catedral en la mas alto D. la ciudad, su gente es amable y cordial como nuestras socias quines son mujeres alegres, trabajadoras y luchan para salir  adelante junto a sus familias.

La Señora Mariana Tenesaca vive en la ciudad D. Azogues, es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal.
 
La Señora. Mariana tiene 56 años, todos sus hijos son mayores  D. edad y  casados, solo vive con una hija y comparten los gastos del hogar.

Doña Mariana se dedica a la venta D. papas fritas, tortillas, humitas etc., en su negocio  empezó  vendiendo papas fritas, luego se ha dedicado a la venta D. carnes en palito y así ha ido creciendo poco a poco, primero vendía en su casa y ahora a arrendado un local en la ciudad,   trabaja con su nieto D. quince años.

El dinero D. su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra D. un termo, en ollas y tazas para implementar su local. Su meta es tener un local mucho más granD..
texts.en:
The nine women members of the Novata Community Bank live in the town of Azogues, known for the beauty of its buildings such its tall cathedral. Its people are friendly and warm, just like these cheerful and hardworking women who are working hard to give their families a better future.

Señora Mariana T. lives in Azogues, and this is the first loan she has had with the community bank.She is 56 years old. All her children are grown up and married. She lives with a daughter and they share the cost of running the household. Mariana earns her living selling fries, tortillas, humitas (a kind of corn cake) etc. She started out selling fries only, and then she sold meat on skewers. Gradually the business has expanded. At first she ran the business from her house, but now she rents a stall in the town. Her 15-year old grandson works with her.

Mariana plans to use the loan to buy a Thermos flask, pots, and cups to use at her stall. Her goal is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy a Thermos flask, pots, and cups

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es: María Leticia O. G. de 37 años de edad, reside en Ilopango en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive junto a sus dos padres de edad avanzada y junto a dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, quien se gana la vida comercializando ropa para hombres y mujeres, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, así mismo hace algunas visitas a las casas de sus clientes para poder mostrarles su productos. María es madre soltera, y su mayor deseo es el de poder darle una vida mejor a sus hijos, brindándoles estudios, alimento, ropa y demás. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su inventario y comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, sobretodo para este fin de año en que sus ventas se aumentan en gran manera.
texts.en: Maria Leticia O. G., age 37, lives in the town of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her elderly parents as well as her two children who are currently studying. Maria is a responsible and hardworking mother of a family who makes her living selling men's and women's clothing. She runs her business from her home, but also sometimes makes visits to her clients' homes in order to show her inventory. As a single mother, Maria's greatest wish is to be able to give a better life to her children, providing them with education, nutrition, clothes, and everything else. She is asking for a loan in order to increase her inventory by purchasing a greater amount of clothes, especially given that her sales increase greatly during the end of the year season.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing inventory for retail sales

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been practicing mixed farming for the last 30 years. He has a farm in Kisii town, western Kenya that produces maize, beans, bananas, tea and milk, which are all sold locally. He depends on the income from his farm to provide for the needs of his family.

Peter is 69 years old, and married, with 12 children between the ages of 18 and 28. Two of his children are currently attending school.

He has requested this 45,000KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Peter says this will ensure that his family will have enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. His biggest challenge has been the high cost of transportation due to poor road networks in the area. He would like to acquire more dairy cows in future and purchase a motorcycle to assist in transporting his products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Señor Pan De Azúcar De Calca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor Pan D. Azúcar D. Calca” tiene 3  años y medio D. funcionamiento y está conformado por mujeres y varones, los socios buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Calca. La ciudad Calca está ubicado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría D. los socios viven en este poblado D. Calca y se dedican a la artesanía,  ganadería y agricultura.   
 
Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta D. maíz, venta D. torta, venta D. pastales, venta D. calzados y venta D. adobes. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios D. construcción D. casas y asistencia social.  
 
Julieta, tiene 32 años y nació en el distrito D. Calca provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú. Ella es una joven emprendedora que tiene estudios superiores pero también se dedica al comercio. Su actividad económica D. Julieta es la venta D. maíz. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Julieta va invertir en microcrédito en comprar más semillas, abono y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
The “Señor Pan D. Azúcar D. Calca” communal bank has been in operation for three and a half years.  It has both male and female members.  The members always seek opportunities to get ahead and through their daily efforts proviD. a better future for their children.  The bank meets every 30 days in the city of Calca.  The city of Calca is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Most of the members live in Calca and are craftspeople, cattlemen and farmers.

Among the economic activities of the members are the following examples: sale of corn, sale of tortas, cake sales, shoe sales and sale of adobe bricks.  Other members proviD. house construction services and social assistance.

Julieta, 32, was born in Calca district, Calca province, Cusco department, Perú.  She is a young, enterprising woman who has higher education but is also a merchant.  Julieta’s economic activity is corn sales.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well.  Julieta will invest her microcredit purchasing seeds, manure and many other things.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, manure and many more things.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh S., 27 years old, owns a small wooden house and a grocery shop where she sells many items, including cooking ingredients, sweets, soft drinks, and other goods to passers-by and her neighbors. She has been operating this enterprise for a long time and earns an average of $1.25 a day. To ensure the entire family's financial stability, her husband works as a firewood seller. This couple has two children, both of whom are attending school. 

In order to sustain other expenses of the whole family, Lanh S. is taking out her loan to buy piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price. With the remaining funds, she will buy a pot for distilling liquor.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise for sale and a pot for distilling liquor.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Rafah in Gaza Strip. He has a phone accessories store. He sells phone accessories, batteries, covers, etc. Muhammad wanted to increase his sales and offer a larger variety of accessories, so he took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the items he needs.

Muhammad is photographed in his store in the picture here.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories

loans.name: Ana Milagro

texts.es:
Ana tiene 32 años de edad, reside en Guatajiagua, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo don Ángel y tres hijos Gerson de 14 años, Ángel de 12 y Gabriela de 9 años de edad, Ana y su esposo trabajan para sostener el hogar, dedicándose su esposo a la comercialización de loza y a la agricultura.

El negocio de las tortillas lo inicio hace 4 años, con un horario de 9:00am a 2:00pm, este fue iniciativa propia como alternativa por las dificultades que enfrenta en ocasiones de escasez de dinero y materia prima.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar maíz y leña, para tener materia prima suficiente para continuar en la venta, esta será una gran ayuda a la economía de Ana ya que el maíz le es necesario para preparar tortillas y en este caso comprara abundantemente para disponer un largo tiempo.

Su objetivo por ahora es que sus hijos crezcan sanos, apoyarlos para que asistan a la escuela y estar a la expectativa para expandirse a cualquier otro negocio que sea rentable
texts.en:
32-year old Ana lives in Guatajiagua in the department of Morazán and earns her living by selling tortillas. She lives with her husband Ángel and their children Gerson (14), Ángel (12), and Gabriela (9). Ana and her husband work hard to provide for their family. Her husband sells pots and also works on the land. 

Ana started her tortilla business four years ago on her own initiative. She works from 9am to 2pm. From time to time she faces financial difficulties and a shortage of ingredients. 

Ana needs a loan to buy corn and firewood. She wants to have sufficient ingredients on hand so she can continue selling tortillas. This would give her welcome financial assistance--enough money to buy sufficient items to last a long time. Her goal for the time being is to raise healthy children and to support them through school. In the future she hopes to have another profitable business.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Viven en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande. Ésta es una zona agrícola que se encuentra en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuentan con servicios básicos como luz o agua potable.

Desde hace más de 4 años, Juan se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, el cual cría de edades menores y cuando los animales alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende en el mercado local. En adición, cultiva y mantiene limón, el cual cría, engorda y cosecha semanalmente para luego comercializarlos también en el mercado local. Realiza estas actividades, con la apoya de su esposa, en una parte posterior de su casa.

Desea invertir su crédito en alimentos balanceados para el engorde de su ganado y en abonos para el cultivo de limón. Espera lograr un buen peso y tamaño de sus animales y productos para venderlos a un mejor precio y  seguir creciendo en su actividad. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles. Juan es una mujer muy trabajador. Su esposa y él trabajan juntos para seguir adelante y lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 59, is married and has 3 children.  They live in their own house in the rural part of the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.  There are no basic services such as electricity nor potable water there.
For the last 4 years Juan has raised cattle.  He raises them from the time they are young and when the animals are well-developed, he sells them in the local market.  Also, he grows limes.  When they are ripe, he picks them weekly to sell in the local market as well.  His wife helps him,  and they have the cattle and lime trees behind their house.

He wants to buy balanced food to fatten his cattle, and fertilizer for the lime cultivation.  Juan is hoping to have his cattle reach a good weight and size.  He also  wants his other products to increase in size so that he can sell them at a better price and have his business grow.  That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 700 new sols.  Juan is a hard-working man and he and his wife work together to continue getting ahead and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy balanced food for his cattle and fertilizer for his lime trees.

loans.name: Leonarda Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel nació en la ciudad de Paruro del departamento de Cusco, ella tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Izcuchaca,  ella es viuda y por lo tanto es padre  madre para sus dos hijos. 

Isabel tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y también tiene una tienda escolares en el colegio Illary de la ciudad de Anta. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos y gallinas.  En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el microcrédito para comprar comida para los pollos. El sueño de Isabel es tener una granja de pollitos. 

Isabel es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in Paruro city in the department of Cusco. She is 43 years old and lives in Izcuchaca city. Isabel is a widow, and thus must act as both mother and father of her two children.

She owns a grocery store, located in her home, and also runs a store selling school supplies at the Illary secondary school in Anta city. She also raises small livestock such as guinea pigs and poultry. It is for this business that Isabel needs a microloan, to buy chicken feed. She dreams of having a poultry farm.

Isabel is a responsible person and member of the "Warmicuna Llanqanchis” community bank, which belongs to Arariwa banking association in Cusco city, Perú. “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” is Quechua for "Working Women".

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Batikul's Group

texts.en:
Batikul J. is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married. Together with her husband she has raised two sons. The first son works as a security guard and the second helps his parents in farming.  Twenty years ago Batikul’s parents presented her with a cow and since that moment she has been selling milk products. In this way she earns 5500 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her to improve the family’s living conditions. The family also cultivates agricultural products and then sells some part of the harvest on the market. 

Batikul needs to purchase fuel for farming. It is for this purpose that she applied for the loan. She hopes to obtain the loan in order to realize her plans. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fuel

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia is married and has 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rodelia is 40 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Rodelia has a lumberyard business in the Philippines. Rodelia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional lumber for her lumberyard business.

Rodelia has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Rodelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional lumber for her lumberyard business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo y su esposa son una familia de comerciantes que desde hace 2 años cuenta con su negocio de venta de tacos y gringas denominado “Betos`s” que es una comida típica de la región, que es  carne con condimento rojo puesta en un trompo y se pone en tortilla maíz pequeña y la Gringa es con la misma carne y queso pero con tortilla de harina  y son  acompañados con cilantro, cebolla y salsa. El negocio se ubica en una avenida muy transitada, donde hay variedad de negocios de venta de ropa usada y los clientes después de sus compras van a comer a este lugar.
 Esta pareja es quien prepara esta comida para ofrecer a sus clientes a un bajo precio y esta es su única fuente de ingresos por lo que desean comprar remodelar el local para que se encuentre en mejores condiciones para que haya fluidez de clientes y sus ventas se incrementen para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Eduardo and his wife are a family of merchants who have had a business for the last two years consisting of the sale of tacos and “gringas” called “Beto’s”.  Tacos are a typical dish of the region which are made from meat treated with a red sauce placed on a vertical grill called a “trompo” that is served in a small corn tortilla.  Gringas are made with the same meat and cheese but the tortilla is a flour tortilla and they are garnished with cilantro, onion and salsa.  The business is located on a very busy avenue where there are a variety of used clothes sales shops and when the customers finish shopping they come to eat at his place.

Eduardo and his wife prepare the food themselves to offer it to their customers at a low price and this is their only source of income.  They’d like to remodel their stand so that it will be in better condition so that they can have more customer traffic and sales will increase in order to cover their household expenses.

loans.use: to remodel his food stand.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de 8000 Defensores de la ciudad de San Estanislao o mejor conocido como Santani.
El comité está en el noveno Ciclo con 13  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que son responsables y pretenden alcanzar todas sus metas. Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso de sus emprendimientos.
La sra. Maria Josefina es una mujer muy sacrificada, lleva el liderazgo dentro de su grupo y dentro de su familia, pues es el sostén de la casa y desea superar la pobreza en la que se encuentran sus familiares, por ello se dedica a la cría de animales, pues en su ciudad es un comercio que permite obtener buenos ingresos económicos, es una actividad primaria.
Ella desea conseguir la ayuda de los inversionistas de Kiva mediante el crédito que solicita para comprar balanceados y vacunas para los animales que cría para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee was formed when several neighbors from 8000 Defensores neighborhood, in the city of San Estanislao (better known as Santani), came together as a group.

This committee is entering its ninth loan cycle with 13 members.  The group is noted in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  The members have a great, entrepreneurial spirit since they are responsible and try hard to reach all their goals.  By acquiring this loan, they see many doors opening to them which will enable them to make progress in their business undertakings.

Maria Josefina is a very self-sacrificing woman who leads both the group and her family.  She supports her household and would like to pull herself and her family out of the poverty in which they find themselves.  For this reason, she works raising animals.  In her city, this is a business that allows people to make good income.  It is a primary business activity.

Maria Josefina would like to gain the help of Kiva lenders, through the loan that she is requesting, so that she can buy balanced feed and also vaccines for the animals that she raises and then sells.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and vaccines

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Ngelita is single, and has two children. She is 55 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she sells viand (a tasty dish) and snacks everyday. She has been engaged in this kind of business for five years. She earns PHP 2,800 per month. 

She carries the burden of being a single mother, but this is not a hindrance to continue her dreams. She wants to add kitchen utensils to her small fast food business.  She requested a loan PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional kitchen utensils to have multiple incomes for her children's education.

Ngelita has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to continue her business in a large scale so her children can finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a trader in clothes, slippers, socks, dresses, etc. at a village called Besease in Elmina which is a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a policeman. She has been through senior high school. Her business is four years old. Mary uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers, socks, dresses, etc. for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, socks and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Alejandrina; ella es casada y tiene 67 años; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. venta D. animales y el negocio D. venta D. chicha que es una bebida a base D. maíz, la socia venD. animales como chanchos, cuyes y pollos los hace engordar y crecer y luego los venD. en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia D. Urubamba y la chicha también lo venD. en forma ambulatoria, por medio D. estos pequeños negocios sale adelante junto a su esposo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. animales y negocio D. venta D. chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales como chanchos, cuyes y gallinas y también para comprar maíz y jora para preparar la chicha.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. venta D. fruta, negocio D. venta D. verduras, negocio D. venta D. agricultura, negocio D. venta D. chicha, negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepcion” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Alejandrina. She is married and 67 years of age. Alejandrina has one business selling animals and another one selling “chicha”, a beverage maD. from corn. She sells animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. Once the animals are fattened, she sells them at different fairs throughout Urubamba Province. Alejandrina sells “chicha” as a street vendor. Through her small businesses, she and her husband are able to get ahead. Alejandrina wants to expand and improve both of her businesses, so she is requesting a loan to buy animals (such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens) and also corn and maize for making “chicha”.

The other members engage in business activities such as selling fruit, selling vegetables, farming, selling “chicha”, and selling groceries.

Alejandrina would like to thank those responsible for making this part of her dream a reality. She also promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens, as well as corn for making "chicha".

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 

Ines has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Ines has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Ines hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Leida Rosa

texts.es:
Leida de 19 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Castilla, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Leida a colocado un bazar donde ofrece todo tipo de productos para el uso diario en su domicilio, desde hace 5 año, éste negocio no tiene mayor competencia en la zona donde vive, siempre está tratando de ofrecer artículos novedosos para tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para implementar comprando otro tipo de mercadería como ropa para todas las edades, con la finalidad que sus ganancias aumenten en su bazar, lo que le permitirá pagar su crédito, mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir apoyando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Leida is 19 years old, single, and lives at the home of her parents. They receive running water and electricity. Leida resides in the District of Castilla, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for having businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Leida established a bazaar where she offers all types of products for everyday household use. She has been in business for five years and does not have any major competition in the area where she lives. Leida always tries to offer the latest merchandise since she has more demand from her customers. This enables her to earn more income to cover her personal expenses.

Noticing that her business has grown more prosperous each day, Leida decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that she can introduce other types of merchandise, such as clothing for all ages. Her goal is to increase the revenues of her bazaar, which will allow her to repay her loan, improve her quality of life, and continue supporting her parents financially.

loans.use: to purchase new types of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is 20 years old and married, with one infant. For the past five years, she has been running a small business where she sells cosmetics, beauty products and even personal items such as bags and clothes to all types of customers in her community. Kimberly describes herself as obedient.

Kimberly is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase additional cosmetic and beauty products. Kimberly hopes that someday she can renovate their house to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beauty products, bags and clothes to sell

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en: Enebish lives with her family in a ger (or traditional nomadic tent) in a remote part of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia which does not have infrastructure. She is 43 years old and makes a living selling clothes in a large outdoor market. Her husband is often out of town on business, which means that she must raise their children and run her business on her own. She imports her clothing from Ereen, a border city near China, and is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks to import more clothing to sell. She is working hard to improve her business and her family's life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell this autumn.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh is a 51-year-old married man with two sons. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City with his wife and children. 

Vinh and his wife sell noodles to people in the local community. They have done this for the past ten years.

Vinh plans to take a loan to expand his business by buying bread, pork, and furniture for his stall so that he can better serve his existing customers and attract new ones. He hopes his business will run smoothly and he will be able to earn more money to cover his family's living expenses.

loans.use: To expand the business by buying bread, pork, and furniture for his food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a variety of imported foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en:
Ndunge is 59 years old and married to Pius, but not yet blessed with a child. She runs a poultry business and practices farming in the busy area of Tala market, which gives her the potential for clients and to make more profit. She has been in this business for the last twenty years and gets an income of about KES 20,000 per month.

Ndunge was introduced to KADET LTD by a client of KADET, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to purchase chicks and chicken mash. She will use the extra profit to save for her old age.

She hopes the business will be stable and that she can employ people while she manages it. She is a determined, hardworking lady who wants to see herself established.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to raise and chicken mash.

loans.name: Leidy Marlith

texts.es:
Leidy Marlith tiene 25 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo de siete años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.

Leidy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le servirá para comprar semillas, plantas de cacao e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le ayudará a ampliar la producción. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para comparar dos cuadras de terreno para poder sembrar.
En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música, y realizar reuniones para mejorar el recinto.

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Leidy Marlith, 25, is married and has a son.  She lives with her 7-year-old son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. 

The “Nueva Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Guamayacu which belongs to Echeandía Canton.  Its members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers. Leidy is a corn, rice and pigeon pea farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in Echeandía. She used her previous loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition.

Relationships in her family have improved because she’s now able to contribute a bit more toward family wellbeing.  At work she’s doing much better because production has increased and income has improved quite a bit now that more income is obtained from selling more product.  Support from the previous loan helped her to improve and she had no problem making the installment payments established by the communal bank.

This new loan will be of much help because it will serve to buy seeds, cocoa bean plants and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte, fertilizer and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition.  The loan will be very useful because it will help her increase production.  The challenges she faces are frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to stay in business and to buy two cuadras [land measure] of farmland to plant.

In her free time she enjoys listening to music and organizing meetings to improve the hamlet.  She is very happy for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani is a widowed woman with six children who are all adults. She owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Meselemani has operated a firewood-selling business for the past 15 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She dreams of being a firewood wholesaler.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to be able to access financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Alberto Alonso

texts.es:
Alberto hombre trabajador, tiene su pequeño negocio, es conductor de su propio vehículo ofreciendo su servicio en la vía pública como taxista.  Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda colocándole las ventanas y puertas así obtuvo seguridad para su familia.
Se le ha presentado dificultades el vehículo descompuso ocasionado perdidas económicas, requiriendo realizarle revisión completa y cambios de repuestos. Con esta nueva solicitud de préstamo comprar: frenos, amortiguadores, aspírales, rotula, maniquea, bumper delantero, luces vía delanteros, laterales, focos, luces de stop, retroceso, entre otros repuestos del auto para cambiar la carrocería, la dirección, suspensión, rodamiento, sistema de frenos, el sistema eléctrico y el motor que tiene filtraciones de aceite siendo perdidas notables. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo ya que le ha permitido mejorar poco a poco su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Alberto is a hard-working man who has a small business.  He drives his own car providing service on the streets as a taxi-driver.  With his previous loan, he was able to improve his home's infrastructure by putting in windows and doors to ensure security for his family.

He has had some difficulties as his car has broken down causing him to lose money.  It needs to completely overhauled and have parts replaced.  With this new loan request, he will buy: brakes, dampers, coils, brackets, front bumper, parking lights, side-lights, head-lights, and stop-lights, among other automotive spare parts, so that he can change the bodywork, steering, suspension, bearings, brake system, electrical system and the motor which is leaking significant amounts of oil.

He is grateful to the lending institution for the help, as it has allowed him to improve his standard of living little by little.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is taking another Kiva loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to boost her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Amina dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Dionocio Gerardo

texts.es:
Dionocio de 34 años, desde hace 10 años atrás empezó con esta actividad de costurero en su sastrería, y gracias a Dios hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien.

Comienza a trabajar desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido problemas en su negocio.

Está casado y su esposo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen 1 hijo de 9 años que estudia en escuela fiscal.

Su meta es poder termina su casa de cemento y agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionocio, 34, started sewing in a tailor shop 10 years ago, and thank God, so far, it has gone well.

He starts working at 7 am and continues until 9 pm and thanks to God, he hasn’t had any problems in his business.

He is married, his wife works in the home and they have a 9-year old son who is in public school.

His dream is to finish his cement house and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy material and sewing machines

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachael is a 23 year old single lady who lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself. 

Rachael has operated a boutique for the past year.  Her clients are neighbors and friends.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Rachael dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more clothes for resale.  Rachael decided to join Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Due to hardships in life, Magdalena engages herself in the buying and selling of dry goods to supplement her husband's income. She is 40 years old and has two school-age children. They plan to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and find good jobs someday. Despite financial difficulties, Magdalena and her husband have the strong determination to work out their plan.

Magdalena aims to improve her small business to increase her income and support the education of their children. She is asking for capital of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stock of dry goods like shirts, short pants, skirts, blouses, jackets and pants to sell in the public market. She mentions that this loan will help her to work out her plan and make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods like shirts, short pants, skirts, blouses, jackets and pants to sell

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
La señora Luz Elena esta solicitando un crédito para la colocación de la losa de concreto en su vivienda; ya que desea mejorar el patrimonio que les dejara a sus dos hijos que tiene.
Doña Luz Elena se dedica a la venta de platillo, ingreso con el cual solventa los gastos de la casa, ya que se quedo viuda y con la pensión que recibe paga los gastos escolares de sus hijos. No es suficiente así que se esfuerza en su trabajo para poder bridarle a su familia lo mejor posible.
texts.en:
Luz Elena is requesting a loan to lay a concrete floor in her home as she would like to improve the inheritance that she will leave her two children.

Luz Elena's business is selling meals.  She uses the income from this business to cover her household expenses as she is a widow and uses the pension that she receives to cover her children's school expenses.  The money isn't enough and so she works hard in her business so that she can provide her family with the best she can.

loans.use: to lay a concrete floor

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 37-year-old married woman with two children, ages 19 and 10. Her husband works as a farmer.

Vicenta runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various items like vinegar, soy sauce, soft drinks, and canned goods. Vicenta earns 3,000 PHP per month with her business. She is able to help provide for her family's daily needs.

Vicenta has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soft drinks, and rice. She hopes this loan will help her business grow more.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, soft drinks, and rice.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en:
Dilara is a 45-year-old single woman. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She is living with her parents.

For the last 10 years, DIlara has been growing and selling fruits. Her father also helps her in this business, which is the only source of income for her family. Dilara chose this business because it is profitable. In Azerbaijan, fruits are in very high demand and people like to eat fresh fruits a lot. In addition to her fruit sales, she also sells vegetables. People use fresh vegetables and fruits every day and consider them healthy.

Dilara sells fruits and vegetables in the bazaar and sometimes from her house. Her monthly profit from this business is 80 AZN. Regarding the expansion of her business, Dilara is really optimistic about her future. She has applied for a loan of 2000 AZN. She has completed four previous loans from AqroInvest, and she is considered a good customer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Santosi

texts.en:
Santosi is a 33-year-old lady, living with her mother, husband and children. She has a goat farm in which she presently has 12 goats. She purchases goat kids and sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes 8-9 months for her to grow and sell them. She goes out in the morning to bring the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. She then helps her mother in the household activities and then resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her children assists her in maintaining the goats. In this way she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. She says that there is a lot of demand during the months of April to July and October to December, the auspicious time for Indian weddings. Currently she is not able to meet the demand during these months and other peak demand times. 

She wants to take a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase some more goat kids to be able to sell more and seize the opportunity during this peak demand period and to construct a shelter for the goats to protect them from the rain.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing goat kids and building a shelter for her goats.

loans.name: Cocobongo Group

texts.es:
Durante el recorrido a cierta comunidad veracruzana se pueden apreciar los sembradíos de caña de azúcar en donde la mayoría de los habitantes trabajan año con año. Los únicos medios que tienen para llegar es a pie, en  bicicleta, en motocicleta, en caballo o en burro pues el transporte público aún no tiene una ruta que llegue hasta su localidad. En dicha comunidad se formó un pequeño grupo que lleva por nombre Cocobongo  pues doña Tere, una de las integrantes, vende cocos y su hija a nombró así a su local de comida. Todos los miembros son: Rebeca quien se dedica a la cría de cerdos; Amelia, comida; Rosalba, servicio de fletes y cría de cerdos; Bety, artículos naturistas; María, jugos, fruta y zapatos por catálogo y Abigail, comida típica y artículos de bisutería.
   Doña María Teresa es muy querida y respetada por sus compañeras quienes de cariño la llaman Doña Tere. Es madre de 5 hijos los cuales son totalmente independientes y ha realizado muchas actividades pero lo que más le ha gustado es vender jugos y calzado por catálogo pues sus ganancias son favorables. 
    Tras 15 años de experiencia comenta “recuerdo cuando iniciamos, solíamos vender sobre una pequeña mesa de madera donde colocábamos el exprimidor manual de naranja, una cubeta con agua, una franela, jarras y vasos, todo con el objetivo de darle gusto a los clientes”. Desde entonces se levantaba muy temprano para atender a los primeros clientes quienes buscan la frescura del jugo de naranja. Las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, remodelar su casa, satisfacer sus necesidades e iniciar con la venta de calzado por catálogo aumentando así sus ingresos.
   El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de naranjas, cocos, picante en polvo, liquido, bolsas, popotes y calzado que le han solicitado sus clientes. Finalmente expresa  “soy feliz con mis actividades, me siento productiva y soy símbolo de admiración para mis hijos y nietos”.
*La fotografía fue tomada bajo la pequeña palapa donde colocan las mesas para sus clientes; Doña Tere es quien viste falda de mezclilla azul y está junto a su hija quien trae colocado un mandil azul.

loans.use: Comprara; naranjas, cocos, picante en polvo, liquido, bolsas, popotes y calzado

location.town: LOCALIDAD LA REFORMA, SAN MIGUEL SOYALTEPEC

loans.name: Fale

texts.en: Fale is married with two children who are attending school. With her husband she runs two businesses. The first business is a small store which is pictured. This is located at her parents in law house and has been going for 5 years. They also have a plantation which grows taro. Fale wants to open another store in another part of the village which will assist with achieving greater independence. She will get some assistance from relatives from overseas. The loan from SPBD will assist with buying staple goods such as sugar, salt, soap, noodles, sweets, flour and frozen goods

loans.use: Purchase goods for a new general store

loans.name: Maria Glenda

texts.en: My business is the sale of bread, rice, frijoles, sugar, etc. to my neighbors. I have been doing so for 2 years. With the income I bring in I help cover my family’s expenses, education and medications.

loans.use: Purchase of bread, churros, rice, frijoles, condiments, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Rohimas

texts.en: Rohimas has been married for 32 years and has 7 children, 4 daughters and 3 sons. Both she and her husband are doing business as fishermen. They continued from their old generation. They have been engaged in this business since 1979. Some of their children are also assisting them in fishing in the river. One of their daughters brings fish to sell in the market. She will use the given loan of $600 to purchase more fishing nets and one boat engine and spend some amount for repairing the fishing boat. She is capable of handling the loan and could repay it without any problem. The current loan term is 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing more fishing nets and one boat engine and for repairing the fishing boat

loans.name: Florentina Petrona

texts.en:
Florentina weaves blouses, skirts and tablecloths, which she sells to both middlemen and women in her village. She is 26 years old, is married and has one child. Her husband works as a chauffer.

She belongs to the co-op Fatima 7 and along with Magdalena Perez Hernandez and Guadalupe Jimenez Mendez, will invest the proceeds of this loan in additional yarn for their creations.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

FLORENTINA, SE DEDICA A BORDAR BLUSAS , FALDAS Y MANTELES POSTERIORMENTE LO VENDE A LOS MAYORISTAS Y TAMBIEN LO EXHIBE EN SU CASA PARA LAS MUJERES DE SU LOCALIDAD. ELLA TIENE 26 AÑOS , CASADA , 1 HIJO Y SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CHOFER. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO FATIMA 7 JUNTO CON DOÑA MAGDALENA PEREZ HERNANDEZ ( ARTESANA) Y DOÑA GUADALUPE JIMENEZ MENDEZ(ARTESANA).TODAS INVERTIRAN SU PRESTAMO EN LA COMPRA DE HILO PARA SUS BORDADOS.

loans.use: To purchase yarn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more plain coffins and the materials he needs to improve them.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a 23-year old woman who, 6 years ago, already had her own notions sales stall, a traD. that she learned and inherited from her loving and self-sacrificing mother, Lucía. She works offering her products for sale as a street vendor in the commercial area of her native city, Juliaca, from 8:00am until 7:00pm. This work requires great willpower, dedication and perseverance, always with the goal of prospering besiD. her loving family. The desire of this enterprising and exemplary young woman is to save enough money to one day begin selling electric devices wholesale. In order to realize her dreams, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of a greater quantity and variety of merchandise. Beatriz promises to repay the loan over a period of six months. Let’s help this enterprising young woman to achieve her objectives in the least time possible.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz, es una joven D. 23 años D. edad, hace 6 años ya poseía su puesto D. venta D. mercerías, oficio que aprendió y heredó D. su querida y abnegada madre, Lucia. ElL. se dedica a ofertar sus productos en forma ambulatoria en una zona comercial D. su ciudad natal, Juliaca, desD. las 8:00 D. L. mañana hasta las 7:00 D. L. noche, trabajo que desempeña con mucha voluntad, dedicación y perseverancia, siempre con el objetivo D. prosperar junto a su amorosa familia. El deseo D. esta emprendedora y ejemplar joven es ahorrar lo suficiente para más adelante dedicarse a L. comercialización D. artefactos eléctricos, al por mayor y para concretar sus sueños solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en L. compra D. mayor cantidad y variedad D. mercadería. Beatriz promete reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso D. seis meses. Apoyemos a esta emprendedora joven a lograr concretar en el menor tiempo posible sus objetivos.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Abilio

texts.pt:
Abílio C. is married and father of two daughters. He is 41 years old and a native to Inhambane. He lived with his parents until he was 8 years old when he moved to live with his paternal grandparents and finish elementary school. In 1983 he received a scholarship to Cuba where he made the middle level in general economics, and in 1991 he moved back to Mozambique. In 1994 he was hired by Mozambique Electric, a public company, as an administrative and financier where he works today.

Since he has a large family, a wife, 2 children, and his parents all depend on him, and he had to start a business producing cut chickens to increase his income. Currently he relies on a poultry farm with capacity of 1,500 chickens that he built appropriately. He employs 4 people including himself, his wife, and two other ladies that are in charge of the sales. With this loan he intends to continue the poultry business and increase the number of actual chickens to 1,000 from the current 500. After he pays back this loan he plans to borrow another one to continue the construction work on his family residence.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva volunteer

Abílio C., casado maritalmente e pai de duas filhas, 41 anos de idade, Natural de Inhambane, até aos oito anos vivia com os país e mais tarde passou a viver com avos paternos, onde conclui o ensino primario. Em 1983 obteve bolsa de estudos para Cuba, onde fez o nível médio em economia geral e em 1991 regressa a Moçambique. Em 1994 foi contratado pela electicidade de Mozambique – empresa publica, como administrativo e financeiro, onde trabalha até hoje.

Uma vez que tem uma familia numerosa, esposa, dois filhos e seus pais, todos dependem dele, teve que iniciar o negocio de producao de frangos de corte para aumento de rendimento. Actualmente conta com um aviario com capacidade de 1,500 frangos, construido com meios proprios e emprega 4 pessoas, incluindo ele proprio, esposa e outras duas senhoras que se encarregam das vendas. Com este emprestimo pretende dar continuidade com a actividade avicola e aumentar a quantidade dos actuias 500 para 1,000 pintos de engorde. Perspectivas, depois de concluir o emprestimo pretende outro para dar continuidade com as obras de construcao da residencia familiar.

loans.use: Buy Construction Materials

loans.name: Kiganda B Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for five months. Faith sells matooke in the market. Florence, Teopista and Christine all sell raw foods and want to use the loan to buy additional food to sell. Revecate owns a kiosk.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia is a mother who is dedicated to looking after her children. She is capable of sacrificing many things for them, and it is for this reason that she dedicates most of her time taking care of them. The best way that she found to do so was raising sheep and pigs in her own home. The place where they live has a peculiarity since both the rural and urban landscapes live together harmoniously. She has a humble home, but the harmony of a united family prevails there. Her husband is a deliveryman who provides services to a local market using an urban delivery tricycle. Many times, however, his earnings are not sufficient to cover the household expenses, which is why Amalia works so hard raising her livestock and selling them at an affordable price at the local cattle market. She and her husband are convinced that only a good education will bring personal development, since many times not having any skills renders getting a job more difficult. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan in order to increase her livestock by purchasing hens because she has seen a demand for them in the area. With your help, this humble family will soon be able to improve its quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Amalia, es una madre de familia muy dedicada a cuidar a sus hijos, ella es capaz de sacrificar muchas cosas por ellos y ésta es la razón por la que se dedica casi todo el tiempo a cuidarlos y vio la mejor manera de hacerlo criando carneros y cerdos en su propia casa. El lugar que habitan tiene una particularidad pues cohabitan armoniosamente el paisaje rural con el urbano, su morada es humilde pero reina la armonía de una familia unida en la que su esposo es un humilde triciclero que ofrece servicios de carga en el mercado; muchas veces los ingresos diarios no satisfacen las necesidades es por ese motivo que Amalia se esfuerza con la crianza de sus animales para que los pueda vender a buen precio en la feria ganadera de su zona. Así mismo ella y su esposo están convencidos de que sólo una buena educación será la que compense un buen desarrollo individual ya que muchas veces el no tener un oficio dificulta obtener un trabajo. Con ese propósito en mente solicita un préstamo para incrementar el número de sus animalitos comprando gallinas ya que ha observado la demanda local de esta ave.Con vuestra ayuda esta humilde familia pronto podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of hens

loans.name: Mery

texts.fr:
Mery T., age 32, was born in Blitta, a place located 200 km from Lomé.  She is married to Sadikou KPADJA, who is a spot welder and scrap metal merchant.  They have two children.  Her main business is the sale of pagnes (colorful print fabrics).  She is a traveling retailer going from house to house and district to district.  Each day, she covers a distance of 26 km on average.  She had started this business in 2004 selling only lower-quality pagnes.  Her first loan of 150,000 francs CFA enabled her to add another type of pagne, the HITARGET brand of intermediate quality.  After paying off her loan, she is again requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy 15 bolts of Hitarget pagnes.  

 Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame T. Mery, âgée de 32 ans est née à Blitta localité située à 200Km de Lomé. Elle est mariée à Monsieur KPADJA Sadikou qui est un Soudeur Ferrailleur. Ils ont deux enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de pagnes. Elle est une revendeuse ambulante et vend de maison en maison et de quartier en quartier. Elle parcourt journalièrement une distance moyenne de 26 km. Elle avait commencé cette activité en 2004 uniquement avec la vente de pagne de qualité inférieure. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 150.000 FCFA lui a permis d’ajouter un autre type de pagne de marque HITARGET de qualité intermédiaire. 
Après remboursement de ce crédit, elle sollicite encore un emprunt d’un montant  de 150.000 CFCFA pour acheter quinze pièces de pagne Hitarget.

loans.use: To grow her stock of traditional fabrics

loans.name: Lina's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Lina is 26 years old and is a single woman. Lina owns a small food store and she also sells clothes. She works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $220 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to increase her stock of food and clothes to sell. She will share this loan with Tausi, who has a business as a food vendor.

loans.use: To buy more food and clothing inventory.

loans.name: Oiniso

texts.en:
I. Oiniso is 43 years old and married with four children. Her husband is an entrepreneur, and they are raising their children with love and trying to ensure they have everything that teenagers may need. For 10 years in Tajikistan’s local markets, Oiniso has been selling fabrics for the national dresses which are very popular and very important items in the dowry of any girl.  Being very polite with the clients and having good taste, she has many customers. All fabrics are supplied from the neighboring city of Dushanbe. 
In order to better satisfy her customers’ varied requirements, Oiniso is trying to increase her range of goods. Therefore she requests a $200 loan to purchase a new stock of fabrics. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months, and your support will really help her.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Denisa

texts.en: Denisa is a young woman living outside the town of Gračanica.  She is 28 years old and single.  To support herself, she currently works in a restaurant, making pies known as burek, a common food in Bosnia & Herzegovina.  She earns about 350KM (approximately $440 USD) a month, which is her main source of income.  She has requested her first loan in the amount of 600 KM, and she will use this money to buy food for her cow.  She hopes that this investment will be profitable, and for the future plans to spend more time working on her small farm.

loans.use: To buy food for her cow.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline is 20 years old and dedicates herself to selling clothes. When she started this job it was like a hobby for her, but now that she is growing and maturing, she has realized that this is a job which has brought her a lot of money, and which has taught her the value of work. She knows that with her young age, she can work even harder to become a prosperous businesswoman in the near future. With the help of some relatives who live in the capital city of Lima, Jackeline continues to acquire very high quality items in all styles and for all ages. Thank God she has the unconditional support of her parents, who encourage her every day to continue with her business for them and for her future. Jacklen has decided to ask you for the amount of money she is asking to borrow, so that she can rent a small place to sell her goods, also allowing her to get more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Jackeline tiene 20 años, y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cuando ella inició este oficio era como un pasatiempo para ella, pero ahora que va creciendo y madurando se ha dado cuenta que es un negocia que la ha traído muchas ganancias y le ha enseñado el valor del trabajo, sabe que con su juventud puede esforzarse aún más para ser una próspera empresaria en un futuro cercano.Con la ayuda de unos familiares que viven en Lima, la capital, Jackeline consigue adquirir prendas de muy buena calidad y de variados modelos para todas las edades. Gracias a Dios, ella cuanta con el apoyo incondicional de sus padres, quienes le incentivan a seguir con su trabajo cada día, por ellos y por su futuro, Jackeline decidió recurrir a ustedes para que tengan a bien proporcionarle la cantidad de dinero que pide, en préstamo, para alquilar un pequeño local donde vender sus prendas y así poder adquirir mayor mercadería.

loans.use: Renting a place to sell her clothes.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio Cesar is 22 and was born in Juliaca. He is unmarried and lives with his grandparents and his aunt. He is a very lively and energetic young man. He has always lived in his hometown of Juliaca, where he grew up and went to school. He used to work at his sister's grocery store, but two years ago he decided to start his own business in order to pay for his studies. With his family's help, he set up public internet booths in his house. He runs the internet cafe in the afternoon. The best part about Julio Cesar's job is that it allows him to continue studying for a degree in civil engineering at the Juliaca city university, while at the same time earn money to cover the cost of school. He likes to use the Internet to look up information or surf the Web. The hardest part of the job is keeping the computers in good working order, since there are often problems with them. Julio Cesar works hard every day to shape a better future for himself. He plans to use the loan money to invest in the purchase of another computer. This will allow him to increase his number of customers and to start another business in the future, such as a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Julio César tiene 22 años, es juliaqueño de nacimiento, no es casado y vive en la casa de sus abuelos y tía. Es un joven vivaz y muy enérgico, siempre ha vivido en su ciudad natal Juliaca, donde creció y estudió, su hermana posee una tienda de abarrotes, en la cual trabajó, pero desde hace dos años decidió emprender su propio negocio para solventar los gastos de sus estudios.Con la ayuda de su familia, instaló unas cabinas de Internet en su casa, las cuales administra y atiende por las tardes.Lo bueno del trabajo de Julio César es que le permite estudiar su carrera de Ingeniería Civil en la Universidad de la ciudad de Juliaca y al mismo tiempo ganar dinero para solventar los gastos que ameritan sus estudios, le gusta aprovechar el Internet para buscar información y distraerse navegando, lo más difícil es tener que mantener las máquinas en buen funcionamiento ya que siempre se presenta algún desperfecto. Julio César se esfuerza día a día para forjarse un mejor futuro. El dinero del préstamo será invertido en comprar una computadora más y así aumentar la clientela, y en un futuro poner otro negocio, como una ferretería.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional computer for his public internet booths.

loans.name: Llinith

texts.es:
La señora Llinith, socia del Banco Comunal “ Judith Tuanama”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín, provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Sinchi Roca Nº 111. Los clientes son  sus amigos, familiares y vecinos de su barrio. Los productos de belleza lo trabaja en base a pedidos por catálogos. 
 
Con este crédito de S/. 1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará productos para surtir más el negocio como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche en cajas, detergente, conservas, aceite, entre otros, también comprará repuestos para su carro el cual es una herramienta indispensable de trabajo de su esposo ya que brinda servicio de transporte interurbano.
