Tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, quienes todavía dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es tener una tienda bien surtida en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad, otra de sus metas también es ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Llinith belongs to the Comunal Bank “Judith Tuanama”. She lives in the area of Saint Martin in the province of El Dorado district of San Jose de Sisa. She is dedicated to the sale of non perishables and beauty products. The business is run out of her home in the Jr. Sinchi Roca N 111. Her clients are friends, family, and neighbors of her neighborhood. The beauty products she sells come through the orders she makes through a catalog. With this credit of 1,500 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy products grow her business such as rice, sugar, milk, detergent, canned goods, oil, and more. Also she will buy spare parts for her husband’s car which is necessary to perform his work of intercity transportation. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children who still depend on her. It has always been emphasized that she is a dedicated woman, hard worker, and great organizer. Her goal is to have a store in a strategic location in the city. Also, she wants to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, oil, non perishables, etc.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Jose Manuel Roberto

texts.es:
José Manuel hace diez años es ganadero, inició su negocio ante la falta de capital para seguir con el ganado fue entonces que lo invitaron a asociarse en una carnicería hace 2 años y el acepto, pero ahora como le ha ido bien desea independizarse y establecer su propio negocio.

El necesita un préstamo por US $825 que pagara en 6 meses para acondicionar el local donde se independizara y comprar una sierra para cortar carne. Con tu apoyo lograra su meta.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel was involved with cattle raising for 10 years. Later, he decided to try another way of business since the income generated with cattle raising was not enough. That led him to accept an invitation, 2 years ago, to join a friend at a butcher shop. Nowadays, however, he has seen that the butcher shop has done well and decided to go on his own by establishing a shop for himself. He needs US $825 that will be paid back in 6 months. It will be used to provide a cooling system for the shop and to purchase an electric knife to chop up the meat.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cooling system and an electric knife.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. is 52 years old, married and mother of five children, who are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling food products like maize, bags of millet, beans, groundnuts and gari to her loyal customers in the neighborhood. She says that selling these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family. 

A. is a member of the group called Wadala (Enjoyment) Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee social collateral for each other and to assist one another with the loan repayments. Her picture was taken during their group visit.

loans.use: To increase inventory of maize, millet, groundnuts, gari and beans.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras” está actualmente en su 1º ciclo se formó gracias a la invitación de otras emprendedoras que ya están trabajando en sus respectivos grupos.
Estas mujeres poseen una actividad comercial diferente cada una, con lo que logran generar ingresos principalmente para el sustento de sus familias.
Estas mujeres y sus respectivas actividades son:
 Andresa C.	Artesanía
Julia Elena M. M.	Despensa
Agustina L. C.	Vta de ensalada de frutas
F. Patricia B. R.	Vta de cosméticos
Herminia B. R.	Vta de artesanias
Maria Carolina B. R.	Vta de artesania
Veronica Liliana G. B.  	Vta de bijouterie
Luz Marina B. R. 	Vta de artesania
Jorgelina M. P.	Vta de comestibles
Analia Roxana B.	Vta de merceria
Nery R. B.	Vta de Chipas
Gladys Martina P. de Zárate	Vta de comestibles
Rosa Maria P. C.	Vta de ropas
Marciana B. de Ramos	Vta de chipas
Maria Valeria U. de Campos	Fabricación y venta de productos de limpieza

Todas ellas retiran un pequeño monto del préstamo total para poder invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías, materias primas y/o materiales necesarios para sus respectivas actividades por ejemplo: compra de frutas, verduras, azúcar, huevos, aceite, carne y especias para aquellas que se dedican a la elaboración y venta de comestibles, así como también gaseosas, jugos, lácteos y agua mineral. Compra de hojas secas de palmas para elaborar artesanías, barro, compra de químicos para la elaboración de productos de limpieza y de detergentes. Compra de ropas para damas y caballeros, calzados, etc.
texts.en:
The "Women Fighters" committee is in it's 1st cycle and was started thanks to invitations by women who were already participating in other groups. Each of these women has a different business from which she earns an income, this income is mainly for the maintenance of the family.

The group comprises the following women: Andresa C., handicrafts Julia Elena M. M., grocery outlet Agustina L. C., fruit salad sales F. Patricia B. R., cosmetic sales Herminia B. R., artwork sales Maria Carolina B. R., handiwork sales Veronica Liliana G. B., jewelry sales Luz Marina B. R., handicraft sales Jorgelina M. P., food sales Analia Roxana B., grocery sales Nery R. B., bread sales Gladys Martina P. de Zárate, food sales Rosa Maria P. C., clothing sales Marciana B. de Ramos, bread sales Maria Valeria U. de Campos, Manufacture and sales of cleaning products.

Each of these women will receive a small part of the loan to invest in merchandise, basic materials and/or materials necessary for her respective business. For those who are in the manufacture and sales of food, it's to buy fruit, vegetables, sugar, eggs, oil, meat and spices, as well as, soda, juices, dairy and mineral water. For those who make and sell crafts and handicrafts, it will be invested in palm leaves and mud. For those who manufacture and sell cleaning products and detergent, it will be invested in chemicals. And for those who sell clothing, it will be to buy clothing for men and women, shoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, meat, dairy, soda, handicrafts, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana se dedica a la venta de chamarras de cuero y carteras. Su esposo es albañil contratista y tiene cuatro hijos.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en alquiler ya que no cuenta con una vivienda propia.
Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la cuarta  vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia Mercadería. (chamarras, carteras, bolsones)
Su antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Julian sells leather jackets and wallets. Her husband is a contracted bricklayer and they have 4 children. He home is located in the de Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz. She lives in a rental since she does not own her own home. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan with Impro, and the fourth time she has required help from Kiva. Her credit history qualifies her as a top client, which is to say that she has an excellent repayment history of her loans. The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise materials. (Jackets, wallets, bags). Her previous loan allowed her to continue to this loan since she now has work experience.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Miriams Ildilcia C. O.: la actividad de ella es el comercio, tiene 25 años de tener una pulperia la cul opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia "Los Gemelos"ubicada en el Barrio San Jose de esta comunidad, a la vez vende ropa y calzado, con los ingresos que genera la pulperia brinda los estudios a sus hijos.
Petrona del Carmen L.: se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, actividad que realiza desde hace 25 años, una de las hijas que vive con ella junto a otras empleadas la ayudan a elaborar el producto, con los ingresos que le genera cubre un 100% los gastos personales y compromisos financieros, el sueño de ella es tener una fabrica con mas produccion y generar empleos en mi comunidad.
Alba danelia A.: se dedica a la venta de golosinas y enseres del hogar, actividad que realiza hace 3 años, los clientes potenciales son los de la comunidad donde ella vive, su negocio les genera  ingresos con los que han podido brindar la educacion a sus hijos y cubrir los gastos familiares.
Reina Maritza V.: se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y la elaboracion y venta de ropa de cama y ropa americana, actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año junto con su esposo han proceado 4 hijos de los cuales 2 cursan la secundaria y una la universidad, con los ingresos que genera el negocio contribuye con los gastos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Miriams Ildilcia C. O.: her activity is a merchant; she has had a grocery store for 25 years, operating under the name of "Los Gemelos", located in the San Jose neighborhood in this community. At the same time, she sells clothing and shoes; with the income that she earns she is able to provide for the education of her children. Petrona del Carmen L.: She works making and selling doughnuts, an activity that she has done for 25 years. One of her daughters, that lives with her, along with other employees, help her make the product; with the earnings that she generates she is able to cover all of her expenses and financial commitments. Her dream is to have a factory with a larger production and the ability to create jobs in the community. Alba danelia A.: She works selling sweets and household items, an activity that she had performed for more than 3 years. The best clients are those in the community in which she lives. Her business generates income with which she has been able to provide for the education of her children and cover the household expenses. Reina Maritza V.: She works selling cosmetics as well as making and selling bed linens and American clothing, an activity that she has done for more than a year along with her husband. They have 4 children, of which 2 are in secondary school and one in university. The income that the business earns is used for her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es:
La señora Cadith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en prolongación Grau Nº 160, distrito y provincia de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 1 es mayor de edad y 2 aun dependen de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja se dedica a la venta de madera. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en golosinas, para venderlos en su casa. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega y cabinas de Internet, esto le permite un ingreso diario, con lo que paga las cuotas mensuales del banco puntualmente.

Con este prestamo de S/ 3,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara papel higiénico en paquetes, arroz, azúcar en sacos, algunas verduras, y además con una parte pagara el mantenimiento de las maquinas del Internet. 

Cadith, esta muy agradecida con el banco comunal por el apoyo que recibe ya que esto le permite crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Cadith belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva. She lives in the neighborhood of Grau Nº 160, in the province of Juanjui, and the department of San Martin. She is 39 years old and is a mother of 3 children. One of children is of legal age, and two still depend on her. Her spouse works selling wood. With the first loan she recieved of $300, she decided to invest in delicacies, which she sold from her house. She has been working with the bank for seven years. With this loan of 3000 nuevos soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy toilet paper in packages, rice, sugar in bags, some vegetables, and additionally a part will pay the maintenance for her computers. At the present she depends on a small grocery store and Internet cafe for her daily income, with which she repays her loan payments promptly. Cadith is very thankful for the communal bank for the support that she receives and that has permitted her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toilet paper in packets, rice, suger in sacks, various vegetables, and pay for the maintenance of her Internet cafe.

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en: Arvin D. lives in Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 30 years old, and married with one child.His business started when balut (duck eggs) was in demand in their village. Arvin, together with his wife, work hand in hand to supply the needs of the family. At present, he is a balut distributor at Catarman, one of the most populated municipalities in Camiguin Province. Alvin wants to expand his business and be able to cater to the 5 municipalities of Camiguin Province. He joined HSPFI and was able to get his first loan, and now Alvin needs additional capital amounting to PHP 8,000, to purchase more trays of balut.

loans.use: To purchase more trays of balut.

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en: Tagi L., 36, is married with 3 children.  She has 3 years of experience selling clothing to the general public. Her business is open 7 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with South Pacific Business Development (SPBD). She will use her loan to purchase poplins, paints, elei design boards, rollers, ie lavalava materials, and paint brushes. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 WST (~ $335 US).  SPBD loans are Tagi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Materials needed to make clothing

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El señor Vicente y su esposa la señora Norma Alicia son comerciantes desde hace 3 años y sus ingresos se adquieren através de la venta de muebles usados para el hogar pero en excelentes condiciones; ellos cuentan ya con una cartera de clientes pero también van a distintas partes de las cercanías de nuestra ciudad. 
Son una familia estable y trabajadora que día a día luchan ya que buscan la manera de salir adelante. 
En estos momentos el señor Vicente está tramitando el crédito para invertir en la compra de más mercancía y asi incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vicente and his wife, Norma Alicia, have been merchants for three years and make their income by selling used home furniture in excellent condition. They already have a customer base but also go to outlying suburbs of their city.

They are a stable, working family, fighting day after day to find a way to get ahead.

Today, Vicente is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise in order to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment (Used furniture sales)

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра Чаборова проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 38 лет. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Зухра имеет собственный магазин. Она продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности она занимается более 5 лет. Ей в этом помогают ее дети. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить товараоборот. На полученный доход хочет  оплатить за обучение сына, т.к. ему в этом году надо пступать в университет.
texts.en:
Zuhra J. live in the Varzoba region of Tajikistan. She is 38 years old, divorced and has 2 children. Zuhra owns a small store where she has been selling groceries for the last 5 years. Her children help her with this business. Zuhra would like to take out this loan to expand her store and offer more goods for sale. She wants to use the extra revenue to pay for the education of her son, since in the next year he is entering college.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pruchase of fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Demetrio Caledonio

texts.es: El señor Demetrio Celedonio O. C., tiene la edad de 53 años, habita  en el barrio la Borgoña, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tiene nueve hijos , el de 27 , 25 ,23, trabajan y le poyan , los de 22,18,17,14,11y 8 años estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 15 años , don Demetrio trabaja en la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, el inicio esta actividad por esfuerzos propios . Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para tener mejor producción y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Demetrio Celedonio O. C., 53, lives in the Borgoña neighborhood, which is located in the Ticuantepe municipality. He lives with his wife; she helps him with household activities. They have nine children. The children who are 27, 25, and 23 work and help him. The children who are 22, 18, 17, 14, 11, and 8 currently go to school. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. Demetrio has been farming for 15 years. The biggest difficulty he has is lack of financing. He started this business through his own efforts. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to increase production and sell for a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to increase production

loans.name: Nelvis Tomas

texts.es: Nelvis Tomás está solicitando su 3er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar mejora de su habitación, como es el repello de las paredes de la casa,  trabaja en la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce, trabaja como docente desde hace 9 años, es un hombre trabajador, honesto de buenas costumbres, su esposa trabaja como docente en la misma colonia, ambos se apoyan en los gastos del  hogar, a pesar que son una pareja jovenes han  luchado para tener su propia vivienda, el se siente agradecido con AFODENIC ya que por medio de los creditos obtenidos lograron obtener su propia vivienda ubicada en la colonia Naciones, es un joven que tiene espitud de superación, actualmente estudia su tercer año de la universidad, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral salud  y una vivienda  bonita para cuando llegue su primer hijo.
texts.en:
Nelvis Tomas is applying for his third loan from AFODENIC so that he can make home improvements such as repairing cracks in the walls of his house. He has worked as a teacher at the Francisco Aaron Joce school for 9 years. He's a hard-working man, modest and polite. His wife works as a teacher in the same neighborhood and they share household expenses. Despite being a young couple, they have fought to get their own house. Nelvis Tomas is grateful to AFODENIC because he has managed to get the house in the Naciones neighborhood with the loans he's received. He is a young man with the drive to get ahead and he is now in his third year at the university. His dream is to have a stable job, health and a beautiful home for whenever his first child comes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair walls of house.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Малике 40 лет. Она замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она опытная портниха. Клиенты приходят к ней домой заказывать разные национальные платья. Она шьет платья на заказ, кроме того она со своими ученицами шьют национальные платья для реализации на рынках Панчшанбе и Якшанбе. Малика закупает ткань на рынках Сомон и Атуш. Там очень большой ассортимент тканей и низкая цена. В осенний сезон Малика планирует шить платья из теплой велюровой ткани. Для этого она должна закупить большую партию этой ткани и поэтому она запрашивает этот займ.
texts.en:
Malika is 40 years old. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. She is an experienced seamstress. Her customers come to her home to place orders for various traditional dresses. Malika makes dresses to-order and also makes traditional dresses with her apprentices for sale at the Panchshanbe and Yakshanbe markets. Malika buys the fabric at the Somon and Atush markets because they have a wide selection of fabrics and low prices there. During the autumn season, Malika plans to sew dresses from warm velour fabric. She needs to purchase a large stock of this fabric for this purpose, and this is why she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of velour fabric

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora Saturnina Cabrieles es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad dos hijas a las cuales quiere darle lo mejor. 
Sus niñas ya van a entrar a estudiar la secundaria, pero tiene un problema que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la inscripción y comprar le los uniformes.
Es por eso que solicita un crédito y así poder darles es estudio a sus hijas.
Doña Saturnina trabaja como maestra de ciencias y química en una escuela particular eso son los ingresos que genera pasa sus hijas y con el cual una parte será para el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Saturnina Cabrieles is a single mother. She is responsible for her two daughters, for whom she wants to provide the best.

Her daughters are about to start high school, but she is experiencing difficulties at the moment because she lacks the necessary funds to pay for their registration and school uniforms.

She is requesting a loan so that she can give her daughters a chance to study. Doña Saturnina teaches science and chemistry at a private school. Her income goes to support her daughters, but a portion will be set aside to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughters' school uniforms & registration fees

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine N. is a 40-year-old married lady with four children, with the eldest being 18 years old and in secondary school. She also helps to take care of two orphans who are also in school. 

Christine has had a butcher shop in Kisowera trading centre for five years and she is able to make 100,000UGX in profit a week. She employs a man to help her with the cutting of the meat in pieces for sale, although at times, she does the work herself. 

She has a plan to buy a plot and build her own house so that she can stop renting and save that for future developments. Christine needs a loan to help buy more meat for her butcher shop so that she could make more profit. She is such a friendly and easy-to-approach lady, and this keeps her going.

loans.use: Buying more meat for resale in the butcher shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old, and married to Santos, who is a laborer. They are blessed with two children who both study in elementary school. Susan's dream is that they will be able to afford to educate their children to college level. As Susan says, “If there’s a will, there’s a way”, and she will do her very best for her children's future.

Susan has a store where she sells a number of different items. She has been in business for three years and is still hoping to develop her business further. In order to make progress, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. This will be of great help in making her plans a reality.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Sebi

texts.en:
Sebi E. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase bedsheets to sell.  Sebi is 38 years old and is Married with a husband that is a nurse. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana B. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children.

Ana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khlok

texts.en: Khlok S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $3 per day. Her husband (he appears in the photo) earns a living as an ox trader. He always goes to buy oxen in the rural areas from farmers and re-sells those oxen to gain income. This couple has been married for years and has three children. Two of the children are married and one is a teenager attending school. Khlok S. sees that her husband’s business is profitable and she hopes to sustain it by accumulating a larger quantity of oxen using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of oxen

loans.name: Gerlee

texts.en:
Gerlee N. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife works as a cook and his two sons, ages 11 and 7, both attend a local secondary school.

Gerlee operates a transportation service in his town. He uses his motorcycle as a taxi to transport people around the local area. Gerlee started his business in 2005 with capital of 20,000 tugrugs. Over the last four years, he has managed to grow his business into a stable operation. Today, his working capital exceeds 300,000 tugrugs. He has many plans for the future and says, "I hope to save enough money to help my wife open a cafe." He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase machinery parts for his motorcycle. 

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Sokleak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokleak C. has been a textile designer since she was 18 years old – a skill she learned from her mother. She designs patterns for silk fabric. In addition to this business, she also buys finished silk fabrics from the weavers in the village and transports them to sell at other districts far away from her home. Sokleak does not have enough capital to purchase finished silk fabric for resale. That’s why she is applying for her first loan of $500 US in order to increase her capital.

Sokleak (shown in the photo), 29, and her husband, Mr. Poli Pich, 27, were married in 1998 and just have one daughter who attends school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Phnom Penh is the capital city of Cambodia. Her husband is a soldier.

loans.use: To purchase finished silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Fatima, like many other women in the community, works to support her husband to provide for the family. For the past 10 years, she has been working as a food vendor, preparing and selling yam and rice with stew, and hawking to sell in the mornings. To prepare her dishes, Fatima buys bags of rice from nearby communities. Currently, she needs a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of rice

loans.name: Alba Agustina

texts.es: Alba tiene 40 años, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio que nace con la enseñanza  quien inicio este negocio y decidió hincar su propia actividad económica en su vivienda por lo que juntos emprendieron este medio de vida, ya que le instruyo a su esposa para que le ayudara a pintar y realizara la elaboración de los diseños, por lo que han trabajado juntos para aportar en lo necesario en su familia es así que su esposa se encarga de empezar a ofrecer sus productos en su humilde vivienda y también venderlos de manera ambulante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de yeso, pintura, ciner, brochas, pinceles entre otros productos que son necesarios para la elaboración de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Alba is 40 years old, and dedicated to selling artisan crafts. She has done this for more than 18 years. Alba began soon after learning the skill, and began this economic activity in her own home. Alba and her husband made a living together in this manner, after she taught him to help her paint and elaborate the designs. They have worked together to achieve what's necessary for their family. She is in charge of selling the products, both in their humble home and on the streets. The financing she solicits is to buy plaster, paint, ash, and artist's and painter's brushes, among other products, which are necessary for the elaboration of the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS TO MAKE ARTISAN CRAFTS TO SELL

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth V. is from the village of San Vicente in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, candies, soap (bath and laundry), and toothpaste in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Lilibeth's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-at, 38, has been a silk weaver since he was 25 years old. Sam-at sells his finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. His wife has been selling groceries for one year. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale in her village.

Sam-at is asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 US to provide capital for his wife to purchase additional grocery items for resale. 

Sam-at and his wife, Mrs. Sony Siem, 36, have been married since 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of the children are in school. They live in the Muk Kampoul district of Koh Dach, a famous island located 30 kilometers along the Mekong River, roughly 15 kilometers northeast of Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To provide capital for his wife to purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional comodities for her shop.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn G., 55, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Angelito G., a violin maker, and they are blessed with a child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own string-instrument shop for the last sixteen years.

Evelyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow thirteen times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her instrument-making business.

Now, with your help, Evelyn would like to obtain a PHP 26,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying equipment and raw materials needed to continue production of their violins and guitars.

Evelyn dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can continue to provide for her child’s education. She also wants to continue helping other people like herself.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment and raw materials needed to continue production of their violins and guitars

loans.name: Magda Simona

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente trabaja como secretaria del colegio del Jicarito, es originaria de la misma comunidad ella habita de la iglesia católica 600 vrs al este
Además de la actividad laboral se dedica a crianza de cerdos para tener ingresos que apoye el núcleo familiar
A logrado venir preparando académicamente a su hija y también ella está estudiando para obtener un título como profesora
texts.en:
This client works as a secretary at the Jicarito School. She is from the same community. She lives 600 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) east of the Catholic Church. In addition to her secretarial work, she also raises pigs in order to have earnings to help her family. She has been academically preparing her daughter, and she is also studying to get a teacher’s degree.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University expenses, daughter's transportation, buy booklets

loans.name: Baatarhuu

texts.en:
Baatarhuu is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest two daughters, ages 12 and 10, attend a local secondary school. They have been living together in their current home for five years. 

Baatarhuu operates a grocery store business in his town. He built his grocery store in August, 2009, in his yard and started operating his business in the same year. Baatarhuu has been successfully operating his business, and the business has been stabilizing. He has been planning to expand his grocery store into a supermarket in the future. 

Baatarhuu is a hardworking person. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more inventory for his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: A 45 ans cette dame reste une dame très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de  charbons de bois . le stock de charbons de bois est épuisé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des sacs charbons de bois. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
At 45 years of age, this lady is quite dynamic. Her revenue-generating activity is selling charcoal. Her stock is at present depleted, and she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy sacks of charcoal. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Jiguisseme est constitué 4  femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et habitant à Kafela  un des villages de la préfecture de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur treizième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles  divers tels  le  charbon de bois avec Mariam  Dembélé,  la bouillie,  les fruits et légumes etc.
Mariam Dembélé compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25  sacs de charbon de bois.
Elle s’approvisionne dans le dit village et dans les villages  voisins.
Elle revend aux passants au bord du goudron et  à Sikasso ville les jours de foires hebdomadaires, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille (scolarité des enfants et mariages) et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
This Jiguisseme group is made up of four married women with an average age of 44 and 4 children on average, who all live in Kafela, a village in the prefecture of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They are on their 13th collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying the needs of their clientele. This group of women sell various items such as charcoal, in the case of Mariam Dembélé, and also porridge, fruit and vegetables, etc. Mariam Dembélé intends to use her loan to buy 25 sacks of charcoal. She buys the charcoal in her village and in surrounding villages and sells it to passersby along the paved road and in the town of Sikasso on weekly marketdays, to a clientele composed of women and men for cash. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family expenses (school fees and wedding expenses) and the rest will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying charcoal for resale

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz O. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 52 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Beatriz owns and operates a business providing recycling services, hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to haul materials. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Teresita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ginafe

texts.en: Ginafe D. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Ginafe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried fish and frozen hot-dogs and also selling cooked hot-dogs and other specialty foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Ginafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ginafe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita S. is from the village of Minante 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Lolita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Las Animadoras Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Las Animadoras viven en la aldea Corinto, esta formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican al comercio. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Petrona V. C. tiene 43 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos a cargo, 
se dedica a la venta de pescado y platanos junto con su esposo en su carro .
este negocio lo realiza por mas de dos años,  salen a vender de casa en casa y a veces viajan a Tegucigalpa a vender pescado y camarones, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de camaron, pescado y platanos.
ya que desea trabajar con mas producto para asi tener mas utilidades.
 
la sra. Juana R. A. tiene 53 años de edad, es una mujer viuda ya que su esposo murio.
Juana se ha dedicado a su familia, los educo y ya se casaron vive solo con un hijo menor, Juana tiene su propia casa que es de adobe con repello y se ha dedicado al negocio durante varios años, vende refrescos, abarroteria, pollo, granos basicos, y tambien vende golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas y tajaditas que son las golosinas tipicas de la region, el credito lo utilizara para compra de maiz, maisillo y abarroteria en general,  su mayor deseo es que sus ventas se mejoren.
 
la sra. Ingrid Johana R. tiene 30 años de edad, tiene un hijo que esta en el kinder, vive con su 
esposo en su casa, que es pequeña y nos comentaba que la ha hecho con gran esfuerzo y
sacrificio.
Ingrid se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas desde hace 4 años, Ingrid le vende a los alumnos de la escuela ya que su casa se encuentra enfrente de la escuela, ademas vende desayunos a los maestros que imparten  clases en la escuela, el credito lo utilizara para compra de productos que necesita para la elaboracion de las golosinas.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Las Animadoras (The Cheerleaders) live in the village Corinth, consists of three working women who are engaged in commerce. Below are details of the different activities they perform: Mrs. Petrona V. C. is 43 years old, married and has four dependent children. She works with her husband selling fish and bananas their car. They have been working at this business for more than two years. They go from house to house to sell, and sometimes travel to Tegucigalpa to sell fish and shrimp. The loan is to be used for the purchase of shrimp, fish and bananas. Their goal is to work with more products, to have more profits. Mrs. Juana A. R. is 53 years old, a widow since her husband died. Juana has dedicated herself to her family. She educated them and now they are married. She lives alone with one child. Juana has her own house, which is adobe with plaster and has been engaged for several years in the business selling soft drinks, groceries, chicken, grains, and staples. She also sells snacks such as tacos, enchiladas and sliced candy that are typical of the region. The loan is for purchase of corn, maisillo and general groceries. Her greatest wish is that her sales would be better. Mrs. Ingrid Johana R. is 30 years old, has a son who is in kindergarten and lives with her husband in his house, which is small and has told us that she has made a great effort and sacrifice. Ingrid works making and selling candy, since four years ago. Ingrid sells to students at the school because her house is opposite the school. She also sells breakfast to the teachers who teach at the school. The loan will be to buy products she need in the manufacture of candy.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish, platains, corn, rice, sugar, salt, tortillas, soaps, pastas, toilet paper, butter, oil, pork, beef, chicken and shrimp.

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khen S., 43 years old, is the village bank president having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Boeng KrU. Leu village, Kandal province. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve their family living.

Mrs. Khen S. is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Ros U., is a motorbike taxi driver. With these businesses they provide a small income to support their family. In order to support her pig breeding business, Mrs. Khen S. will use the loan to build more pigpens for raising pigs.

This couple has three children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To build more pigpens for raising pigs

loans.name: Leydis Maria

texts.es:
La señora Leydis Maria tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Su negocio está ubicado de manera ambulante por lo que así tiene más facilidad de obtener clientes. El crecimiento de su negocio es notable gracias a la buena administración, la excelente atención a los clientes. 
Es una joven que ha demostrado que tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante pues siempre ha trabajado desde muy joven su Mama le enseño a ganarse la vida. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercadería y así surtir más su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Leydis Maria has sold general merchandise for 2 years. Her business is in a street market because this is the easiest way to obtain customers. Her business' growth is outstanding thanks to her good administration and excellent customer service. She is a young woman who has demonstrated the desire to succeed. She has always worked; from a very young age, her mother taught her to make a living. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to better stock her business. She needs her earnings to cover her household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Velima

texts.en:
Velima is 32 years old and married with a 7-year-old child.  For ten years, she has been selling second-hand clothes in Korogocho slums in Nairobi East.  She was previously employed before she went into business for herself.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to afford to buy bales of clothes. She hopes to expand her business so as to earn more income in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy bales of clothes. She describes herself as a hardworking and focused lady.

loans.use: To buy buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Mkwalia Group

texts.en:
Shukuru Ally, in his early thirties, is married and has two children. Three years ago, Shukuru started a food shop which he operates from 6:30 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily, earning him a stable monthly profit.

This will be Shukuru's second Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Shukuru's previous loan, which he has since repaid, was used to increase his business capital. He plans to use this loan to begin selling fruits and vegetables in his shop.

Shukuru will share this loan with his loan group Mkwalia, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Shukuru is on the far left.

loans.use: To begin selling fruits and vegetables in his shop

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are medical bills.

She has operated a medical clinic, administering to her community members and passersby. Everlyne faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another medical clinic in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase medicine and admission beds for in-patients. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for her clinic and admission beds for in-patients.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is treasurer of a group of small businesspeople called the Rise Group, which is funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya, where she has worked as a farmer for the last seven years. She grows maize, beans, vegetables, tea and milk, all of which she sells locally. She depends on the income from her farm to meet the needs of her family.

She has applied for a loan for 45,000 KES through Juhudi to buy and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and improve her family's living standards. Her main challenges have been lack of ready markets for her products, and various pests and diseases which limit her production. In the future, she would like to expand her farm and increase the number of her cows she owns   to at least four.

Jackline is married and blessed with four children. Two of her children are currently in school.

loans.use: To buy and insure a cow.

loans.name: Handaa

texts.en:
Handaa G. is 59 years old and lives in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has a liver disorder and always receives treatment at the hospital. 

Handaa operates a tailoring business out of her home. She started her business in 2007 and has since built a stable operation. She makes tailored clothes according to her customers' requests. In the future, she plans to enlarge her business in order to increase her income and pay for her husband's treatment. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials and fabrics to make clothes for the upcoming Mongolian New Year holiday in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and fabrics

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Mr. Thea B. (pictured with his daughter) is 42 years old and his wife, Mrs. Mouly Kong, is 39 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers and the other is still young.

Thea is a construction worker. His wife is a chef. He is asking for his first loan of $700. He will use $500 to purchase a motorcycle for his children to get work and another $200 to build a restroom for the family’s use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and build a restroom

loans.name: Mujeres En Esperanza 3, 4 Group

texts.en:
Josefina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Esperanza (Women in Hope).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Josefina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bed clothes and pots by purchasing a few dozens of each. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing shoes, clothes, etc. Her long-term goal is to save enough money to purchase a home. She wants to be a successful business woman. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy bed clothes and pots

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob M. is 29 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 4 months and 6. He has been practicing mixed farming for five years in Kisii town, western Kenya. He sells his products to the local market. His biggest challenges have been low market prices for his products and poor weather conditions, which affect his production.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will help him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He hopes to expand his farming in the future and buy a vehicle to help in the transportation of his farm products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha; ella tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene dos negocios uno de ellos es un bar que está abierto a partir de las 05:00pm hasta las 02:00am bueno el horario es relativo ya que se puede abrir más tarde o cerrar más temprano depende de la clientela, su esposo es quien se queda en el bar y la socia lo administra ,a la vez la socia tiene su depósito de cerveza que está ubicado cerca al bar , estos dos negocios son su único ingreso de la socia y mediante esto ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más cerveza para su depósito y para implementar más su bar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Sumac Soncco” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Bertha; she is 52 years old, married and has 2 children. The member has two businesses. One of them is a bar that is open from 5:00 p.m. until 2:00 a.m. although the hours change by opening later or closing earlier depending on their customers. Her husband takes care of the bar and she manages it. The other business is a beer warehouse that is located near the bar; the two businesses are the only income the family has and through them she has been able to give her children a good start in life.

The member needs the loan to buy more beer for her warehouse and to increase the sales in her bar.

The member is happy for the loan and is committed to meeting all of her payments.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy more beer for her warehouse and to increase the sales in her bar.

loans.name: Gulkiya's Group

texts.en:
Gulkiya T., 27, is involved in retailing consumer goods in a market in her hometown of Kerben. She is the treasurer of her group. She is married and has a seven-month-old toddler. While she is at work, she relies on a nanny to look after him. Gulkiya’s husband had to leave to go to Russia because he was offered a much better job. Both of them hope that soon things will be figured out and that they will have a chance to bring the whole family together. 

Every morning Gulkiya says good bye to her child until the evening, and leaves for work as early as possible. Retailing consumer goods is highly competitive, leading people to come up with new ideas for promoting their products. Every seller has his or her own techniques ranging from allowing customers to bargain to making gifts to customers. Gulkiya believes in a saying “the early bird catches the worm” and tries to open up early to attract early customers wandering in a market. Gulkiya faces severe competition, so she does her best to stand out from the crowd. 

Gulkiya's parents operated the business throughout their whole life. They gave Gulkiya the business ten years ago when. By watching her parents serve customers, Gulkiya already knew the successful techniques of retail. Ten years of hard work has brought its fruits. Gulkiya made a gift to her husband. She bought an automobile that he was dreaming of for a very long time. At this moment the business generates a monthly income of 7,000 soms for Gulkiya. She plans to spend the requested loan on buying more consumer goods. Over the next months she expects to have high demand and truly believes she will be repay the loan on time and without any violations.
      
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase consumer goods for trade

loans.name: Chhuy

texts.en: Chhuy P., 30, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. P. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 1.6 day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 80 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 38 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, donde vive con sus dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad, también su esposa, la casa es propia, y él es empleado y agricultor.
Carlos trabaja en la alcaldía de Jiquilisco, y también desarrolla las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas los fines de semana. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar todo lo necesario para sembrar y también comprar dos reces, ayudando así a llevar a cabo la siembra de granos básicos y aumentar el número de ganado.
Sus aspiraciones son que su milpa este en las mejores condiciones, aumentar su ganado y trabajar diariamente de la mejor manera, apoyando a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos, 38 years old, resides in the Jiquilisco department of Usulután where he lives with his two children, 18 and 15 years old, as well as his wife. They have their own house and he is an employee and farmer.
Carlos works in the Jiquilisco town hall and also carries out his agricultural and livestock activities on the weekend. He is asking for this current loan to buy the materials necessary to plant as well as to buy two cows which would help him carry out the planting of basic grains and increase his number of livestock.
His aspirations are that his crops are in the best condition, to increase his livestock, and perform his daily work in the best way to be able to support his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and agricultural materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his merchandise (fish)

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Doña Natalia es de una comunidad llamada tres estrellas, es una comunidad indigina, tal comunidad presenta un indice alto de personas que emigran a los Estados Unidos para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y de su familia, el negocio que tiene doña Natalia es una papeleria y su prestamo nos comenta que lo solicito para invertir en mercancia en utilies escolares para el negocio, ella platica: " la competencia es un factor importante porque hay otra papeleria cerca de la mia y como hay otra es dificil sacar buenas ventas y tambien ganancias, la mercancia si se vende pero se vende despacio, el prestamo me ayuda mucho porque voy a tener la oportunidad de invertir el dinero en mas mercancia, nuevas libretas lapiceros, calculadores en todo lo que mas venda, y con eso lo que gano lo ocupo para la comida por ejemplo, mis metas son no quedarme como estoy y luchar por ahumentar y hacer mas grande mi negocio, tengo tres hijos por lo que tengo todavia que ver para que salgan adelante, 2 hijos estudian, tengo 35 años, 15 años de casada, vivo en casa propia, mi esposo trabaja tiene un negoci de aluminio y vidrio.
texts.en:
Doña Natalia is from the community of “Tres Estrellas” (Three Stars). This community features a high influx of people who have migrated to the United States in search of a better quality of life for their families. Doña Natalia manages a stationery business and says that her loan will be invested in school supplies. She says, “Competition is a major factor because there are other stationery shops near me, so it is difficult to generate good sales and earnings.” Her merchandise sells at a slow rate.

The loans have been a great help because they have given her the opportunity to invest in more merchandise such as books, pens, and calculators. She sells most of everything. For this reason, she is concerned about feeding her family. Her goals are to move forward and fight to expand her business. Natalia has three children who she wants to see succeed. Two of them are in school.

Natalia is 35 years old and has been married for fifteen years. She lives in her own home. Her husband has an aluminum and glass business.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell in her business.

loans.name: Margalaa

texts.en: Margalaa is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children, aged 1 and 4, in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife is a salesperson at Talst Optic, a private company. Margalaa operates a taxi service in his town. He started his business in 2004. He is a reliable and safe driver who is renowned amongst his customers. He is planning to continue his business in the future. He says, "All I want is to build a house where my family can live happily." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy a new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: C4369 Ubumwe Group

texts.en:
Denise is 24 years old and is single.  She currently works in a shop in Kimironko district. She takes care of two relatives who are 8 to 20 years old. She runs a well-organized small store which sells bananas. She has been operating it successfully for three years and her shop is open from 7am until 7pm every day.  

Denise is the leader of this group, called "Ubumwe" in the local language, which means "reconciliation". The group consists of two men and five women. Denise is the second person on the left, raising her hand.

The group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company, to purchase more bananas for their market, so they can provide better service to their customers. The loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities of stock for bananas, which will allow them to earn more profits. With this extra income they all earn, Denise and her group hope to save some money and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Dalgi Esther

texts.es:
Dalgi mujer de 38 años, casada y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 10 años, vive con su familia en un barrio muy tradicional de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde la música, el folclor,  los carnavales y su gente trabajadora generadora de ingresos,  forman parte de la cultura  de sus habitantes.  En este ambiente ella tiene un negocio llamado “Confecciones y Variedades Lunna” allí exhibe ropa que ella misma fabrica y también vende muchos productos que requieren las familias cercanas a su vivienda, como cosméticos, perfumes, accesorios, papelería etc.
 Su experiencia de negocio data desde cuando tenía 15 años de edad y su mamá la puso a estudiar modistería  y le compró su primera  máquina con la cual inició la fabricación de blusas muy a la moda, que vendía en chazas del mercado, continuó perfeccionando su arte con capacitación en el servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA   y posteriormente se trasladó a la Isla de San Andrés , donde le fue muy bien con su actividad, pues le agregó el estampado de camisetas ; así fue como vivió allí durante 4 años;  una vez regresó a la Ciudad de Barranquilla aprovechó toda su experiencia y nuevamente emprendió el negocio que aún tiene,  pues confecciona y alquila vestidos de novia, de primera comunión, disfraces; ella gradualmente ha ido creciendo y adquiriendo sus activos fijos. Últimamente  tiene sus vitrinas y empezó a vender cuadernos, dulces, ropa, accesorios femeninos, colonias, y en la actualidad está estudiando artes plásticas y ya esta produciendo cuadros que ha vendido, porque considera que cada persona debe perfeccionar su arte, mediante el estudio y la experimentación para poder abrir nuevas líneas de negocios y sostenerse en un mercado tan cambiante como el actual.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materia prima, materiales e insumos para la fabricación de ropa encargada haciendo de esta una inversión exitosa, porque su experiencia atrae siempre nuevos clientes por el acabado que ella da a sus prendas y el servicio amable que ofrece e a sus clientes reales y potenciales. Su sueño es tener una boutique y también una galería donde exhibir sus cuadros, además de adquirir su propia casa, siendo esta es su máxima motivación para el trabajo persistente que Dalgi realiza día a día.
texts.en:
Dalgi, 38, is married and has two children who are 4 and 10 years of age.  She lives with her family in a very traditional neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla where music, folklore, carnivals and hard working, income generating people, form part of the culture of its residents.  In this environment she has a business called “Confecciones y Variedades Lunna” where she displays clothes that she, herself manufactures and she also sells many other products that the nearby families need like cosmetics, perfume, accessories, stationery items, etc.

Her experience in this business goes back to when she was 15 years old and her mother started her studying dressmaking and bought her her first sewing machine that she used to start making up-to-date blouses that she’d sell in the market.  She continued getting better skilled taking courses at SENA, Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje (National Vocational Education Services) where she did quite well with her activity because she added t-shirt printing.  She lived there for four years.

Once she returned to the city of Barranquilla she used all her skills to relearn her business which she has to this day.  She makes and rents wedding gowns, first communion dresses, and costumes.  She’s been gradually growing acquiring fixed assets.  Lately she got display cases and started to sell notebooks, candy, clothes, women’s accessories, and cologne.  She is currently studying art and is producing paintings that she’s sold.  She considers that everyone should perfect their art through study and experimentation to open new lines of business to stay in a market like the present one that is so changeable.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials, materials and supplies to make clothes she has on order thus making this a successful investment because her experience attracts new customers thanks to the finishing touches she gives to her garments and the kind service she provides to actual and potential customers.

Her dream is to have a boutique and also a gallery to display her paintings.  She’d also like to have her own house.  This is the maximum motivation for Dalgi to keep working every day.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Jesus le esta haciendo falta un cuarto y tiene el proyectos de construirlo en la parte trasera de su casa. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material que es, block, varilla y cemento. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para poder empezar la construcción lo más pronto posible ya que su niño esta creciendo y necesita su propio espacio en la casa. 
Don Jesus pagara el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleado de una fabrica de producción.
texts.en: Jesús’ house needs a room and he has a project ready to build one on the rear part of his house but he does not have the necessary funds to buy building materials and supplies like concrete blocks, iron rods and cement.  This is why he’s asking for a loan to be able to start construction as soon as possible because his son is growing and needs his own space in the house. Jesús will repay the loan with part of the salary he earns working as an employee of a production factory.

loans.use: to start building a room at the rear of his house.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 52 years old and a single mother of one adult child. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years. Her monthly income is about $113, which she uses to support her family. 

The client is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by the KADET staff. She will use the loan to buy farm products like manure and seedlings. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand the land farming business and venture into dairy farming.  Her hope is to settle down in life after enhancing her income.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening a dressmaking school in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for sale.

loans.name: Amidatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de tissu, pagnes et des petits trucs depuis 01 an, Amidatou s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé et revend  au marché d’Akodessewa. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et est maman de 02 enfants. Ce prêt l’aidera à renforcer son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Amidatou has been selling fabrics, pagnes (colorful West African cloths) and haberdasheries for one year. She gets her supplies at the Great Market in Lomé and resells at the market in Akodessewa. She is married to a merchant and is the mother of two children. This loan will enable her to boost her activity level in order to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and pagnes.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
From Kompong Cham Province, Mr. Moa and his wife have been working in crop-planting for a long time. From this occupation, they can make an income of approximately $5 per day for  food expenses, utility expenses, education expenses and other vital expenses. 

Mr. Moa will be using the loan which he is asking for to buy fertilizers and seeds in order to start planting his crop during the rainy season. The couple has six children, all of whom are single and most of them are still attending public school..

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su hijo, es vendedora de tamales y costurera, los negocios surgieron por iniciativa propia, los instalo en su casa, trabaja todos los días y no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
