Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela, hilos, para la costura y tambien pollo, condimentos para los tamales esta mercadería le ayudara para realizar mejores trabajos,  mejorarando sus negocios y a aumentar sus ingresos. 
Su proposito  es fortalecer sus negocios para recibir mejores ganancias y darle el estudio a su hijo, quien depende unicamene de sus ingresos..
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her son.  She is a tamale vendor and a seamstress.  The businesses arose through her own initiative and are home-based.  She works every day and does not have a fixed schedule to take care of customers.

At present, she’s requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread for the sewing and also chicken and spices for the tamales.  This merchandise will help her do better work improving her businesses and increasing her income.

Her goal is to strengthen her businesses to earn better profits and provide schooling for her son who depends solely on her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for the sewing and corn, chicken and spices for the tamales.

loans.name: Kahoru

texts.en:
Kahoru has operated in the transport industry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. He is 27 years old and married to Leah. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle. He will employ someone else to operate it while he operates his old one. 

In the future, Kahoru hopes to buy a pickup truck, which he will be using to transport goods to and from the market

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 40 year old married man with four children living in his own semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Fred is a farmer who has a dream of having diverse income generating projects. He grows bananas and has a piggery unit. He has been practicing agriculture for the last fifteen years and he is happy with the proceeds. The major hardship he encounters at the moment is the hiked prices of piggery feeds and labour costs. His dream is to venture into mechanised farming and expansion on his banana plantation. Fred needs the loan to pay labourers who are clearing his land for banana growing.

loans.use: To pay labourers who are clearing land for banana growing.

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc, a 38-year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He has a son. He and his wife earn an income by selling many kinds of beads and hair pins in their community. They have been in this business for ten years.

Duc requires a loan to purchase a greater quantity and range of different products, including beads, pins, and assorted hair and beauty accessories, to better serve his customers. He hopes that will permit him to attract more customers, to earn more income, and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a range of hair and ornamental products (beads, pins, assorted hair accessories) for selling

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur DRAMANE est âgé de 32 ans, marié à  une  épouse et père de 3 enfants. Il vit dans une famille nucléaire dans la ville  de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Du à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas eu la chance de s’instruire. Alors il s’est très vite intéressé aux  activités  génératrices de revenus notamment au commerce d’articles divers  auprès de son feu père. Cette activité lui procure de nos jours assez de revenus, sa notoriété est bonne car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, DRAMANE a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  il y a   3 mois. Il est à son premier prêt, qu'il utilisera pour acheter un stock de marchandises : thé, sucre, lait en poudre, et cigarettes, biscuits. Il s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique dans le quartier Hamdallaye de  la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. 
Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, DRAMANE compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, satisfaire le besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. Il compte sur les financements de Soro pour l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Monsieur DRAMANE is 32, married and the father of three children. He lives in his nuclear family in the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region). 

For socio-economic reasons, he was not fortunate enough to educate himself. Thus, he quickly got interested in money-earning activities, particularly selling various items together with his late father. This activity now brings him in a good deal of income; he is well-known and has a lot of customers every day. 

In order to satisfy the needs of his clientele appropriately and expand his business,  DRAMANE turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three months ago. He is on his first loan which he plans to use to buy various merchandise: tea, sugar, powdered milk, cigarettes, cookies. He buys from the wholesalers in Koutiala and sells his goods for cash in his shop in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the town of Koutiala to a clientele composed of women and men.

As his business grows, DRAMANE expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which he will use to reimburse the interest charged by Soro, to satisfy the needs of his family, and then invest the rest in his business. He is counting on the loans from Soro for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai was born in 1970. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune. 

Mai is single. She is a hairdresser. She has a barber shop at home. She has had this business for five years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. 

Since 2007 she has participated in SEDA and always repaid punctually. The last time she borrowed 8,502,000 VND to invest in her shop. 

In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to repair her barber shop.

loans.use: to repair her barber shop.

loans.name: Aires Cordilleranos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Aires Cordilleranos” lo conforman 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, mueblistas, hojalateros, joyeros, criaderos de gallinas y producción de mermeladas entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Rigoberto integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pie, ocupando la cuarta posición de izquierda a derecha. Su cabello es cano y usa anteojos. El se dedica a la hojalatería, soldadura y gasfitería, prestando sus servicios todos los días de la semana. Trabaja en éste oficio desde hace 30 años. Su negocio cuenta con herramientas de fabrica y artesanales, realizadas por el mismo. Rigoberto se dedica principalmente a la instalación de combustión y reparación de cocinas. 
Sus materiales y/o herramientas las compra en distribuidoras de materiales de construcción.
Con el crédito comprará material para realizar galvanizado.
Sus metas en su negocio son instalarse con un taller, en el cual no solo se dedique a prestar servicios, sino también a vender material y herramientas, además debe obtener un permiso para trabajar sin restricciones. 
Rigoberto vive junto a su esposa y su nieta de 2 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son concretar sus proyecciones de trabajo para brindarle de ésta manera una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
El se encuentra muy agradecido del crédito y servicios entregados por Fondo Esperanza, comenta que disfruta de las reuniones grupales del Banco comunal por la cooperación y sociabilidad que se ha dado. Respecto a las capacitaciones tiene muchas expectativas de aprender nuevas estrategias para ocuparlas a favor de su negocio. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Aires Cordilleranos" and comprised of 19 entrepreneurs who are active in different businesses, including furniture making, tinsmith, jewelry, chicken farming and marmalade production.  They all live in the city of Temuco.

Rigoberto is a member of the communal bank and he is pictured standing, fourth from the left.  He has grey hair and wears glasses.  He is a tinsmith, welder and plumber who offers his services every day of the week and has 30 years' experience.  He owns manufactured as well as artisan tools which he has made.  Rigoberto is involved mainly in installing and repairing cooking stoves.

He buys his materials and/or tools at construction materials dealers.  He plans to use the loan to buy galvanizing materials.

His goal for the business is to set up a workshop where he would not only provide services but also sell material and tools.  He also must obtain a permit to work without restrictions.

Rigoberto lives with his wife and a two-year-old granddaugther.  His goal on a family level is to realize his work goals so he can provide a better quality of life to his family.

He is very grateful for the loan and services received from Fondo Esperanza.  He enjoys the communal bank's group meetings because of the cooperation and sociability.  Regarding training, he is excited about learning new strategies to put into practice at his businesss.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucaní region.  The city is about 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  In the area there are several lake resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and bright flora and fauna, concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It is worth pointing out that in this region around 50% of the country's Mapuche indians live.

loans.use: To buy galvanizing materials.

loans.name: José Andres

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde los ocho años de edad, fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar junto con sus hermanos. Él proviene de una familia numerosa son cinco hermanos, los cuales a lo largo de su vida enfrentaron grandes carencias, por la pobreza de ese tiempo, les toco comer con tortilla mojada con suero y sal. Pero que la misma necesidad los hacia conforme y felices.

Poco a poco fueron trabajando y todos sus hermanos tienen sus hogares, y José esta feliz de tener una familia a la cual le brinda lo necesario para subsistir. Él ha sembrado una milpa cerca de su casa y dice que no fue mucho lo que perdió con el invierno, por eso esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la recolección del maíz y fríjol, ya que necesita pagar empleados, para que le ayuden a esa actividad. También quiere comprar una vaca. Una parte de la producción la venderá y el resto lo dejara para consumo de su hogar. José piensa en sembrar la milpa del próximo año con lo que ingrese de la venta del maíz de este año.

José desea brindarle a su familia el sustento diario y comprar un terreno más grande, para sembrar un poco más.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 35 years old and lives with his life companion. They have one child. José has been farming for eight years. His parents taught him and his siblings how to work. He comes from a family with five children, so he knows what it is like to lack many things in life as a result of poverty. Sometimes the only food available to eat was tortillas dipped in whey and salt, but his family was able to adapt and remain happy.

José and his siblings worked over time and all of them have their own homes. He is very happy that he has a family for whom he can provide the necessities for living. José has a cornfield near his house and says he did not lose much during the winter. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo so that he can harvest corn and beans. He needs to pay workers to help with this activity. José also wants to buy a cow. Part of the milk that it produces will be sold and the rest will be reserved for household consumption.

José plans to plant corn next year, so he will reinvest the income from this year’s sales. He wants to provide for his family’s daily sustenance and buy a larger piece of land so that he can plant a few more crops.

loans.use: to pay workers to help with harvesting and to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
NawA. is a 39-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and she is a mother of two children.

NawA. is selling weddiing gowns and engagement dresses. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more gowns and dresses to sell.

NawA. is looking to open a shop from where she can sell her dresses instead of selling them from home. She is also looking to save some amount of money to finance her daughters' education in tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase wedding gowns to sell

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Sotera has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Sotera has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sotera hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca” del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Cuenta con educación primaria.

Trabaja desde hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos de confitería, chocolates, mana y gaseosas. 

Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevo soles, comprará más mercaderías como chocolates, aceitunas, maná (cereales), maní, gaseosas, etc., en el negocio trabaja sola, su esposo se dedica a la venta de cámaras.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una casa y un carro propio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la distracción con las socias.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the communal bank "Kapia Marca," in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno.  She is 42 years old, lives with a partner and has 2 school-aged children.  She has an elementary school education.

Margarita has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 5 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in her business selling confectionery products, chocolates, mana (a Peruvian candy) and soft drinks.

With this new loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, she will buy more merchandise such as chocolates, olives, candy, cereals, peanuts, soft drinks, etc.  She works alone in her business; her husband has a business selling cameras.

Margarita's dream for the future is to have her own house and her own car.  What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings and having fun with the members.

loans.use: to buy chocolates, olives, candy, peanuts, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a family house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling clothes, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. One of the major challenges she faces in her business is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With this loan of KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio is 58 years old and married with three children. His two younger children still go to school.

Aurelio is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Aurelio primarily grows rice to sell. He works hard to improve his business and support his family. He requested this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to pay for labor. Aurelio hopes to soon acquire farming equipment such as a tractor.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Flor Kantutita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTITA” iniciará su séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de salchipapa, trenzado de mantas, costura de mandiles, producción de tullmas, chofer, portería.

La señora Martha,  indica que hace mas de cinco años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su hermana. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de abarrotes) que comprará la Ceja  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias de las comunidades. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella tiene cuatro hijos y es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud, la atención del personal y el servicio.
texts.en:
The community association "FLOR KANTUTITA" began its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center Germán Busch. It is made up of eleven members and it is guided by a board of directors headed by Martha. The members of the community association go forward with various businesses, among them we have: food sales, cosmetics sales, kebab sales, blanket weaving, sewing aprons, making tulmas, driver, and caretaker.

Martha says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for more than five years, and she joined the institution at the invitation of her sister. Currently she has a grocery business that she's been working at for years.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (for buying groceries) which she will buy in the commercial sector of the city ("La Ceja") and later sell at the community marketplaces. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family, as she is single with four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes health, personal attention, and the service.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 40-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been buying and selling bananas for seven years. His hardships are price fluctuation and inflation. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is moving his business to a more permanent location. Johnson wants the loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handmade sterling silver jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of silver, her main material, to increase production.

Leslie has been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is her story:

"I have always been interested in art. It was a natural choice to study design. After that, I studied jewelry design, which I've practiced since 2003. Making jewelry offers me a sanctuary away from the world where I can do what I want. I love art and three-dimensional pieces, and I love to be able to touch what I create in my mind. To me, my craft is like a magical experience that allows me to express what I feel through silver and gems."

"Thank you all for appreciating Peruvian arts and taking part of this microcredit. I plan to purchase the materials I need with it, in order to increase my production, in time for the holiday season."

Use the link below to view Leslie's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6660

loans.use: to purchase silver, her main material, to increase production, in time for the holiday season.

loans.name: Nezahat

texts.en:
Nezahat is married and has one child.  She sews duvet covers, bedding sheets and bed covers at home and sells them in local bazaars thus makes a contribution to the family budget.  She bought bulks of fabrics for bed covers, sheets and ready made duvet covers.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Nezahat hanım evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Evinde çarşaf ve pike takımları dikerek bunları semt pazarlarında satarak maddi olarak eşine destek oluyor.  Nezahat Hanım maya’dan aldığı 2. kredisi  ile toptan pike  kumaşı ve hazır nevresim takımları aldı.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for bed covers, sheets and ready made duvet covers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Phet

texts.en: Mrs. Phet V., 26-year-old mother of one child, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is talented and has experience working in a tailoring business which contributes to her about $3/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, is a motor-taxi driver and typically makes about $2 extra for his household. In order to get additional money and keep improving her tailoring business, V. hopes the loan will assist her to purchase a motorcycle for her husband and clothes for her inventory. She hopes, for the next coming year, to have enough money to own a tailoring store at a market, where she can increase her savings.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to run a business

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Business: Tend the store, make traditional weaved cloth and do other home-based work. The loan will be invested in stocking the store with many things that are not stocked now. She hopes, as a consequence, to fill the store and increase her earnings.

Dona Catarina is married to don Jacinto Raymundo Santiago y they now have three children. Before, Jacinto wanted to continue his studies and, after some thought, they agreed to start their little store. She tended the store and made her cloth and last year, at last, her husband graduated as a teacher. This was one of dona Catarina’s dreams, a dream that she and her husband have now fulfilled, with her husband working in the community and she at her store. She hopes now to fill her store and increase her earnings.

Written by Juana Cedillo.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Actividad: cuido de la tienda y elaboración de tejidos típicos y actividades en su hogar. La inversión del crédito es para surtir su tienda ya que hay muchas cosas que no tiene la tienda. Los resultados que espera es tener lleno su tienda y obtener más ganancias.

Doña Catarina esta casada con don Jacinto Raymundo Santiago y actualmente tienen tres hijos, pero el esposo estaba ansioso de seguir sus estudios y se pusieron de acuerdo y pensaron su pequeña tienda. Y ella cuidaba la tienda y a la vez elaboraba sus tejidos, y por fin el esposo se graduó el año pasado como maestro de Educación y ese fue uno de los sueños que doña catarina logro con su esposo pues actualmente el trabajo en su comunidad y ella se dedica a su tienda.

Escrito por facilitadora Juana Cedillo.

loans.use: To stock her store with many things that she doesn't have now.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina A. runs a small convenience store in front of her house. She sells things like rice, chicken, coffee, sugar, and charcoal for cooking and heating. Miguelina is 46 years old, married, has one daughter and four grandchildren. Her husband is a day laborer in a nearby farm and her daughter works for an electrician in the nearby city of Barbaro. They all live together.

Miguelina has already successfully paid back an Esperanza loan for 5,000 pesos (US$ 150 ). She buys products for her convenience store from the nearby capital city of El Seybo, then sells them to her community. Miguelina wants to keep moving forward with her business. Business is good, she says, and she wants to keep selling more goods and needs money to expand.

loans.use: Purchase food staples and household supplies for resale

loans.name: Lucila Máxima

texts.es:
Doña Lucila is a woman who has always found a way to take care of her kids on her own. Today after many years have gone by, she watches with satisfaction the independence of her older children within their society and now she just shares her longings and her little home with her last daughter, who is eighteen years old. Everyday she motivates her. Doña Lucila had worked for over twenty years as a domestic employee and in payment for her services the family, with whom she worked, left her to inherit the house in which she lives today. In this house she saw the best way for her to obtain an income to care for her kids. Making use of part of this beautiful house she opened a little grocery store. Fifteen years have already passed since then and now she can see the fruits of her labor. Because she is at such an advanced age, she cannot lift objects of much weight and has a slightly limited physical capability, but it is more than the constant physical efforts that her life demands of her. Doña Lucila desires to see her last daughter graduated as a professor and so she will continue making the effort in her store, where she sells groceries and the everyday necessities. This is why she requests a loan with the objective of investing it in the purchase of a great quantity and variety of the articles that her clients demand daily. Let's support these noble desires of forging a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lucila, es una mujer que siempre ha visto la manera de sostener sola a sus hijos, hoy ya después de muchos años transcurridos ve con satisfacción el desenvolvimiento de sus hijos mayores dentro de su sociedad y ahora sólo comparte sus anhelos y pequeña morada con su última hija de 18 años que cada día la motiva a seguir adelante.Doña Lucila ha trabajado por más de veinte años como empleada doméstica y en retribución de sus servicios la familia con la cual trabajaba le dejó en herencia la casa donde hoy habita y por ello vió la mejor manera de obtener ganancias para sostener a sus hijos.Es por ello que haciendo uso de las instalaciones de esta bella casa aperturó una pequeña bodega, ya han pasado 15 años desde aquel entonces y ahora puede observar los frutos de su labor. Por su avanzada edad ya no puede cargar objetos de mucho peso y tiene un poco limitado el esfuerzo físico más no los esfuerzos de ánimo que son ilimitados en la vida de Doña Lucila.Doña Lucia desea ver a su última hija graduada de profesora y por ello seguirá esforzándose en su tienda de venta de abarrotes y víveres de primera necesidad, es por ello que solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de artículos que le demandan a diario sus exigentes clientes.Apoyemos estos nobles deseos de forjar un futuro mejor.

loans.use: Capital to acquire a great quantity and variety of everyday goods.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Pierrette Y., 39, is a married mother of six (6) children. Her main business activity consists of selling foodstuffs (corn, beans, sorghum, millet), and she is assisted by her husband, an unemployed schoolteacher. Pierrette is requesting a loan of $1000 to build up a consistent inventory so she can satisfy her customers and earn a profit, which will allow her to meet her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 39 ans, Madame Y. Pierrette est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce des produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, sorgho, mil). Aidée par son mari qui est un instituteur en chômage, Madame Pierrette sollicite un financement de $1000 pour faire un stock consistant en vue de satisfaire sa clientèle et en dégager une marge bénéficiaire qui lui servira de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of grains

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, age 20, is single and lives with her aunt in Dar es Salaam. Since March 2007, she has been selling clothing to earn income and now makes about US$55 in monthly profit. Bahati works from 8 am to noon daily. Her customers often cannot afford to pay her up front for the clothes they buy and, instead, pay afterwards in regular installments. This payment system, however, creates difficulties for Bahati who must keep track of her customers in order to receive her payments in time.

Bahati hopes to receive a loan to increase her clothing stock. She belongs to the loan group Jipemoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing inventory

loans.name: Gulomaly

texts.ru:
Gulomaly G. lives in the city of Fayzabad. He is 55 years old, married and has three children. He has a college education and is a dentist by profession. He works as a dentist in Fayzabad, but besides his work he also does animal husbandry. His experience in this field is five years. He plans to use the loan to buy a calve and after feeding it for about 40 days he will sell it on the market. Gulomaly's business allows to improve the financial situation of his family and also facilitates the development of farming in this region. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гаффоров Гуломали житель города Файзобод. Возраст 55 лет , женат имеет 3 детей.Образование высшее. По специальности Стамотолог . Работает стоматологом в районе Файзабад.Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Опыт в бизнесе 5 лет.Кредит планирует использовать на покупку бычка, а затем после откормки ,которая продолжается около 40 дней, перепродать на рынке. Его бизес позволяет улучшить финансовое положение в семье , а так же способствовать развитию фермерской деятельности в районе. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calve

loans.name: Va Group

texts.es:
Pascuala would like to set up a general store in her house because she lives 30 minutes from the nearest town, there are no stores in her community, and there are hardly any cars for transportation. With this loan, she would like to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, cookies, soft drinks, pasta, etc. She is a 44-year-old mother of 3 children, whom she will be able to better support once her business is in place. The other members of the group are Petrona H. H. and Julia Herandez H., who both sell fruits and vegetables, and Teresa Maria Pérez H., who is an artisan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA QUIERE INSTALAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA YA QUE VIVE A 30 MINUTOS DEL PUEBLO MAS CERCANO Y EN SU LOCALIDAD NO HAY TIENDAS Y CASI NUNCA HAY CARROS PARA VIAJAR, CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR, ARROZ, AZUCAR, ACEITE, GALLETAS, REFRESCOS, PASTAS, ETC. ELLA TIENE 44 AÑOS, 3 HIJOS, A LOS QUE CON LA INSTALACION DEL NEGOCIO PODRA MANTENER MEJOR ,LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON PETRONA H. H., JULIA H. H. LAS CUALES SE DEDICAN A VENDER FRUTAS Y VERDURAS Y TERESA MARIA PÉREZ H. QUE ES ARTESANA.

loans.use: Purchase of more goods (rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Maliserina's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Maliserina is 40 years old and married; she has two children, ages 12 and 22. Maliserina owns a small food store, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with Linda, who also has a business in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her business.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mr Vin C. and his wife were married in 1978. They have seven children; three sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other four children, one is a mason and the other three are in school. His wife, Mrs Yai Chea has been a fish seller for 11 years. She buys fish from fishermen for resale in her village and nearby village. The family lives across the Mekong River about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr Vin has been a mechanic for 24 years. He does his work in the village. He is requesting a loan of US$400 to pay for repairing his house.

loans.use: To pay for repairing his house.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rokia B. is a 41 year old married woman with 5 children who lives with her husband and their children in a monogamous family in the Wayerma district in the city of Sikasso. She has been running a business buying and selling firewood for 9 years in order to meet her needs and those of her family.

She is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso and took part in a group loan before obtaining an individual loan. She supplies herself in the areas surrounding Sikasso 4 times per month. She runs this business at home throughout the year without any major difficulties. With this loan, she intends to acquire 20 truckloads of firewood and 15 bags of charcoal to resell during the rainy season. With expenses of 200,000 FCFA, she intends to realize a profit of 150,000 due to the scarcity of dry firewood during this time of the year.

She intends to repay this loan rapidly and to increase the amount requested in order to enlarge her business, and thus her profit.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Rokia B. est une femme mariée de 41 ans et mère de 5 enfants vivant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Wayerma de la ville de Sikasso. Elle mène l’activité d’achat et de vente de bois de chauffe dépuis 9 ans pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille.

Elle est à son premier.pret avec Soro Yiriwaso et a passé par le crédit solidaire avant d’obtenir le pret indivduel. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso 4 fois par mois . Elle mène cette activité à domicile durant toute l’année sans difficultés majeures. Avec ce pret elle envisage d’acquérir 20 voyages de camions en bois de chauffe 15 sacs de charbon de bois pour les revendre pendant la saison des pluies. Avec un achat de 200.000 FCFA, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 150.000 FCFA en raison de la rarété du bois de chauffe sec en cette période de l’année.

Elle compte rembourser rapidement ce pret et augmenter son montant demandé afin d’élargir son activité et par conséquent son bénéfice.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of firewood

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
Mrs. Silvia is 57 years old and sells fruits and Nacatamales (local tamales served as breakfast on Sundays or lunch during the week) on Saturdays and Sundays. she is married and her 4 children are adults and live outside the home. 15 years ago, Mrs. Silvia started her business selling nacatamales, but over time was able to extend to the sale of fruits from her home.

Mrs. Silvia's husband is an electrician, but is currently unemployed, a situation that has brought Silvia to search for other sources of income. As a result she is requesting a loan in order to be able to purchase construction materials to make a small room in her house that she can rent and be able to count on other income the will permit her family to live comfortably and stably.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Silvia tiene 57 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y también vende Nacatamales los sábados y los domingos, es casada y sus 4 hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes a ella. Hace 15 años Doña Silvia empezó el negocio de las ventas de nacatamales pero con el tiempo pudo extenderse también a la venta de frutas en su casa de habitación. El esposo de Doña Silvia es electricista pero en estos momentos se encuentra desempleado, situación que lleva a Doña Silvia a buscar otras fuentes de ingresos, es por eso que solicita el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un pequeño cuarto en su vivienda, y así ponerlo de alquiler y poder contar con otros ingresos que le permitan a esta familia una condición de vida estable.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi N., 25 years of age, has been a member since 2003. Since becoming a member of this loan program, she has invested in mat making and livestock. The family income has rise and fluctuates daily. Her first loan of 1.000.000d was used to invest in livestock and mat making. As a result, she was able to invest more capital into her livestock business and purchased more materials for mat weaving. Every day her husband works as a construction worker with an average daily income of 80.000d. Presently, she plans to borrow this loan to help remodel the animals’ pen. She is requesting a loan of 6.000.000d. Her average monthly income is 4.000.000d.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thi Nguyệt 25 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Từ năm tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn làm ăn đầu tư vào làm chiếu và chăn nuôi. Kinh tế gia đình được thay đổi từng ngày. Vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị vay 1.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm chiếu kết quả từ việc chăn nuôi được anh chị đầu tư tái chăn nuôi và thêm vốn mua lác chiếu, hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm thợ xây bình quân mỗi ngày 80.000đ. Tới đây gia đình chị có kết hoạch vay vốn về sửa chữa công trình phụ và chuồng trại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi được tôt hơn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000đ Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Hace más de 20 años, Betty (39), viene dedicándose a la venta de variedad de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas en uno de los terminales de transporte terrestre interprovinciales de la ciudad de Juliaca, con ese pequeño negocio logró brindarle bienestar a su familia, pero ahora que sus hijos se encuentran siguiendo sus estudios superiores le demandan mayor gasto económico, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a la venta de boletos de viaje, obteniendo ingresos económicos extras por cada pasaje  que vende.Su deseo es adquirir variedad de galletas y chocolates  de la ciudad de Tacna y distribuirlos al por mayor a los comerciantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, con esos ingresos  que obtenga logrará cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
For more than 20 years Betty (39) has been selling a variety of candy and soft drinks for a living at one the the interprovincial ground transportation terminals of the town of Juliaca. With this small business she was able to offer well-being to her family, but now when her children are going on with higher education the economic costs have increased and therefore she decided to sell travel tickets to obtain some extra income. It is her wish to purchase a variety of cookies and chocolate bars at the town of Tacna in distribute in bulk to the storekeepers in the town of Juliaca and thus obtain earnings to cover her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of cookies and candies to improve business.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr: Anani K. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est revendeurs d’appareils portables et accessoires à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. L’utilisation d’appareils haute gamme étant devenu la mode, la clientèle devient de plus en plus exigeante. Pour répondre à tous ces besoins, Anani souhaite acheter des appareils ainsi que leurs accessoires. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Anani K. is 45 years old, married and the father of four children. He sells cell phones and accessories in Danyi, a village about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Now that top-of-the-range phones are so popular, customers are becoming increasingly demanding. In order to meet all the demand, Anani would like to purchase cell phones as well as their accessories. He is counting on this opportunity to help improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones and their accessories for resale

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu S. is 32 years old, married and has two children. She is an enterprising trader who is hard working, and has being trading for eleven years She has been selling food products such as maize, plantain, beans, groundnuts and gari in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. 

While her children are in school, she travels to the northern part of Ghana to purchase her products. She says that selling these food items is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make enough income to rent a storeroom. Mamunatu is a member of the group called Saamu (Receiving) Trust Group. Members agree to act as social collateral for each other and assist one another to repay the loans. Her picture was taken during their group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase maize, plantain, groundnuts, gari and beans for resale

loans.name: Eufemia Magna

texts.es:
La señora Eufemia Magna tiene 40 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza II y vive en la calle San Pablo 620 Interior A del sector Jerusalén, distrito La Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercer año D. secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque se quedó huérfana D. ambos padres y su hermano se hizo cargo D. ella. Al casarse su hermano ya no pudo continuar apoyándola. Ella se casó a los 16 años y tiene 3 hijos, D. los cuales el mayor ya trabaja y los dos últimos todavía son estudiantes.
Magnita, como cariñosamente la llaman todos sus familiares y conocidos, venD. D. casa en casa utensilios y artefactos electrodomésticos. Viaja a la sierra liberteña o a otros departamentos a ofrecer sus productos. 
Agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque gracias a sus créditos pudo obtener capital y trabajar como lo hace actualmente. Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, empezó a trabajar y fue creciendo, porque compró muy poco pero lo supo invertir.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1,500, lo cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará paraguas, radios, tapers, cubrecamas y otros.
Magnita desea tener una tienda granD. y poner una fábrica D. zapatos.
texts.en:
Eufemia Magna, 40, belongs to the Nueva Esperanza II ["New Hope II"] community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She left school in the third graD.. She wasn't able to continue her schooling because both her parent died, leaving her an orphan in the care of her brother. When he married, he wasn't able to go on supporting her. She married at 16 and has 3 children, the oldest of whom works. The younger two are still in school. Magnita, as she's lovingly known, sells household goods, door-to-door. She travels throughout La Libertad and other "departamentos" selling her goods. She's very grateful to Manuela Ramos because the money she's borrowed has allowed her to do what she does. With the first loan of S/.300 [300 Peruvian soles], repaid in 4 installments, she began her business, buying little but wisely. With this loan of S/.1,500, to be repaid in 6 installments, she will buy umbrellas, radios, tablecloths, bedspreads and other products. Magnita's dream is to have a large store and set up a shoe factory.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Consuelo Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo Esperanza pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Alto Mayo,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Rioja y se dedica a la venta de frutas de manera ambulatoria en una de las calles principales de la ciudad. 

Con este crédito de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará diversas frutas de la región como mango, mandarina, granadilla, uva, manzana, pera, entre otras frutas para así tener abastecido su puesto, satisfacer la exigencia de sus clientes y asegurar sus ventas. 

Consuelo Esperanza tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 04 hijos, por quienes tiene que trabajar a diario porque quiere darles un futuro mejor, es padre y madre para ellos. Su meta es poner otro negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
Consuelo Esperanza belongs to the "El Alto Mayo" Communal Bank, lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Rioja, and sells fruit along the main streets of the city. With this loan for S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a variety of regional fruits such as mangos, mandarin oranges, granadillas, grapes, apples and pears, to have a supply and be able to meet the demands of her customers. Consuelo Esperanza is 44 years old and the mother of 4 children, for whom she works every day in order to give them a better future; she is both mother and father to them. Her goal is to start up another business from home.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fruit such as mangos, mandarin oranges, granadillas, grapes, apples, pears, etc.

loans.name: La Florida Group

texts.es: El grupo "Florida" esta representada por la señora Silvia  Melina e integrada por 16 miembros los cuales son dinámicos y con muchas ganas D. progresar en sus pequeños negocios. En su mayoría el grupo se dedica a actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida,abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, zapatos y algunos a la prestación D. sevicias D. construcción D. vivienda, transporte público y atencion en cafes internets. Dentro del ámbito laboral en especial el comercial existe gran competencia dentro del mercado por lo que le obliga a los integranrtes del grupo a mejorar la calida D. sus productos y a proporcionar un servicio D. mejor calidad es por esta razon que requieren D. un fianciamiento a travez D. la fundacion Agrocapital, para hacer crecer su negocio comprado materiales e insumos y mejorando sus herramientas D. trabajo para poder brindar un servicio D. calidad y con mayor eficiencia. En general el grupo no tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios pero aseguran ser gente responsable y con gran calidad humana por lo que la fundación agrocapital les brinda la oportunidad D. incrementar sus ingresos y D. mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Florida" group is represented by Mrs. Silvia Melina and has 16 members. They are dynamic and are enthusiastic about making progress in their small businesses. The majority of the group members are in sales such as food sales, neighborhood grocery stores, cosmetics and shoes. Some are service providers, housing construction, public transportation and Internet cafes. In the work field, especially sales, there is a lot of competition in the market. This forces the group members to improve the quality of their products and proviD. better quality service. That is why they need financing through the Agrocapital foundation, to make their businesses grow. By purchasing materials and supplies and improving their work tools, they can offer high quality service with better efficiency. In general the group doesn't have experience working with solidarity groups but they assure us they are responsible and good people. The Agrocapital foundation is offering them the opportunity to increase their income and improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marylin

texts.es: Marylin tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos, en una casa que es propia de su familia. Ella tiene su propio restaurante que decidió implementar para poder sostener sus estudios universitarios, con los ahorros que tenía arrendó un local que hasta ahora ocupa para su restaurante, y ahora que es vacaciones le da todo el día de su tiempo en la atención, pero en época de clases atiende medio día y sus padres la apoyan en la otra mitad del día. Para Marylin  esta es una de las mejores opciones que ha elegido porque es rentable, ya que la comida es una necesidad primordial y esto asegura la demanda de su restaurante, cuya ubicación está cercana a un terminal terrestre de su ciudad. Marylin tiene planes de mejorar su restaurante en cuanto su decoración y los platos que ofrece. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada por su banco comunal por  ser unja joven emprendedora que es responsable  y tiene muchas ideas de emprender un  trabajo en su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de vidrios que colocará sobre sus mesas como parte de la decoración, también comprará centros de mesa, cuadros, entre otros detalles que servirán para  decorar su restaurante, demás mandará a hacer un bonito letrero para la fachada.
texts.en:
Marylin is 21 and lives with her parents and brothers in her family's own house. She used her savings to rent space to open a restaurant so she could support her college education. Now that school's out she devotes all of her attention to the restaurant. But during the school year she'll work for half a day and her parents will support her for the other half. Marylin chose this business because it's profitable, and it's one of the best things she can do; food is a basic need, assuring popularity for her restaurant, which is located near the city transit station. She has plans for improving her restaurant with better decorations and meals. This will be Marylin's first loan with MFP. Her village bank invited her in because she is an enterprising and responsible young woman who has a lot of ideas for getting things done in her group. She'll use her loan to buy decorative glasses for her tables, as well as centerpieces, pictures, and other adornments for her restaurant. She'll also order an attractive sign for out front.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Decor for her resaurant

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Batsuh V. lives with her husband, two daughters and two sons in Tsetserleg city in Arkhangai province. One of the sons is a college student. All the other children work in the countryside. One of the children is unemployed and helps her mother’s business.

Batsuh's husband is a guard for the building of City Water Treatment Agency. In 2000, she started selling raw meat at the local market. In December 2001, she started taking loans from XacBank, Kiva's partner in Mongolia. The result has been very good and all the loans were paid back on time.

When she began the business, she only had a working capital of 50,000 tugrig (1 USD=1,5000 tugrig). Now it has increased to 600,000 tugrig. With the help of the loans, she has improved her family's living conditions and paid her son’s college tuition. She is entrepreneurial and good at what she does. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and help all her children to find jobs. In addition, she would like to have her own place to run the business. With this loan, she will buy raw meat for her business.

loans.use: To buy raw meat for re-sale

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy C., 37, has been selling fish to her neighbors in the village for years. She takes care of three children who are no longer in school. All of them are employed as garment workers in the garment industry. The family lives in Phnom Penh City.

Tuy C. currently makes a daily income of $3 from her business. Her husband works as a carrier in the fish market. C.'s family's living conditions are not so good, because their house frequently needs repair. C. has applied for a loan to add to her savings to repair her house and to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: Repair her house and buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 42 años de edad, es casada hace 9 años, tiene 5 hijos ya mayores que no viven en su casa. Junto a su esposo han educado a cada uno de sus hijos mediante la agricultura, gracias a sus cultivos, sus hijos tuvieron la oportunidad de lograr una carrera técnica, la cual ahora les sirve como soporte para el bienestar de sus propias familias. Durante años han sembrado papa y alverjas, estos dos cultivos han sido muy rentables, por ello está muy contenta y agradecida con la tierra, porque dice que gracias a la tierra y a Dios sus cultivos le han dado muy buenos frutos. Ahora que partieron sus hijos en busca de otras miras, ella y su esposo se sienten muy felices por los logros obtenidos, además ya no tienen la carga de seguir trabajando arduamente para sostener a una familia numerosa. Pero esta pareja tiene hecha su vida en la agricultura, a la cual le tienen mucho cariño, sus hijos les han propuesto dejar la chacra, pero ellos prefieren quedarse ahí por ser parte de su vida y aman sus tierras. En los ciclos anteriores, Catalina se desempeñó como vocal de su banco comunal, cursa su 7mo ciclo de préstamo con MFP, donde todo este tiempo ha venido trabajando con mucha responsabilidad en las cuotas fijadas. El dinero que viene solicitando en esta oportunidad, lo derivará en la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado correspondiente de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 42 years old, has been married for 9 years, and has 5 adult children who no longer live at home. She and her husband provided for their children by farming—thanks to their crops, Catalina’s children had the opportunity to obtain technical degrees, which now serve them well in supporting their own families. Throughout the years Catalina and her husband have grown potatoes and peas; both of these crops are very profitable, and Catalina gives thanks to the land and to God for providing them with such good crops. Now that their children have gone off on their own, Catalina and her husband are very happy about their achievements. Although the couple is no longer responsible for supporting a large family through their hard work, they made their living through farming and have much affection for that way of life. Their children have suggested that they leave the farm, but Catalina and her husband prefer to stay because the farm has been an important part of their life and they love the land. In previous loan cycles Catalina worked as a member of a communal bank, and she is now in her 7th loan cycle with Kiva partner MFP; she has worked very responsibly the whole time to make her loan payments. Catalina plans to use the money she is requesting at this time to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Gerardo Porfirio

texts.es: El señor Gerardo Porfirio C. , tiene la edad de 47 años , habita en el barrio el raizon , carretera hacia Masaya , junto a su esposa , la cual es ama de casa y comerciante , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos los cuales le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y darle un mejor bienestar , don Gerardo desde hace 35 años , se dedica a la agricultura , el inicio la actividad agrícola con el apoyo de sus padres . Los planes hacia un futuro para su cultivo es poder mejorarlo. El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, para obtener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo Porfirio C. is 47 years old and lives in the Raizon neighbourhood, on the highway to Masaya, with his wife. She is a housewife and works as a merchant in order to help him with household expenses. They also have in their charge their two sons, who help with the work on the farm. His plans for his family are to improve their quality of life and their well-being. Gerardo has been a farmer for 35 years. He began his agricultural activities with the support of his parents. His plan for the future of his crops is to be able to improve them. He wants the loan for the purchase of supplies and fertilizers in order to get a good harvest and to sell it for a good price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers in order to improve crops.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 36-year-old woman and is married to Serafin Enrique who is also 36 years-old. Her husband works as the treasurer in their village at Magsaysay, Naguilian, Isabela. He also operates his passenger tricycle for extra income. The couple was blessed with three children.  Sermay Michelle is 17 years-old and currently studies nursing in Manila.  Sermil Michael is 14 years-old and is in high school, and Shiella May is 10 years-old and studies in primary school.

Mildred has managed a mini-grocery store in their home for about three years. She needs additional working capital and is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She plans to purchase more groceries to meet the needs of her customers. She hopes that her loan request will be granted because it would be of great help for the improvement of her business. Her eldest child is undergoing chemotherapy while at the same time studying patiently because she really wants to acquire a degree. The family must pay PHP 8,000 monthly for the chemotherapy treatment. She is so thankful that her good sister has assisted in the payment for the medication of her child. She is at least happy that, together with her husband, they both do their best to work and be able have sufficient income for their expenditures.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Juan Bautista Group

texts.es: El grupo “Juan Bautista” esta reprensado por la señora Carmen, es un grupo nuevo que se reunieron entre personas de la misma comunidad de manera que se conocen muy bien y confían uno al otro. En general los integrantes se dedican a la venta de aves, zapatos, pan, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, dulce, salteña y algunos al servicio de transporte en motocicletas. El entorno de los miembros del grupo es bastante competitivo pero con sus ganas de trabajar y su experiencia salen adelante para brinda a sus hogares una mejor calida de vida. El destino del crédito es para adquisición de materiales, repuestos, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso para otorgar a sus familias un hogar económicamente estable. A pesar de ser un grupo nuevo cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The "Juan Bautista" ("John the Baptist") group is represented by Carmen. This is a new group that brings together people from the same community who know each other well and trust in each other. In general the members make a living selling birds, shoes, bread, groceries in neighborhood stores, candy, empanadas, and some work in transportation with mototaxis. The business environment for the group members is quite competitive, but with their will to work and their experience they are able to make headway to provide their households with a better quality of life. The loan will be used to acquire materials, spare parts, ingredients and tools that will help the members generate more income to make their family finances stable. Despite being a new group the members have experience with group loans and know how to administer the funds well.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials, spare parts, ingredients and tools that will help make the members' businesses more efficient

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
La señora Casilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 54 años D. edad, estado civil casada, es madre D. 12 hijos (2 ellos fallecidos, 8 ya casados y solo 02 a su cargo) y no tiene estudios,  vive en el Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 02 años,  su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con el cual compró lanas para elaborar artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicita un préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar lanas, y elaborar llicllas (mantas), frazadas, fajas, y todo lo que se le pida especialmente para matrimonios.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para poder solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas que dan en Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Casilda belongs to the 'Flor Azangarina II' Communal Bank which is located in the district of Azangaro, province of Azangaro, department of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, and mother of twelve children (2 deceased, 8 now married, and just two still in her care). She did not complete her education and lives in the Ezequirl Urbiola neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost two years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles with which she bought wool to create handmaD. items. Now she is seeking a loan of 1000 new soles to be able to buy wool and make capes, blankets, sashes, and all similar articles that are asked for, especially for wedding couples. Her greatest desire is to continue working so she can proviD. for the family expenses. She likes the savings and the talks provided by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of wools of various colors.

loans.name: Hermenegildo German

texts.es: El señor Hermenegildo V., tiene 53 años de edad, reside en el bario Laureles Sur, soltero y con hijo que vive con el de 25 años, su negocio es la venta de rosquillas desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar para sobres salir adelante, inicio con fondos propios la venta de rosquilla en un semáforo de la Miguel Gutiérrez, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de rosquilla y comprar una mantenedora para vender fresco, helados y hielo para mejorar los ingresos y poder estar en mejores condiciones. Da las gracias  a la institución por el apoyo con el préstamo ya que se ha beneficiado para mantener sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sr. Hermenegildo V. is 53 years old. He is single and lives with his 25 year old son in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He has been selling donuts from a very young age. He started working to get ahead, so he decided to use his own funds to begin selling donuts at the Miguel Gutiérrez traffic crossing.

With his loan, he will buy donuts and a refrigerated display case so that he can sell cold drinks, ice cream, and ice. This will increase his earnings and improve his living situation. He thanks the institution for supporting him with this loan. This will help him maintain his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase donuts and a refrigerated display case

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Орифе 51 год. Разведенная и мать 2-х детей. Она развелась с мужем много лет назад, потому, что муж много пил и не приносил домой деньги. Орифа много работает чтобы прокормить и обучать своих детей, а также накопить денег на свадьбу сына. Сын Орифы тоже работает помогает матери. Орифа продает поп-корн и мороженное около рынков Джума-базар, Якшанбе-базар, а в остальные дни недели торгует около своего дома. Орифа хочет расширить свой бизнес и поставить аппарат для разлива холодных напитков.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Orifa is 51 years old. She is divorced and is a mother of two children. She has divorced her husband many years ago because her husband was a drunk and did not bring any money home. Orifa works a lot to be able to feed and give education to her children and also save money for her son's wedding. Orifa's son also works and helps his mother. Orifa sells popcorn and ice cream around Juma-bazar and Yakshanbe-bazar markets, and during the other days she sells near her house. Orifa wants to expand her business and install a machine for making cold drinks.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ice cream and popcorn

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is 42 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She sells sarongs and has been in the business for the past 16 years. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Jenifer's Group

texts.en:
N. Jenifer is a strong and determined lady who is willing to succeed through hard work. She is 42 years old and a widow with two children ages 20 and 24. She also cares for other siblings. 

She has a retail shop. She has been a shopkeeper for five years and is able to make 100,000UGX a week, which in turn helps her to take care of her family including paying their school fees. Before this, Jenifer was a poultry farmer but is now happy that her friendliness and accountability have kept her in business. 

In the future, she wants to become a wholesale supplier of goods so that she can sell more. She also envisions seeing all her children and those she takes care of attain the best of education so that they can get better jobs for self-sustainability. Jenifer needs a loan to help add more capital to her shop since this brings about stability in the supply of products and the smooth running of the business.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more products.

loans.name: Yasin's Group

texts.en: K. Yasin is 66 years old, married and has seven children between the ages of 16 and 40. Three of his children are still in school and he also takes care of two orphans. K. opened a kiosk four years ago with money he saved from years of farming, and has applied for a loan to stock it with new merchandise to sell to his customers. His other goal is to build a house so that he can stop renting, since this is costly and difficult for him in his old age.

loans.use: To restock his kiosk with more goods.

loans.name: Karema Hamida Group

texts.en:
Karema and Hamida are the group leaders of Karema Hamida group. There are four members in this group. They all want to take out a loan for their businesses to make them larger. So they have requested a group of loan of 56000 Afghani. 

Karema and Shafiqa want to take a loan for their husbands who have general stores. Hamida wants to receive a loan for her husband who has a cookie and bread shop. Shakila also wants to take a loan for her husband who has fruit shop. They admire this process of small loans.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith V., 49, from the village of San Pedro, is the married mother of four adult-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns and operates an aquaculture business whose main source of income comes primarily from harvesting and selling cultured oysters known as "talaba" in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month.

In 2007, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. she is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase materials needed to culture more oysters. This loan will be the her sixth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to culture more oysters

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou N. is 39 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham with her husband and four of her children. She and her husband are farmers who are able to make a living of US$4 of profit every day. Two of the children are in school and two are garment factory workers. Bou N. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase farmland to expand her cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to expand her cultivation.

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Лутфулло Хошимов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Лутфулло имеет среднее образование. Он более 10 лет работает в своей мастерской, в котором ремонтирует технику. Кредит просит для закупа сырья, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Lutfullo H. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. Lutfullo has secondary education. He has been working at his own repair shop, fixing technical equipment for over 10 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of raw materials in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is twenty two years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. She works hard to be able to provide for herself. She trades in pastries. She prepares and supplies pastries to other retailers in her community. Josephine also sells some of her pastries by the road side. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a member of Virgen del Carmen de Patria, a communal bank comprising 23 members in Patria, a town on the edge of the Amazon rainforest - 8 hours by rough road from Cusco.  Eufracio, 42 years old, lives with his common-law wife and five children in a home in Patria.

Eduardo is a farmer.  He has several small plots of land around Patria (some are located a couple of hours walking distance from his home) where he grows pineapples, yucca, rice and coca.  Eduardo is requesting a loan to hire day laborers to help him with his harvests and with bringing his produce to market.  He hopes that with the income he earns this year, he will be able to put a roof over his home and finish its partly-built second level.  

Eduardo appreciates your support, thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to hire day laborers to help with harvesting and bringing produce to market

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap N. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is 37 years old and is a farmer, owning a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living.

Mrs. Sopheap N. has a problem because it’s the time to plow her rice field but she did not plow it because she does not have oxen to plow it with. Moreover, she does not have enough money to pay someone else to plow it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to use to plow her field.

Mrs. Sopheap N.’s husband, Mr. ChabThouk Nuon, is a teacher in the local school who earns less income than needed to support their family. This couple has three children, one of whom works in the public sector while the others are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her rice field with

loans.name: Fatmata Sankoh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Fatmata S. group, named after the group’s leader. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,400,000 each to expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata S.. Fatmata is 46 and was born in Makeni. She is married with 6 children. Her husband is a businessman. 4 of her children are adults and 2 are attending secondary school.  For 10 years now, Fatmata has been selling items such as cigarettes, batteries, lollipops, powdered milk, drinks and bathing soap. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying more stock wholesale to add to her current inventory. 

(In the left of the photo is loan officer, Solomon Beah, handing over the loan to the group's leader)

loans.use: To buy stock wholesale for resale

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Simorn U., 55, lives several kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She has four children: three daughters and one son. One is a waitress, other one is a scarf weaver and two attend school.  

Simorn is a scarf weaver and scarf-weaving teacher. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase cotton thread for her daughter's scarf-weaving business.

loans.use: Buy cotton thread for her daughter’s scarf-weaving business.

loans.name: Bebe Awa Anisa Group

texts.en:
Anisa is a member of Bebe Awa Anisa group. She lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan, and is married with four children.

She is a tailor and has been involved in this business for more than six years. She is a very hardworking woman and sews all kinds of clothes, small and big sizes. She is happy that she can support her family members in a good way. 

She needs the loan to purchase cloth and different kinds of threads. She hopes to expand her business in the near future and have a shop instead of working in the house.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and different kinds of threads

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario de la cuidad de león, actualmente está trabajando en el centro de salud de telica, desempeñándose como enfermera auxiliar, es casada,
texts.en:
This client is from the city of León. She currently works in the Telica Health Center. She works as nurse’s aide. She is married.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room, floor, and ceiling

loans.name: Marigee Obut Group

texts.en: Marigee O. is from the village of Maikay, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Marigee is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marigee O. Group. Marigee is single. To make a living, Marigee runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marigee has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 4,600 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. On November 28, 2008, Marigee joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marigee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Marigee is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marigee from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fatheya

texts.en:
Fatheya R. is a 53-year-old wife and the mother of two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a retired teacher who owns land in the Jenin area where he grows seasonal fruits and vegetables.

Fatheya wants to help her husband work the land and improve its produce. Therefore, she took a loan from FATEN to purchase a greenhouse to grow more vegetables and fruits. Fatheya says that this will increase their income and improve the family's situation.

Fatheya likes taking care of plants, as is apparent from the background of the picture, where she stands at her front yard.

loans.use: Purchase a greenhouse

loans.name: Abibata

texts.fr:
Madame Abibata Kouyaté est âgée de 63 ans, mariée et mère 9 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari avec leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire  au  quartier Missira de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle commença très tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. 
Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière jusqu’à son mariage, elle mena beaucoup activités génératrices de revenus mais finit par opter la préparation et vente de l’encens. 
Elle  mène cette  activité  depuis 15 ans et  jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. 
 Dans le dessein de faire face à la demande clientèle,  elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 72 mois, après avoir fait 6 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt. 
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 20kg de sarakatanés et 10kg de magnonkiséni. Elle s’approvisionne en  République Islamique de Mauritanie et effectue sa vente, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 60 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de subvenir à certaines de ses charges (habillements, savons et médicaments). 
Son ambition est  de se  construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abibata Kouyaté is 63 years old, married and the mother of nine children. She lives with her children and her husband in a single-family household in the Missira borough of Segou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
