She began taking part in commercial activities at an early age, helping her mother sell food condiments. She spent several years with her as an apprentice until she married, after which she tried her hand at many activities to finally opt for the preparation and sale of incense. She has been running her business for 15 years and enjoys a solid reputation and a large customer following. In order to meet customer demand, she approached Soro Yiriwaso 72 months ago. After six group loans and three personal loans, all repaid in full, she is now requesting a fourth personal loan. The loan will be used to buy 20 kilos of sarakatané (bark from an Arabian tree) and 10 kilos of magnonkiséni (a plant). She gets her supplies from the Islamic Republic of Mauritania, and sells her product for cash or credit to mainly women customers. She hopes to attain monthly earnings of 60,000 FCFA, which will enable her to meet some of her needs (clothing, soap and medication). Her ambition is to build herself a dwelling.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare incense

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta P. is from the village of Bitag Pequeño, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 49 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells her raised animals.
In 2009, Violeta joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng R., 65, is an older woman and the widowed mother of three children. All three of them are single and are working in different fields. To earn a living, Kheng R. owns a small store where it is a good location to raise income. In her shop, she sells grocery items to people who live in the village. She has another financial earner in her son who is a bus driver in a small company. 

Additionally, the couple always takes time to cultivate a rice crop for the purpose of eating. Growing rice crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. There is a neighbor’s farmland in a good location for faming. Kheng R. wants to be the owner of this land but she lacks money to buy it. So, she is applying for a US$ 900 to purchase the piece of farmland, on which she will plant crops to generate extra income.

loans.use: To buy a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Tsevelmaa T. is a 36-year-old  single mother who lives with her three children in Uvs province, western Mongolia. She started her business in 2005 and since then she has been able to increase her working capital up to 7,000,000 MNT. She is a hard-working and polite woman. She wants to have her own food store and build a new house for her family as well. Tsevelmaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase food products in order to increase her revenue.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 43 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. She has also started raising hogs for fattening. She says she works hard to be able to provide for the needs of her family. She also hopes to be successful in her business.

Mercy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and feed for the pigs. This will be her 4th loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Nerayda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DINAMICO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Nerayda; ella tiene 29 años de edad y la socia es soltera,  ella se dedica a trabajar en la agencia de viajes de su madre, La socia es empleada de la agencia de viajes Cusco Andino; La socia estudió turismo y está estudiando ingles en un instituto su sueño es poder tener su propia agencia de viajes mientras está ahorrando y aprendiendo todo sobre la operación de grupos y paquetes turísticos. La socia quiere tener sus propios logros es por esto que ella se esfuerza en ahorrar y aprender mucho mas sobre todo este negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para incrementar sus ahorros y de esta manera tener su sueño en un tiempo menor.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nerayda is a member of the community bank named Dynamic. She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco. Nerayda is 29 years old and she is singe. She works together with her mother and they run a travel and tourism agency. She is an employee of the Cusco Andino travel agency. Nerayda studied travel and tourism and she is learning to speak English. Her dream is to one day have her own travel agency. She has been saving money and she has been learning to manage a travel business. Nerayda looks forward to making it own her own which is why she works hard to save money and learn as much as she can about running this type of business. She requests a loan to supplement her savings, so that her dream may become a reality in the near future. Nerayda appreciates and is grateful for the loan that is granted to her because is gives her the chance to grow and obtain a better quality of life. She is committed to the obligations of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supplement her savings, to set up a tourism business.

loans.name: Rado

texts.en:
Mr. Rado L., is 35 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Sok, is 33 years old. They live in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1995 and five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and the other two are still too young for school.  

Rado has been a mason since 2000, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He wants to buy construction materials to operate his business because he does not have enough materials.

Hence he is applying for a loan of $300 to make the purchases. 

Photo: Rado is not in the photo; instead his wife is in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Urbana, tiene 57 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella trabaja elaborando y vendiendo menus, la socia tiene un pequeño restaurante y se dedica a la cocina y todos los detalles que este le demanD.; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos y vasos para el restaurante.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Urbana, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Urbana is 57 years old, she is married and has 5 children. She prepares and sells meals: she owns a small restaurant and takes care of the cooking and of every detail that this activity requires. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients and glasses for the restaurant. She is thankful for the loan that will be granted to her, and at the same time she commits to comply with the repayment of her dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and glasses for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anjao

texts.en:
Anjao is a 33-year-old business-lady who runs A.’s Grocery. She is the mother of two children who are in school.

Anjao sells oranges, pawpaw, onions, bananas and tomatoes in her grocery shop and has been in the business for two years. She has been an active member of Embakasi Trust group in Faulu Kenya and says that since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her finances and loans.

Anjao has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a blender, crates of eggs and polythene bags for packaging her products. She hopes to open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a blender, crates of eggs and polythene bags for packaging her products

loans.name: Zhuzhanna

texts.en:
Zhuzhanna P. is a widow. She lives in Uzhgorod, Western Ukraine. Zhuzhanna owns a fast food vending kiosk. Her fast food place is very popular among customers. Zhuzhanna has been in business for 12 years. She has gained a good client base. Moreover, she has a reputation as a qualified cook and entrepreneur who always sells fresh and tasty food. Currently, Zhuzhanna makes 3100 Grivnyas in net profit each month. 

Zhuzhanna is seeking a loan of 7100 Grivnyas to increase her working capital and satisfy growing demand in the fall/winter season. More people live on fast food in the colder season, especially students, market entrepreneurs and taxi drivers. Zhuzhanna’s affordable pies, pastries, hamburgers and hot dogs are always served hot and fresh, which is the best option for low-income people or those working outside.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en:
Elyn N. is from the town of Banga. She is 28 years old. Elyn is married and has an 8-year-old child. To make a living, Elyn owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elyn also opened up a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products.

Elyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan S., a 27-year-old man, is married to Polline Mwacharo. Polline is a businesslady, and they have three children together. Two of their children are twins (they are two years old), and their third child is a three-year-old girl.

To earn a living, Duncan sells curios in the Nairobi Maasai market, where there are many local customers and tourists that buy from him. Duncan has been running this business for the last 12 years, and his monthly income is typically 31,000 KES. Duncan describes himself as a very hardworking man.

Duncan was introduced to KADET by another KADET client, and ever since he has been satisfied with KADET's services. He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500) to increase his stock of curios and to purchase other unique goods in order to attract additional customers. If the loan proceeds enable him to expand his business, he would like to open another shop. In the future, he plans on exporting his curios for additional income.

loans.use: To expand his business by increasing and diversifying his inventory

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat S. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the large city. His daughter attends a local primary school, while his son is in kindergarten. 

Ganbat operates a transportation service. He began his business in 2007 and has since gained significant experience. After several years of hard work, he has built a stable operation. He says, “I work hard every day to expand my business in order to improve my car as well as my house and fence.” 

Ganbat is requesting a 2000000 MNT loan in order to make necessary repairs on his car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Soth

texts.en: The man shown in the picture above, Mr. Soth S., is a 30-year-old married man who works as a vet in Kompong Chhnang Province. He has a life partner in his wife who is a local famer. Mr. Soth S. also assists his wife when he has free time from his work. Mr. Soth S.’s wife has been planting the rice crop on her farmland. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. In the past, Mr. Soth S.’s wife has always hired the neighbor’s cow to assist with the chore of plowing the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow, but her account does not have enough money in it. That is why Mr. Soth S. is looking for a loan as capital to support his wife’s farming business. He will use the loan to buy a cow to plow the farmland and to pick up rice during harvest seaS..

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Bendicion De Mujeres Trabajadoras 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Reyna is the coordinator of her group Bendicion de mujeres trabajadoras (Blessing of working women) 1, 2 .   Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally,  many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries.  The main economic activity here is the Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others.  This is an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Reyna makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Reyna is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza.  She has a food stand where she sells sandwiches, hot dogs, burgers and juices.  She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing meat, bread, juices, vegetables, sausages, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business to make it grow. Her long-term goal is to save enough money to expand and improve her business. She wants to be a successful businesswoman and attend the university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy meat, bread, juices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has four children.

In 2006, Ali opened his own food market because the competition in his local area is minimal. He is well known and has a good reputation.

He is requesting $1,800 to install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and buy two refrigerators. He is aiming to grow bigger and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To install an external ceiling at the entrance of his shop and buy two refrigerators

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza A. is 40 years old and married with one school-aged child. She is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a specialized retail store that sells ready-to-wear clothing. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling clothing and goods such as caps, blouses, sandals and blankets in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. 

Liza joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase inventory and provide working capital. Liza is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory to sell such as t-shirts and shoes. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business. 
 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as t-shirts and shoes

loans.name: Nazareen's Group

texts.en:
Nazareen, 34 years old, lives in the historic city of Lahore, Pakistan, famous for its culture and history. She lives in a small home with her husband and five daughters in the area of Green town. She moved here after her marriage. Three of Nazareen's daughters are students and the others stay at home because they are too young to attend school. Nazareen's husband, M. A., is a butcher by profession. He has operated a meat selling shop in the community for the past 10 years. He specifically sells goat meat. Due to his agreeable manner and the quality of his meat, he has a good number of customers. Nazareen is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She has a part-time business selling clothes to clients in her community. She purchases clothes from the famous Anarkali market and the Azam cloth market in Lahore and earns a good profit. She does this work to help her husband financially.

Nazareen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy some goats to help him fulfill his customers' orders and earn more profit. Nazareen is hopeful about the positive growth of his business after the loan investment. Nazareen is new lender with Asasah.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa L. es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Nube, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una belleza natural, cultural y arquitectónica la misma que es admirada por propios y extraños, su gente  mantiene su cultura y tradiciones siendo muy amables y cordiales.

Doña Rosa se encuentra de 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 17, 15, 13 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, su tercera hija estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en una vulcanizadora que es de su propiedad, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosa realiza los quehaceres domésticos en diferentes casas, labora de lunes a viernes hasta el medio día, esta actividad la realiza hace 7 años.
 
Se encuentra en el octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales para arreglar su casa ya que aun le  faltan  algunos acabados. Su meta es  viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Reina de la Nube” (Queen of the Cloud). She lives in the the city of Cuenca. This city experiences cold weather, but it has natural beauty, culture, and architecture that is admired by locals and outsiders. The people are friendly, courteous, and maintain their culture and traditions.

Doña Rosa is 42 years old, married, and has four children (ages 17, 15, 13, and 10). Her two oldest children work and help with the household expenses. Her third child, a daughter, is in high school while the youngest daughter attends elementary school in the city. Her husband repairs tires and has his own shop. Rosa and her husband worked together to build their own home.

Sra. Rosa performs the housekeeping duties for various families. She has been working in this job, Monday through Friday, for seven years.

Rosa is receiving her eighth loan from the Communal Bank. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of materials for remodeling her house since it lacks a few finishes. Her goal is to travel all over the world.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Leonila Aracely

texts.es:
Leonila, tiene 35 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con una hermana y un hijo de 17 años de edad, administra una Boutique, ella comenzó como vendedora en las calles, luego recibió el apoyo de su madre para instalar un negocio fijo, naciendo este negocio hace 3 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, surtiendo el negocio le ayudara a fortalecer y a proporcionar a los clientes una mejor variedad de productos como cosméticos y ropa. 
Esta oportunidad le dará más estabilidad y mejores ingresos para su hogar, las aspiraciones de ella son instalar un negocio amplio, propio y con mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
Leonila, 35, lives in San Miguel with a sister and a 17-year-old son.  She runs a boutique.  She started out as a street vendor but later got help from her mother to set up a fixed business.  This business was born three years ago.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to stock the store.  It will help her strengthen it to provide customers with a wider variety of products like cosmetics and clothing.

This opportunity will give her more stability and better income for her home.  Her hopes are to set up a spacious business of her own with lots of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lilia M. owns a sari-sari store.  She is 48 years old, married, and a resident of Barangay Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she operates a sari-sari store and sells snacks. For 10 years, she was able to maintain her business even in hard times.  Now, she is earning an average net income of not less than P10,000.  This amount is so helpful for Mrs. M. and for her family. 

Mrs. M. joined PAGLAUM MPC in 2008 because she was interested in the organization's products and services.  
As part of Mrs. M.'s 10th loan cycle, she was given the privilege of obtaining the amount of P25,000 to add her capital for her existing sari-sari store and snack vending business. The future income from this business will be used for her daily basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future. She is hoping that someday she will be able to expand her little stall and also to improve her business.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for her sari-sari store and snack vending

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Jurial

texts.en:
Jurial G. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 43 years old. Jurial is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Jurial owns & operates a business providing motorela, or habal-habal, services to local community members. Jurial has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jurial joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jurial is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jurial from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a farmer in Muranga Town in Central Kenya. She has had a mixed farm for the last 20 years. She is married with two children; one child is still at school. Her farm produces milk, bananas and coffee, which she sells to the local market. She is helped by two farmhands.

Rose has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow and a water pump. She says this loan will help improve her income and her family's living standards and make the water supply for the farm more secure. She adds that the future is looking good with the availability of agricultural loans.

Rose, however, observes that animal feed costs are still a challenge.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and a water pump.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badenya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de poissons, de tubercules et de galettes.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Badenya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des poissons, des tubercules et de la farine de blé.                                                                        
LALA C. compte acheter des poissons avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are all married women who average 28 years of age and four children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Nalla, subprefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, and through ties of kinship and friendship. They sell fish, tubers, and flat cakes. This is their first group loan, which they will use to buy fish, tubers, and wheat flour.

LALA C. intends to buy fish from resellers in Fana. She conducts her sales daily, for cash or credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which she will use to make loan repayments, to pay contributions for social ceremonies, and to reinvest in her business activity.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 24 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Desde muy niña aprendió las tácticas del negocio, pues trabajaba en el puesto de venta de sus padres. La educación que le dieron y algunos ahorros decidió independizarse y forjarse por si sola en el ámbito comercial. Hoy tiene su propio negocio, que consiste en comprar productos a los campesinos tales como: café, cacao, achiote, maíz y palillo, oriundos de la zona selvática; además cuenta con el apoyo de 02 trabajadores quienes se encargan de cargar y pesar los kilogramos de cada producto. Es así que con su carro recorren varias comunidades en busca de productos, una vez almacenado una buena cantidad lo vende a las empresas acopiadoras quienes le pagan un gran porcentaje por cada kilogramo de carga entregada. Su negocio le es muy rentable, por que al margen de lo que vende las empresas le dan incentivos cada año. Las épocas de lluvias y derrumbes en las carreteras, son el impedimento porque obstruyen el camino y perjudican el traslado de la carga. Los planes para el futuro es seguir trabajando con el mismo ahínco que le caracteriza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP  y esta apta a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. El  crédito solicitado, le servirá como capital para comprar café, caco, maíz y achiote a los campesinos.
texts.en:
Edith is 24 years old.  She is a happy, single, hard-working, young woman that is eager to succeed in life.  She lives in her own house and what she would like most is to earn a good living so that she can give her future family financial stability.  

She started learning business strategies at a young age since she worked for her parents at their sales stand.  With the education they gave her and some savings she decided to become independent and forge ahead alone in the business sector.  Today she has her own business.  She buys products from farmers in the jungle such as coffee, cocoa, achiote [the natural pigment annatto is derived from this shrub], corn and palillo [a condiment].  She also has the help of 2 workers who are responsible for packing and weighing each product, thus allowing her to drive her car around to the various communities in search of products.  When she has a good quantity stored she sells it to middlemen who pay her a large percentage for each kilogram of product.  Her business is very profitable because apart from what she sells the middlemen give her incentives every year.  The rainy season and the landslides on the roads are a challenge because they block the roads and make delivery of the products difficult.  Her plans for the future are to continue working with the same zeal that is characteristic of her.  

This is her first loan with MFP and she is capable of making her payments on time since she wants to be able to access more credit in the future.  The loan she is requesting will give her capital to buy coffee, cocoa, corn and achiote from farmers.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, cocoa, corn and achiote from farmers.

loans.name: Rosa Yadira

texts.es:
Rosa de 39 años,  vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución).Su esposo trabaja como mecánico en un empresa llamada Espalsa, tiene cuatros hijos que están en colegios fiscales. Tiene una tienda de víveres.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás abrió una pequeña tienda poco a poco la fue adecuando. Labora diariamente vende víveres como arroz, caramelos, café, azúcar. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en mercadería para su tienda compras de víveres como aceites, arroz, azúcar, varios para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, lives in la Primavera de Duran (an urban area which originally had hilly terrain, with several hills, streams and lakes that still remain part of an ecology in solution). Her husband works as a mechanic at a company called Espalsa.  She has four children who are in state schools.  

Rosa also has a grocery store.  Some time ago she opened a small shop that she slowly adapted . She works daily selling supplies such as rice, candy, coffee, and sugar. With the help of the requested loan she plans to invest in merchandise for her grocery store such as oil, rice, sugar, and more to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy candy, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 40-year-old woman who is married to Abd Aljaleel. They have five children. Maha wanted to support her husband and her family, but at the same time wanted to dedicate herself to her children, so she opened a small food store in their neighborhood for her husband two years ago, and it has been running very successfully. Now Maha has applied for a loan to buy products for the store that their customers are asking for but that they do not presently stock.
Since Maha is a conservative person, her husband Abd Aljaleel appears in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more food and drink products for her food store.

loans.name: Marat

texts.ru:
Марату 40 лет и он проживает селе Цав, Сьюникского региона. Марат женат, имеет двух сыновей: старшему 12 лет, младшему 11. 
Сельским хозяйством Марат занимается более 10 лет. На своей ферме разводит крупный рогатый скот, свиней и пчел; выращивает картофель и фасоль. Сельскохозяйственные продукты (говядину, свинину, молоко, мед, картофель и фасоль) реализует в магазинах и лавках городаов Капан и Каджаран. Жена Марата помогает ему на ферме и таким образом они содержат свою семью.
Сумма кредита в 1.000.000 драм необходима Марату для организации уборки сена, приобретения нескольких ульев, рамок для меда и парафина.
texts.en:
Marat is 40 years old, and he lives in the village of Tsav in the Syuniksky region. Marat is married.  He has two sons, an eleven-year-old and a twelve-year-old.  
 
Marat has been working in agriculture for more than ten years. On his farm he raises cattle, pigs, and bees.  He grows potatoes and string beans. His produce (beef, pork, milk, honey, potatoes and string beans) are sold in shops and booths in the cities of  Kapan and Kadzharan. Marat's wife helps him on the farm, and thus they support the family.

Marat needs to take out a loan for 1,000,000 drams to harvest hay and to acquire several beehives and frames for honey and beeswax.

loans.use: to harvest hay and to acquire several beehives and frames for honey and beeswax.

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagro lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Margarita del Carmen de 39 años quien se dedica al comercio de productos Avon y ropa desde hace 10 años. Ella inicio con la empresa Avon, ya que esta proporciona sus productos al crédito y luego fue creciendo e invirtiendo. 
Ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos a su cargo de 17 y 12 años de edad y su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Las otras integrantes son Brígida de 24 años comerciante de productos Avon y ropa, y Berta Adilia vende comida desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The Milagro group is comprised of three hard-working, enterprising women, one of whom is Mrs. Margarita del Carmen, 39, who has been selling Avon products and clothing for the last ten years.  She started with Avon since they supply products on a credit basis, and then she began growing and investing.

She is single and has two children under her care, ages 17 and 12.  Her goal is to see her family get ahead.

The other members of the group are Brígida, 24, who sells Avon products and clothing, and Berta Adilia, who has been selling food for three years.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 40 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 19 years old.
Juvy is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 18 years. She and her husband now own a rice field in Banga, South Cotabato. According to Juvy, they earn about 10,000 PHP per month from their farming business. Juvy has requested a loan to purchase six sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. Juvy hopes that her business will help to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Maria Rosaura

texts.es: Maria Rosaura: de 29 años ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda desde hace 2 años en la comunidad donde vive,ella nos cuenta que inicio su negocio vendiendo un poco de mercaderia en ropa de segunda,ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de una paca de ropa de segunda ya que nececita invertir mas para poder generar mas ganancias y aumentar sus ventas y asi de la misma manera estar mejor economicamente.
texts.en: Maria Rosaura is 29 years old.  She has been working selling second-hand clothing for the last two years in the community where she lives.  She tells us that she began her business by selling a small amount of second hand clothing merchandise.  Now she is requesting this loan for the purchase of a bale of second hand clothes, as she needs to invest more in order to generate more earnings and grow her sales, and in this same manner to become better off financially.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years.  He is 43 years old, married to Fresiah and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Peter hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Frencher

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulties, Frencher did not pursue his college education. He is now 20 years old and still hoping that he will earn a degree later. In the meantime, he is engaged in vegetable production to earn an income and save for his education. He endures the hardships of life and is strongly determined to be successful someday. 

He aims to increase his vegetable production to earn more income but he has insufficient capital, therefore he is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his vegetable production. He believes that the loan will help him to increase his production and income. 

He hopes that this year he will earn and save more money so that he will be able to continue his studies this coming school year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain vegetable production

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en:
Nhu is 42 years old and is married. She has two children, a son and a daughter, and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by making and selling beverages and many kinds of foods for meals. They started this business ten years ago.

Nhu requires a loan to purchase new furniture for her food stall and repair her house. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase turnover. She also hopes that this will increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for her food stall and repair her house.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: Justo, de 53 años, convive con Domitila su esposa. Ambos tuvieron 2 hijos: Roxana y Viviana. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquila, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Este hombre hábil y emprendedor; genera sus ingresos en el oficio de artesano, que desde los 18 años hasta hoy practica. Sus principales tejidos constan de ponchos y mantas conocidas como “gachacatas”, que sirven para cargar niños en la espalda. Gracias a su dedicación y creatividad, sus tejidos generan grandes pedidos de compradores de las diferentes ciudades del país, los que constantemente visitan su taller, para poder comprarlos. Sus buenas ganancias le permitieron ahorrar y hace tan solo tres años, abrió su propio “grifo”; donde vende combustible a los diferentes autos que llegan a su localidad. Según cuenta le va muy bien pues no existe uno en la zona y los diferentes chóferes lo visitan constantemente. Además agradece el apoyo de su esposa quien cuida a las 50 ovejas que posee. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz del trabajo realizado en todo este tiempo, “ya aprendí a ahorrar y proyectarme”, afirma. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Justo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios cilindros de combustible para continuar su negocio.
texts.en: Justo is 53 years old and he lives with his wife, Domitila. They have 2 children together: Roxana and Viviana. They live as a family in a house rental located in the locality of San Pedro de Cajas. This capable and enterprising man generates an income as an artisan, an occupation he started when he was 18 and still practices today. His primary knitting projects include ponchos and blankets known as "gachacatas". They are use to carry children on one's back. Thanks to his dedication and creativity his knitting has generated large orders from buyers of different cities in the country. They constantly visit his workshop to make purchases. His considerable profits have permitted him to save money and in only three years' time he was able to open his own dispensary. He sells fuel to cars that come to his locality. He says that it is going very well because there are no gas stations in the region and several drivers visit him constantly. He is thankful for his wife's support because she takes care of their flock of 50 sheep. He is a member of the communal bank named "Telarmachay" and it is his fourth loan with MPF (Kiva Field Partner). He is happy with the work he has accomplished during this time. "I have learned to save money and to focus", he affirms. For this reason he promises to be on time with his loan payments. On receiving his support, Justo will invest the funds he requests in the purchase of several barrels of fuels to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase several barrels of fuel.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is a 35-year-old, hardworking woman. She is married and has six children. She lives in a semi-permanent house with her family of seven people in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a piggery project that she has been operating for the last 10 years. Her family dream is to own a large piggery project despite the challenges of price fluctuations and the high cost of feed. Teddy needs the loan to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.use: to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas and perfumes, cosmetics, sandals, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Narcisa

texts.es:
Mayra tiene la edad de 52 años, se dedica a la  venta de ropa nueva y cosmeticos, su condicion de vivienda es muy humilde, y es por tal razon, esta optando al credito, en donde tiene mas facilidad de pago, y equilibrar sus gastos.
Hoy en dia cuenta con el apoyo de su unica hija, que vive con ella, ya que los otros dos viven independiente, siendo madre soltera .
Lo que hara con este nuevo prestamo, es cambiar el techo hasta donde ajuste con el material a comprar, en laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, clavos ya que tiene que ir por parte, para poder ajustar, ya que su solicitud va conforme a su disponibilidad de pago. Siendo su  meta, junto a su hija, el poder hacer esta mejora que es de gran necesidad habitacional.
texts.en:
Mayra, age 52, sells new clothing and cosmetics. The condition of her home is very modest. For this reason, she has elected to secure a loan because the payments are very convenient and will help even out her expenses. Today she has the support of her only daughter who lives with her. Her other two children are independent. Mayra is a single mother.

This new loan will be used replace the roof, so Mayra will buy materials such as sheets of zinc, wood beams, and nails. The loan amount on her application was adjusted based on her ability to repay. Along with her daughter, Mayra has established a goal of completing this improvement since it is a great need in their home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for replacing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Nedaa

texts.en:
Nedaa is a supportive wife who is married to Mohammad. Mohammad works in one of the Jordanian universities; he also has artistic talent which is what he does in his free time and based on his orders.

Nedaa now has applied for a loan in order to support her husband and open a small painting workshop for him to paint pictures to sell and make that their second source of income.

Because Nedaa is a conservative person, she has asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To help her husband open a small painting workshop.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Genalyn has a motorcycle with a cart from which she sells snacks like coconut juice, banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar), and gulaman juice. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Genalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Pedro Agustin

texts.es: Don Pedro de 37 años de edad, originario de Estelí, padre de tres hijos, de oficio agricultor y comerciante. Con mas de 15 años de experiencia en el área de siembra y comercialización de hortalizas. Este es su segundo crédito en Kiva, pues el primer préstamo fue de mucho éxito lo ocupo para siembra de cebolla gracia a la buena venta logro comprarse una camioneta que utiliza para transportar su producto. El solicita el este segundo crédito para compra de insumos, fertilizantes, abono y pago de mano de obra para siembra de cebolla. Pues espera que su producción sea de mucho calidad y buenos rendimientos como fue la primera siembra. En esta etapa lo esta apoyando sus hijos para sembrara en conjunto y aprendan a lidiar con el negocio pues su  meta principal es darle una buena educación y nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is 37 years old and originally from Estelí.  He is the father of three children, and works as a farmer and businessman.  He has 15 years of experience in growing and selling vegetables. 

This is his second loan with Kiva, as he had great success with the first loan which he used for growing onions.  Thanks to his good sales, he was able to buy a truck that he uses to transport his products.

He is requesting the second loan to purchase supplies, fertilizers, and manure, and to pay for labor for growing onions.  He also hopes that his produce will be of excellent quality and will result in good yields like his first planting.

At this stage, his children are helping him with the farming and are learning to deal with the business side of things.  His primary goal is to give them a good education and raise the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing onions

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 100,000 to help renovate her rental houses. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of cement, sand and color wall paints. She dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future and earn more income. 

She thanks Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity to access loans to improve her mode of living.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cement, sand and color wall paints.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is an industrious housewife who helps her husband in managing their onion farming business to ensure a good harvest. She is 49 years old and has three children. Despite the hardships of living, they aim to improve their sources of income and support the education of their children. They have been farmers for almost 20 years, and they earn a profit of P25,000 in every harvest season. They use their income for their necessities and to finance their children's education.

They planned to expand their onion plantation to ensure a high yield. But due financial constraints, Norma is asking for an additional P20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for onion production. She believes that their patience and hard work will bear a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for onion production

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Empresarias” está conformado por 08 socios responsables, que llevan trabajando 08 meses con el Programa- Prosperidad siendo Gladys una de las integrantes. Gladys tiene 54 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de  lencerías la cual lleva 03 años en este negocio, aparte ofrece productos de belleza de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar, Gladys no cuenta con un local  es por ello que trabajo a pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, gracias a estas actividades le ha permitido a Gladys apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Uno de sus anhelos es de tener un local donde pueda exhibir sus lencerías. Con el crédito que recibió piensa comprar brasieres y trusas pues tiene pedidos por entregar. La Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres Empresarias” agradecen a los prestamistas ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Empresarias communal bank is made up of eight responsible members who have been working with the Prosperidad program for eight months.  Gladys is one of the members.  Gladys is 54 years old and married, and has two grown children.  She works selling lingerie, and has been in this business for three years.  She also sells beauty products to get additional income for her home.  Gladys does not have a shop, so she works through orders that her customers request from her.  Thanks to these activities Gladys has been able to help her husband with the household expenses.  One of her desires is to have a place where she can show her lingerie.

With the loan she received, she plans to buy bras and girdles because she has orders to fulfill.  The Mujeres Empresarias communal bank thanks the lenders because they make it possible for them to make progress.

loans.use: to buy bras and girdles.

loans.name: La Fuente 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Clautide is the coordinator of the Group La Fuente (The Fountain) 1, 2 & 3. The members live in the slums located to the north of Santo Domingo. This group is located in one of the poorest community to the north of Santo Domingo. Clautide sells fruits and vegetables. This is the first loan she has requested from Esperanza, and she is planning to purchase oranges, bananas, pinneaples, papayas, and other fruits and vegetables. She is very excited about this loan, which made it possible to reinvest in her business and expand her sales into more products and clients.

Clautide tells us that her challenges has been to start her business, going forward and to raise her children. She is a single mother of two children, and they live together with her.  Her business profits will be used to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support. 

In this loan, we are adding three pictures, they were taken in their community. The three pictures complete the group of 15 members.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabian es una persona que se ha caracterizado por tener un gran talento para el arte y ser muy trabajador. Fabian se capacitó gracias a un curso en una entidad, el cual le enseñó la actividad de la carpintería, y gracias a esto ha podido montar un negocio del cual genera los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Fabian cuando montó su negocio contaba con muy bajo capital, lo que hizo que su taller no tenga todas las máquinas necesarias para poder trabajar correctamente. Gracias a que los productos de Fabian son de muy buena calidad, ha tenido muy buenas ventas, hasta el punto que hay ocasiones en las que debe dejar de responder a ciertos pedidos de sus clientes por la poca capacidad de producción que tiene. Con el ánimo de mejorar esta situación, Fabian espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina cortadora y la compra de insumos como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros para hacer su negocio más productivo.

Fabian espera que de esta manera pueda explotar el mercado potencial de su negocio. Fabian también espera que su hermana pueda trabajar con el, pues actualmente tiene grandes dificultades, por lo que Fabian quiere generar un puesto de trabajo en su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de una máquina cortadora y la compra de insumos como madera, pegante, clavos, entre otros para hacer su negocio más productivo.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has three children and has been doing this work for four years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'grazing.' His biggest challenge is 'tick elimination.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'tet-cattle.'

George was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'coaxed by my neighbour to join the Juhudi Kilimo group.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'animals should be kept well to enjoy good returns from them.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, George replied, 'enjoy good health due to money earned.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. George owns a cow, poultry, and bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sidilia

texts.en: Sidilia, 26, lives with her husband and three children in Chiredzi District. She runs a stand at the local flea market to pay her children’s school fees and help support her family. She used her first loan from Kiva to purchase more stock to improve sales. She is requesting a second Kiva loan to construct a large boutique and expand her business. She plans to use the profit she earns to build a house for her family. Sidilia volunteers at the nearby high school as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading discussion groups on how students can create a better world. She will repay the interest on her social-interest loan through her weekly volunteer work at the high school.

loans.use: To construct a large boutique

loans.name: Véronique

texts.en: Née en 1960 à Aného, Madame A. Véronique est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Son époux en retraite depuis 5 ans n’arrive plus à assumer les charges de la famille car sa pension de retraite est très insuffisante. Exerçant comme activité le tissage et la vente des nattes, Madame A. arrive à subvenir aux charges du ménage avec son petit  revenu. Elle vient de recevoir une importante commande de 400 nattes d’une gamme spéciale. Avec son équipe, elle a décidé de satisfaire cette commande provenant d’un centre de formation pour jeunes délinquants. Les nattes commandées sont de grandes dimensions et demandent plus de travail parce qu’il faut y insérer le logo du centre. Seulement,  Madame A. n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour faire ce travail. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $750 pour acheter les matériaux de fabrication et engager quelques personnes pour que le travail soit rapide. Cette commande va beaucoup augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et changer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: acheter les matériaux de fabrication

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Mahammadali

texts.en: H. Mahammadali is 46 years old and married with 5 children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh. H. runs a small food store and has applied for a 1200 USD loan to improve his business and cover his large family's needs.

loans.use: Going to enlarge his food store

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mr. Thoung K. is a 57 year old widower who has one child who is a garment worker. Thoung K. currently earns $1 a day farming and selling fruit, and would like to expand his business by purchasing more fruit to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel, 46 years old, mother of 3 children (two boys and a girl), owns a little cafeteria. She started the business 20 years ago with the help of her partner, who is a clerk in a supermarket. Isabel prepares food in the afternoon and sells during the evenings in Santo Domingo, since Hato Nuevo is located about one hour from the capital. She also sells natural juices and alcoholic drinks as well as energy drinks.

During these last three years, Isabel's clientele has been expanding, so that she can't always offer everyone the same amount of food and drinks that she had been selling. To remedy that situation, Isabel is planning to buy more provisions in order to prepare more food. She is also thinking about hiring a woman to help her in the business. She is requesting a loan that can help her reach these goals quickly. This way, she'll be able to increase her income and improve her family situation.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs so as to prepare more food for her little cafeteria and to hire a woman to help prepare foods

loans.name: Esther Marina

texts.es:
Esther works every day to better her family and has always been in search of new business opportunities that offer benefits for the wellbeing of her family. She is the mother of 6 children of whom three are still under her tutelage. To support them better, she made the decision to open in her home a space that offers Internet services to the whole community and also allows her to pay attention to the care of her children. With them she has organized a work plan in teams. This has allowed her to see the growth of her business and the benefits that come along with it. Now she is looking to the future to install another Internet establishment. Esther knows that this will require hard work, and she will continued to be motivated by seeing her children improve in their studies. She wants to buy another computer that will allow her to increase her service capacity and prepare the small establishment for the comfort and greater permanence of her clients and for this she needs a loan. Esther is greatful in advance for your collaboration.

Translated by Princeton University Language Project.

Doña Ester, trabaja cada día para ver superada a su familia y siempre ha estado en búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades de negocio que le ofrezca ganancias para el bienestar de su familia.Ella es madre de seis hijos de las cuales tres todavía están bajo su tutela y continuo deseo de otorgarles lo mejor ha posibilitado la decisión de abrir en su casa un espacio en el que ofrece los servicios de Internet a su comunidad entera y que además le permite permanecer atenta al cuidado de sus hijos, con ellos ha organizado todo un esquema de trabajo en equipo, esto les ha permitido observar el crecimiento de su negocio además de los beneficios que acarrea consigo. Ahora piensa a futuro instalar otro establecimiento de Internet, Doña Ester, sabe que todo esto requiere de un trabajo arduo y es por ello que seguirá motivándose al ver a sus hijos superándose mediante el estudio. Ella desea comprar otra computadora que le permita acrecentar su capacidad de servicio y acondicionar el pequeño establecimiento para comodidad y mayor permanencia de sus clientes y para ello necesita de un préstamo. Doña Ester agradece por anticipado tu solidaria colaboración..

loans.use: Purchase of a computer and preparation of a small internet service center.

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza is a married, 26-year-old mother of one son. She owns a clothing store that sells apparel for men, women, and children.

During the festivities of the Virgin of Caacupé, she had a great number of sales. She sells sweaters, shorts, skirts, shirts, etc.

She is requesting this loan to buy more clothing for the season, since sales have increased considerably and she wishes to broaden her selection of apparel.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Liza, es una señora joven de 26 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños.

Durante las festividades de la Virgen de Caacupé, comenta Liza, tuvo una gran cantidad de ventas. Entre algunas de sus mercaderías que vende podemos citar: remeras, shorts, faldas, camisas, etc.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercaderías de temporada ya que las ventas han aumentado considerablemente y desea ampliar su stock.

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters, shorts, shirts, jeans, skirts, tops, etc.

loans.name: Olujoke

texts.en: Olujoke S. is married with 3 children, is 32 years old, and hails from Ajamgbadi area in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a stylist and sells weavon (a hair weaving product) and attachments (extensions). She has been in LAPO as a secretary of a union since 2005. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more weavon and relaxer for sale.

loans.use: To buy more weavon and hair relaxer.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Kanten

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Kanten is famous in her village as a seller of sesajen (Hindunese prayer aid/offerings made of coconut leaves and flowers) that is used usually in "Ngaben" ceremony (cremation) and marriage. Ni Wayan Kanten's has many clients, from her neighbors to surrounding villagers. This is because Ni Wayan Kanten is famous for the quality and cheap price of her products. Ni Wayan Kanten tries to fill smaller orders, but she gets two temporary daily workers when she gets bigger orders. For small batch, she can spend about $4.40 in cost to get $11 revenue. With $6.60 daily profit , Ni Wayan kanten owns 10 Canang Sari clientsdaily. Every client buys 100 Canang Sari for $1.10 per 100 pieces. For bigger orders, she gets more profit. She plans to use the loan to purchase more ingredients to buy more ingredients so she can step up production.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Wayan Kanten sudah terkenal di desanya sebagi penjual Sesajen ( salah satu sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu yang tebuat dari bungan dan daun kelapa miuda ) yang biasanya dipergunakan oleh umat Hindu sebagai sarana persembahyangan baik untuk upacara Ngaben ( upacara bakar mayat ) maupun untuk pernikahan. Pelanggan Ni Wayan Kanten cukup banyak, mulai dari masyarakat yang ada disekitar tempat tinggalnya sampai ke desa –desa tetangga yang jauh dari rumahnya. Hal ini dikarenakan Ni Wayan Kanten sudah terkenal dengan hasil produksinya yang baik dan harganya terjangkau. Jika jumlah pesanan sedikit maka Ni Wayan Kanten kerjakan sendiri, tetapi jika dalam jumlah yang banyak maka Ni Wayan Kanten dibantu oleh dua orang tenaga kerja yang diberi upah harian. Dalam sehari jumlah biaya yang dikeluarkan Rp. 40.000,- untuk biaya produksi dalam partai kecil dengan penghasilan Rp 100.000. Dengan keuntungan tiap hari mencapai Rp. 60.000,- NiWayan Kanten memiliki 10 pelanggan Canang Sari setiap hari. Setiap pelanggan membeli 100 buah canang sari dengan harga Rp.10.000 untuk 100 biji. Jika ada pesanan dalam jumlah banyak atau partai besar maka keuntungan yang didapat akan meningkat. Dari modal yang didapat ini dipergunakan untuk membeli bahan baku dalam usahanya.

loans.use: Purchase goods to be sold like flowers and coconut

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es:
In spite of his economic status, Mr. Gualberto keeps working very hard to improve his situation and open up a carpentry workshop. He would like to offer a higher quality of life to his parents, who are his greatest treasure. This hard working man struggles every day to increase the number of commissions and customers he receives. Little by little he moves to the end goal of owning a fully stocked carpentry workshop. He needs a loan to invest in acquiring work tools and raw materials to decorate his beautiful wooden furniture that is in such high demand from his customers. Your invaluable support will help Mr. Gualberto realize his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

A pesar de su situación económica don Gualberto sigue trabajando con mucha insistencia para sacar adelante e implementar su pequeño taller de carpintería, y así ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a sus ancianos padres quienes son su mayor tesoro. Este emprendedor hombre se esfuerza constantemente para incrementar sus pedidos y mejorar la calidad de los mismos, y así poco a poco cumplir uno de sus más grandes anhelos de poseer una carpintería con todos los implementos necesarios.Hoy requiere para ello un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en adquirir herramientas de trabajo y materia prima para finalmente elaborar hermosos y variados muebles que son muy solicitados por sus clientes. Tu indispensable aporte permitirá concretar los sueños de este emprendedor y noble hombre.

loans.use: Purchase of tools and raw materials

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en: Sobia A. is the group leader of a small group of five women. She married a couple of years ago and has one daughter who is one and a half years old. Sobia’s husband works at a local factory and earns a meager income. He feels the need to start his own business and therefore needs a loan. He will use the loan to start an auto spare parts shop. He is very hopeful and wants to increase his income to give a better future to his daughter. Sobia’s group members are: Venice B. (who wants to buy iron for her business), Azra B. (who will buy a dairy cow for her milk business), Sughran B. (who wants to buy spare parts) and Rubina S. (who will buy construction supplies).

loans.use: to start an auto spare parts business

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en:
Gullu G., 52, owns her own business breeding livestock. She started raising livestock in 1983 and since that time she has become very experienced in this field. She and her husband are unemployed and this is their only financial resource for the family. She lives with her family in Bilasuvar in a settlement for internally displaced persons.

Gullu has decided to expand the number of calves she is raising and wants to purchase additional three calves at US$ 400 each. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of US$ 1200.

loans.use: to purchase three additional calves

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Oumou K. is a 49 year old married woman with 8 children, currently living in a monogamous family with her children in Odjoumabougou in the district of Ouelessebougou, Kati area, in the Koulikoro region.

She has been involved with the micro-finance institution SORO YIRIWASO for 4 years, and is on her fourth individual loan after 3 group loans (solidarity loans). All of her previous loans have been repaid properly.

With this loan, she intends to buy 25 containers of Aloevera products from the ALOE VERA sales representation in Bamako and sell them in Ouelessebougou. She has been running this business for 4 years and sells her merchandise generally to men. With 300,000 CFA, she intends to realize a profit of 65,000, and will be able to contribute to the family expenses and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Oumou K. est une femme mariée de 49 ans,mère de 8 enfants et vivant dans une famille monogame avec ses enfants à Odjoumabougou dans la commune de Ouelessebougou cercle de Kati région de Koulikoro.

Elle est en relation avec l’institution de micro finance SORO YIRIWASO dépuis 4 ans et est à son quatrième prêt individuel après 3 prêts de groupe (pret solidaire).Tous ces prets précèdents ont été bien remboursés correctement

Avec ce pret, elle compte acheter 25 bidons de produits Aloevera auprès de la répresentation ALOE VERA à Bamako et les vendre à Ouelessebougou. Elle mène cette activité dépuis 4 ans et vend généralement sa marchandise aux hommes. Avec 300.000CFA, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 65.000 CFA et pourra contribuer aux dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans ses activités.

loans.use: To buy ALOE VERA products

loans.name: Laidou (Promesse) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Laidou group are married. Their average age is 22; they have, on average, 3 children and live in traditional families with their spouses, co-spouses, and children in the village of Konobougou, Prefecture of Baroueli (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali).

They sell various small items (cosmetics, condiments, clothing, sugar, tea, cigarettes, etc.)

The women of Laidou group do their purchasing essentially on market fair days in Konobougou from wholesalers who are specialized in the items mentioned above. They generally sell retail on a cash basis at established market stalls or as ambulant salespeople in the village. Their clientele is mostly female with a few males.

The group is presently on its third loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and all the preceding loans were reimbursed in a timely manner.

They want to use this loan to buy: 5 cartons of cigarettes, 1 small case of tubes of skin crème, 5 kg of fish, 10 pants, shirts or dresses for children, and a large quantity of condiments.

With this loan they hope to make a weekly average profit of 2500 FCFA, i.e., monthly 10,000 FCFA per member.

Each of them hopes to open a little shop and specialize in one item.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupe Laidou sont mariés avec une moyenne d’age de 22 ans 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs époux, coépouses et enfants dans le village de Konobougou préfecture de Baroueli( Région de Ségou République du Mali)

Elles exercent le petit commerce d’articles divers (cosmétique, condiments alimentaires, habillements, sucre, thé, cigarettes etc.)

Les femmes du groupe Laidou s’approvisionnent essentiellement les jours de foire du village de Konobougou auprès des grossistes qui se sont spécialisés dans le domaine des articles ci-dessus cités. Elles revendent généralement en détail au comptant de façon fixe au marché ou ambulante dans des tasses de porte en porte au niveau du village. La clientèle à dominance féminine compte quelques hommes.

Le groupe est à son troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.

Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter : 5 cartouches de cigarettes 1 petit carton de tube et lotion pour la peau 5kg de poissons 10 pantalons chemises ou robes pour enfants et une grande quantité de condiments.

Elles espèrent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice hebdomadaire moyen de 2500FCFA soit un mensuel de 10 000FCFA par membre.

Elles souhaitent ouvrir chacune une boutique et se spécialiser au d’un article.

loans.use:
Purchase of various items for re-sale

Achat de divers articles

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: A. Halima is 37 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur, and she makes a living selling foodstuff like tea, sunflower oil, infant formula, mayonnaise, butter and sweets. She rents a stall in one of her town's central markets, and has been in business for 21 years. Her older son helps Halima with the business, and the income she produces helps her meet her family's expenses. Halima works very hard to give her children a good education and make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of her elder son as begins university, Halima has applied for a loan of $1,000 to increase the range of goods she has to sell. She will repay the loan in 12 months. Halima thanks Kiva lenders for their support and promises to pay the loan in time. She is hoping for your help.

loans.use: To buy additional food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ni Komang Wenti

texts.id: Memiliki 3 orang putri yang 2 diantaranya sudah duduk di bangku sekolah tentu sangat membebani keuangan keluarga Komang Wenti yang sudah pas-pasan. Disamping juga harus mencukupi kebutuhan lainnya. Suaminya yang hanya seorang petani dengan hasil yang tidak terlalu banyak membuat Komang harus ikut berusaha mendukung ekonomi keluarga. Untuk itulah Komang berusaha dengan memelihara babi di rumahnya dan masuk anggota kelompok ternak Kembang Mekar. Dengan modal sendiri serta pinjaman dari DINARI, Komang mampu membeli 3 ekor induk babi dimana setelah 6 bulan memelihara induk babi tersebut menghasilkan masing-masing 5-6 ekor anak babi. Setelah dijual keuntungan yang diperoleh setelah dipotong biaya pakannya mencapai Rp. 1.500.000,- dalam kurun waktu 6 bulan. Melihat hasil yang bagus ini, Komang melanjutkan ke pinjaman kedua dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan juga dan rencananya akan dibelikan pakan yang lebih berkualitas bagi 3 ekor induk babinya tersebut sehingga anak-anak babi yang dihasilkan akan bertambah banyak dan berkualitas bagus. Program pinjaman ke peternak babi dari DINARI dengan pelunasan pinjaman pada akhir periode di bulan ke 6 ini dirasakan sangat menolong Komang Wenti untuk mengembangkan usahanya dan hasilnya sangat membantu Komang untuk menyekolahkan anak-anaknya.
texts.en:
Komang Wenti needs to afford tuition for her 3 daughters, two are in school already. She also needs to pay for her daily living expenses. Her husband is a farmer with uncertain and limited income. Komang is compelled to help her family's finances by farming pigs in her backyard. With her own money and additional loan from DINARI, Komang managed to purchase 3 breeding pigs. After 6 months, they produced 6 piglets that was sold for $150 profit in 6 months. After this encouraging result, she was encouraged to seek second loan from DINARI that she will use to purchase higher quality feeds for her 3 breeders, so they produce higher quality piglets. She feels that DINARI's flexible loan structure helps tremendously in developing her business. She plans to use the additional profit to pay her daughters' tuition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Feeds

loans.name: Esfuerzate Y Sed Valiente Group

texts.en: "Esfuerzate y Sed Valiente" is a group of 10 women coming from an extremely poor area. All the women in this group have to fight to get through each day. That is why they came together as a group and are seeking a loan to try and better their lives. They all want to take this loan and start their very own small business, and start generating income. They know this is the first step to bettering their situation. Elsa G. is the representative of this group of 10, and is excited at the chance to lead all her friends into a better life. She is a very hardworking mother and wants nothing more than to better the lives of her children. She plans on starting a small business making and selling food in her area. She hopes to one day expand and have her own restaurant, and make enough money to provide her children with a comfortable life. She and the rest of the group are ready to take the first step to a better life! On behalf of Elsa, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!

loans.use: These women would like to create and improve their small businesses in order to provide a better life for their families.

loans.name: Gloria Elizet

texts.es:
La señora Gloria V. V. tiene 28 años , pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Desamparados 796 del balneario Buenos Aires Norte en el distrito de Víctor Larco, Provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero no pudo continuar estudiando debido a que se unió a su pareja Linder Ascoy con quien tiene dos hijos varones.
Empezó su negocio vendiendo almuerzos, que en el lenguaje popular llamamos menú, actualmente amplió su negocio porque ahora vende también desayunos y yogur con fruta, el negocio se ubica en su casa.
Con el primer monto de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas empezó a vender yogur entonces tuvo que comprar sus respectivos utensilios.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas desea continuar un negocio de CD en el centro de la ciudad.
Su sueño es comprar una casa, ya que ahora vive en la casa de su madre. Sabemos que sí lo logrará porque es una mujer muy emprendedora.
texts.en:
Gloria V. is 28 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” and lives at Desamparados 796, Buenos Aries Norte neighborhood, Víctor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department in Peru. She completed secondary school but could not continue studying as she married her husband Linder Ascoy with whom she has two sons. She began selling lunches that in popular language we call “menu”. Today she has expanded her business and also sells breakfasts and yogurt with fruit. Her business is located in her home. With the first loan for 300 soles, which was repaid in 4 payments, she began to sell yogurt then she had to buy her respective utensils. With this loan for 800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she wishes to develop a CD business in the city center. Her dream is buying a house as she now lives in her mother’s home. We know that she will achieve this because she is a very enterprising businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs at wholesale to start a new business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and is blessed with 2 small children. She lives in a simple house located in the rural place of Barangay Ballacong Ilagan, in Isabela, Philippines. Ballacong is located in the midst of corn fields and is considered to be an upland place in Ilagan. Agriculture is the primary source of income.
