She is applying for a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer, five quarts of herbicide and other farm supplies. She hopes to improve her farm and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Josefa Maria

texts.es:
Josefa de 47 años vive en el centro de Malambo, municipio, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranq,uilla, a 5 kilómetros del aeropuerto de la ciudad, contiguo a las poblaciones de Soledad, Sabanagrande y Santo Tomás, caracterizado por una composición social muy especial, debido a que en sus habitantes encontramos una mezcla gente de todo el país, que llega a trabajar de manera independiente mediante un negocio o en El Parque Industrial Malambo S.A. -PIMSA- condominio industrial privado de completa infraestructura de servicios, orientados a garantizar reducciones en los costos a las empresas que se ubiquen en sus instalaciones y que tienen garantizada la disponibilidad suficiente de mano de obra a las empresas de la zona.
Ella tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 22 años, con quienes sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas y son el motor de su vida. Hace 5 años  Josefa trabajaba en un almacén y quedó desempleada, con su liquidación compró una vitrina, insumos de modistería y adecuó una habitación en su casa, aprovechando el potencial estratégico de su barrio, su negocio cada día fue aumentando sus ventas y con ellos sus utilidades, las que le permitieron comprar más vitrinas que surtió y posteriormente 2 máquinas troqueladoras con 40 juegos de troqueles, ofreciendo el servicio de troquelado y forrado de botones, también compró  dos estantes exhibidores de cintas e hilos para vender en su mercado.
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Josefa hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que llegó al conocer las bondades de los  credikiva,  y por eso está aplicando a él y lo invertirá en surtido de materiales para zapatería y artículos de papelería con los cuales quiere diversificar su oferta. Su meta más adelante es adecuar su negocio, para darle una mejor imagen, lograr apoyar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos y cumplir su sueño personal de tener un negocio posicionado. Mientras este ocurre maneja un ciclo de 93,58% dias, una rotación de inventarios de 93 días, mientras su rentabilidad  es de un 31%.
texts.en:
Josefa is 47 years old and lives in the center of Malambo, a town in the metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla about five kilometers from the airport.  It is near the towns of Soledad, Sabanagrande, and Santo Tomás.  The area has a special social composition since its inhabitants are a mix of people from all over the country that come to work independently at their business, or in the Malambo Industrial Park (PIMSA).  This is a private industrial area with a complete infrastructure of services designed to reduce costs for the businesses located there, and guarantee the availability of sufficient labor to the businesses in the area.

Josefa has two children who are 22 and 12 years old.  She hopes that they will be successful people, and they are her motivation in life.  Five years ago, Josefa worked at a store and became unemployed.  With her settlement, she purchased a display case, dressmaking supplies, and outfitted a room in her house to take advantage of the strategic potential of her neighborhood.  Her business was growing every day and with that, her profits grew, which allowed her to purchase more display cases.  Later she bought two die-cut machines with 40 stencils and offered die-cut services and covered buttons.  She also bought two display stands for tapes and threads to sell.

Her Kiva loan is Josefa's first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization that introduced her to the benefits of Kiva loans.  For this reason, she is applying for a loan to purchase shoes and stationary so that she can diversify her offerings.  Her goal is to improve her store to give it a better image, support her children's university studies, and fulfill her personal dream of having a well known business.  While this happens, she manages a cycle of 93.58 days, an inventory rotation of 93 days, and her profitability is 31%.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and stationary to diversify her business.

loans.name: Semi

texts.en:
Semi is a 23-year-old single lady who lives with her parents in a modest house. To support her family, Semi sells tamarinds, candle nuts, and nutmeg or other goods such as copra that she purchases from other people. She has been running this business for almost three years. She sells her products from house-to-house as well as at the market. 

Semi usually spends the income from her business to buy her business stock and cover daily needs as well as to meet the educational costs of her siblings who are still at the high school. She admits that the income generated is not enough to fully cover her family's needs.

She is looking for ways to increase her income. She wants to purchase more crops, i.e. tamarinds, candle nuts, nutmeg and copra to sell. She is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She is quite sure that the loan will help her in improving her business.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds, candle nuts, nutmeg and copra to sell.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Nowadays, life is difficult due to calamities and the economic crisis. But Ryan is hoping that he is going to improve his family's living status as long as he works hard. He is 22 years old and has one infant child. He raises his family in a village and generates his income through vegetable production and raising livestock. He aims to earn more income to provide for his family's needs and save for the future of his child.

At this time, he tried to plant more vegetables expecting to increase his production. But due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his vegetable production. He believes that the loan will help him to increase his yields. He is hoping that he is going to reap a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain vegetable production.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 29-year-old single man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He is an electrician and he earns a living by repairing broken televisions and selling electrical equipment to customers in his community. 

He would like to take a loan to buy old DVD players, speakers and televisions in order to repair and sell them. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy old DVD players, speakers, and televisions to repair and sell.

loans.name: Gongolamboto Group

texts.en:
Jesca, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been running a charcoal business for four years now.  She works 6 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Gongolamboto" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Twitezimbere (Gkn) Group

texts.fr:
Félicien fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere. Le nom du groupe signifie « se développer entre nous même ». Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 4 à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

Félicien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique pour améliorer la qualité du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Félicien voudrait être le distributeur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Félicien is a member of Twitezimbere Group, which means "developing ourselves one another". He is 40 years old, married and the father of six children, aged 4 to 16, with four of them attending school. He attended secondary school until third grade.

Félicien is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with the microfinance institution ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

His growth strategy for his business consists in using chemical fertilizer to improve the quality of his rice crop. In the years to come Félicien would like to become a known rice supplier in his region. He intends to use his profit to have his children educated.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Jose Rudy Agapito

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor, cuyo oficio lo aprendió gracias a que sus padres se lo enseñaron, desde entonces él se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de herbicidas, abono y demás material esta compra le ayudara a que sus cosechas sean exitosas y mejorar los ingresos ara su hogar.
El sueño de Juan, es trabajar para salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a farmer. He learned this profession thanks to his parents, who taught it to him. Since then, he has dedicated himself to planting staple crops. He does not have a set schedule to serve his customers. 

He is requesting a loan to buy herbicides, fertilizer and other supplies, which will help his harvest be successful and improve his income for his household. 

Juan's dream is to work and get ahead with his business and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alex David

texts.es:
Alex de 22 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hija en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Alex desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral y porcinos, su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones diarias de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales y realizar arreglos para su corral, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Alex es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Alex, 22, lives with his wife and daughter in his own house which lacks basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

For several years now Alex has been raising pigs and barnyard fowl to sell.  His corral, which is appropriate, is located in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses so that his animals will develop optimally to be sold in various local markets producing good profits to cover his daily household obligations.

He has requested a 1500 new sol loan to buy more nutritionally balanced feed for his animals and to repair the corrals.  With income obtained he will be able to repay the loan and improve his family’s quality of life.  Alex is a hardworking, enterprising person whose only wish is that his family gets ahead and improves economically.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed and to repair his corrals.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa de 61 años, está casada con Cayo, vive en compañía de su hijo mayor de 38 años, que aún es soltero, apoyándose en todo, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Rosa es la venta de comidas al paso como frituras, pollo broster, arroz chaufa y demás, para esto cuenta con una mesa que instala todos los días  en el frontis de su casa, en donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son los vecinas de la zona, y transeúntes en general. Lleva dedicándose a este oficio desde hace 5 años, contando con el apoyo de su esposo, quien siempre la acompaña y apoya en todo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el sentirse ocupada, estar en todo momento al lado de su esposo, además del ingreso económico que le genera, con el cual logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, y apoyar a sus familiares, contrario a esto, lo que no le gusta es el cansancio físico que la ocasiona al termino de cada día de trabajo, refiere que se debe  a su edad  y estado de salud. Pero siendo una mujer muy tenaz, continua en actividad. Este será el préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida de poder contar con un apoyo financiero con el cual podrá avanzar con su negocio. Para esto se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con los pagos de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que considera a todos sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas, como aceites, arroz, harinas, papas y demás.
texts.en: Rosa is 61 years old and married to Cayo. They live with their eldest son, 38, who is still single and self-sufficient, in a home they own. Rosa makes a living selling fast food, such as french fries, fried chicken, fried rice and other items, every day on a table she has set up in front of her home. It is here where she very cordially tends to her customers, the majority of whom are her neighbors or general passers-by. She has been doing this activity for five years and counts on the support of her husband, who is always by her side and supports her in everything. What she enjoys most about her work is that it keeps her busy, that she can share the task with her husband, and that with the income the business generates she can cover household expenses and support relatives. On the other hand, what she doesn't like about her work is the physical fatigue she feels at the end of each day due to her age and health, but being a very tenacious woman, she carries on. This will be her seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels content and grateful to be able to count on the financial support so she can advance her business. She promises to make her payments on time. Furthermore, she is thankful to be part of her community bank, since she considers all the members to be responsible people with solidarity. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make her meals, such as oils, rice, flour, potatoes and other items.

loans.use: to purchase oils, rice, flour, potatoes and other items.

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.ru: Хабибуло проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Хабибуло имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии он работает 20 лет. Кроме того он занимается выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа семян пшеницы и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Habibulo lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 56 years old, married and has four children.  Habibulo has a higher, pedagogical education.  He has been working in his field for 20 years.  Besides this work, he is involved in growing vegetables.  He has been in this business for three years.  Habibulo is requesting this loan for the purchase of wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas del Lago”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos,  uno de ellos independiente.  La señora cuenta con estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja desde hace un año y medio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, también se dedica a la venta de comidas pero a pedido (para compromisos).

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará prendas de vestir y juguetes para prepararse para la campaña navideña.  La mercadería la trae de la ciudad de Lima.

La señora desea tener un salón de belleza (spa) y de esa forma incrementar sus ganancias.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la confianza de las socias, la motivación que brindan las promotoras de créditos y el apoyo mutuo.
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the Communal Bank “Brisas del Lago” (Lake Breezes) which is located in the Province and Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Sra. Albina received her higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for a year and a half. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling clothes. She also sells food, but only on request (for engagement parties).

With this new loan of 2000 PEN, Albina will increase her business capital so that she can buy clothing and toys in preparation for the Christmas season. The merchandise is brought in from the city of Lima. Sra. Albina wants to open a beauty salon/spa so that she can increase her earnings. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the trust among the members, the motivation provided by the loan officers, and the mutual support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and toys for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with one child and Helen is 40 years old. She resides at Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Helen is operating a motorcycle transportation business in the local community to earn a living and has been in this business for one year. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP for tuition fees for her child. Helen became a member of GDMPC in this year. In the future, Helen wants to have her own house and lot.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is 57 and lives with his family in the community of Sto. Thomas, in the province of Isabela. He lives in an area that produces the most corn and rice in his country, along with rice, beans, fruit, legumes, tubers, and vegetables. 

Loreto is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide to use on the land that he inherited from his parents and continues to cultivate. He will use the profit from his loan to support his children and provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 55 years old and been in the farming business for 12 years now. He had been patiently planting and harvesting rice to sell as the source of his income. He had one child attending to high school. 

He is asking for a loan to have an additional capital in buying seeds, fertilizer and insecticide use in farming. He asks for P17,000 for crop maintenance.

With all his efforts, he hopes to educate his children up to college so that he will become successful to his chosen career. If this will happen, Ricardo will be very happy and proud.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide use in farming

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es una persona que se ha dedicado al cuidado de pollos gran parte de su vida, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y se la enseñó para que este trabajara en ella. Jose se encuentra casado y es padre de 3 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Con el galpón de pollos que tiene, Jose contribuye junto con su esposa a los ingresos de su hogar, lo que le permite aportar a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y al buen servicio que ofrece, Jose ha podido captar una buena cantidad de clientes lo que le representa muy buenas ventas. Con el ánimo de surtir su galpón con más pollos, Jose busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de pollos para ofrecer mayor cantidad a sus clientes.

Jose espera que de esta manera pueda generar mayores ingresos, pues podrá atender pedidos de clientes que antes tenía que rechazar, además, podrá aportar mayores ingresos para su hogar de modo que su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de pollos para ofrecer mayor cantidad a sus clientes.

loans.name: Dembagnouma 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DEMBAGNOUMA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  N’TENKONI un des villages de Dogo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de   ADJARA , 4ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  N’TENKONI après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  10.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is  36 years old she lives at her parents house and she is mother of 3 kids Monica has her own cattering business she knows how to cook and she needs a loan to buy an oven for her business Monica is the only support for her parents and her kids so she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has a small ice cream shop. He started the business selling ice cream on the streets and near bus stops. Slowly he began to move closer to home and sell to the local schools until he moved the business into his home. He now runs a much larger operation from his home, where he provides the ice cream for 5 street vendors while he sells the product out of his home. Francisco is very proud of the way his business has grown but does not want to stop here. He needs the loan in order to invest in a new freezer and chairs for his clients. He is 42 years old and has one child with his wife. He will use the extra profits from his investment to fix up his home and save for the education of his children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a freezer and chairs for his ice cream shop

loans.name: Luiciano

texts.en:
Luiciano was born and raised in Baba, Ecuador. He has worked in rice production since he was young, after learning from his father. He bought his land about 15 years ago. He depends on his rice production to feed and educate his two children who are 6 and 7 years old. He lives with his wife, children, his father and a sister. They all work together in the fields in order to cultivate rice. He will use the loan to invest in seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. He hopes he can improve his home and save for the future of his children.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Banovsha

texts.en: V. Banovsha is the proud owner of a small herd of sheep. Banovsha is married and has 4 children. She is 43 and is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh. She has borrowed 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU to purchase one cow and one calf.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Nghem

texts.en: Nghem P. is 44 years old. She has 2 children. One is a garment worker, the other helps on her plantation. Her husband is a farmer who earns $2 a day by selling vegetables, which he grows on his plantation. Nghem P. herself is a talented weaver and earns about $2 a day from this activity. She intends to improve her business with this loan by buying a motorbike to transport her goods to market. She will also use the loan to purchase more weaving tools.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and weaving tools

loans.name: Hidoyathon

texts.en:
Hidoyat R. has been engaged in trade for over 4 years. She started her business by cooking different food for people from several shops nearby such as Avesto (a supermarket in Khujand), Atlant (a computer center), Mercury (a disk shop) and a beauty salon. Her husband was her business partner and he helped her to prepare the food and bring it in his car to these shops.

Her business was uninterrupted but her husband died several weeks ago (she is in mourning dress in the photo). The head of Avesto supermarket helped her and gave her a little promise for a shop in the passage of this market. Presently she sells different food products here and gradually expanded her assortment by including newspapers, paying cards for mobile phones and so on. During Ramazan month, when most people are keeping Ruza (it is Musulman tradition to not eat anything all day during this month) she did not cook. She is going to start cooking again (her elder son is going to help her with the transportation of food) in the end of October. She is requesting $1200 to purchase food products for her business. She is also going to sell her dishes in her little shop.

loans.use: Hidoyathon would like to develop her business making and selling food to people who work in nearby stores.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Victoria has been selling clothes in Pichanaki market for three years. She is a modest mother who through many sacrifices has been able to save enough to buy various garments and sell them in this busy market.

Currently, the municipality is moving her in different stands without having a fixed place and charge her a high price for the space. Without a doubt this has thwarted the income she managed to gain through her job, and is therefore wanting to buy a stand in the market so that she stops being the object of maltreatment and the constant evictions.

Beside the sale of clothing, she also wishes to start selling shoes in her new stand so that she makes money to save enough and achieve her future goals.

She is requesting a loan and is asking us to collaborate with the crystallization of her goals to establish herself promptly in a safe and comfortable place.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Doña Victoria, hace ya tres años vende ropa en el mercado de Pichanaki, ella es una modesta madre de familia que a costa de mucho sacrificio ha logrado reunir una considerable cantidad de dinero para comprar prendas de vestir muy variadas y trabajar en este mercado muy concurrido.Actualmente, la municipalidad viene ubicándola en distintos puestos sin tener un lugar definido donde desempeñarse, además de los elevados precios que le cobran por su permanencia, sin duda estos hechos han mermado considerablemente los ingresos económicos que obtenía con su trabajo, por lo que ella desea mucho comprar un puesto de ventas en el mercado para dejar de ser objeto de maltratos y desalojos.Además de la venta de ropa desea ofrecer también zapatos en su nuevo pequeño establecimiento, para que pueda ahorrar dinero con el objeto de alcanzar sus metas futuras.Solicita un préstamo y nos pide colaboremos con la cristalización de su ansiado para establecerse pronto en un lugar cómodo y seguro.

loans.use:
Purchasing small store space in the most busy market to continue offering her garments /
Compra de un pequeño espacio de ventas en el mercado más concurrido de su ciudad para continuar ofreciendo sus bellas prendas.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet has operated a hair salon for the past 5 years. She is also the secretary of the Matale Lending Group where she has been a member for the past 2 years. She is 25, single, and has one child. She is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can buy another hairdryer, more braids, weaves and chemicals for her salon.

Traveling around Uganda, you can see that hairstyles change with the regions and the tribes. In and around the urban cities of Kampala and Entebbe, women prefer braids and weaves. In the more rural areas, women often wear scarves or keep their hair short without adding braids. Braids and weaves are not usually real hair and take considerable time to apply, so the poorer residents of rural areas do not go in for braids and weaves as they are more expensive.

loans.use: Annet will use her loan to buy more braids, weaves and chemicals for her hair salon.

loans.name: Kagugube A Group

texts.en:
Flavia is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is an accountant. She has a cosmetic shop. She believes that if she increases her stock, she can obtain higher profits. With the extra business profits, Flavia wants to build rental rooms so that she can save money for her childrens' education. Sylvia has a beauty salon. Mirember has a retail shop business. Sylvia's current business is growing mushrooms.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to add stock to the cosmetic shop

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz A. is a 47-year-old man who owns a small business in the small village of Saatli region. He sells milk and dairy products to the neighbors and to local bazaar traders. He is married and has three children. He has ten years of experience in this field.

It is very hard to find a job in the village, or in the region in general. Mubariz and his wife are unemployed. Selling dairy products is the only source of income in their family. Mubariz has found a solution to improve his family's life conditions. He would like to purchase one milk cow , a calf, and fodder. The estimated cost for the cow is $700 USD, plus $400 USD for the calf. The rest, $100 USD, he is going to spend on fodder.

loans.use: To purchase one cow, one calf and fodder

loans.name: Francisco Ivan

texts.es:
Francisco N. runs a restaurant in Saltillo, Coahuila. His mother opened the restaurant 10 years ago in order to deal with family expenses. But now Francisco is in charge of running the business.

Francisco is asking for a $1125 loan which he will repay in 6 months. With the loan he would like to renovate the restaurant and therefore provide his customers with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Francisco N. tiene un restaurant en Saltillo, Coahuila el cual inicio su madre hace 10 años ya que requería de mayor ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares, ahora el es quien se encargada de manejar este negocio.

Actualmente el requiere de un préstamo por US $1125 que liquidara en 6 meses para hacer remodelaciones en el local y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus comensales.

loans.use: To renovate a restaurant

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia P. R. is single and lives in Condega. She has been in business for the past 25 years and is a hairdresser. All her life she has worked in this area and has her own beauty salon in town. She takes care of expenses for her son´s education with the income from her business.

She has requested loans from Ceprodel to purchase products for her salon, and this has also allowed her to improve her customer service. Today once again she has approached Ceprodel for a loan which will enable her to buy products such as talcum powder, dyes, creams, etc. She confidently awaits approval of her loan, knowing that this will help her to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Rosa Amelia P. R. es soltera y del domicilio de Condega, es comerciante desde hace 25 años y se dedica al estilismo. Toda la vida se ha dedicado al trabajo de la belleza teniendo su propio salón de belleza en esta localidad. Cabe señalara que ella costea los gastos de estudio de su hijo a través de los ingresos de su negocio.

Ella ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para la compra de productos para el salón, estos le sirven también para mejorar la atención a su clientela. Hoy en día una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la adquisición de los productos tales como talco, tintes, cremas, etc. Es por eso que muy confiadamente espera la aprobación del crédito sabiendo que le será para beneficio y desarrollo de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria runs an agency organizing and planning ball and sport dancing events in Ukraine and other Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) countries. She has two and a half years of experience working in this sphere of business. Presently, she has over $5000 of working capital. Her monthly net profit is over $1200.

Victoria loves her job. She is dreaming about opening dance schools in the nearby city of Drogobych and other towns in her region, offering a good alternative to smoking and drinking which are becoming more and more of a problem with the youth in Ukraine these days. One of the personal dreams Victoria has cherished is to obtain a degree in finance. She is hoping to have an opportunity to study in college and gain some theoretical knowledge which she believes will help her in business as well.

Today Victoria is seeking a loan for 4000 Grivnas to attend an insurance training seminar abroad. She has been working to expand her business endeavors in the area of insurance. This seminar will give her valuable training and will help her gain skills which she can apply in her everyday work.

loans.use: To attend an insurance training session abroad

loans.name: Meena's Group

texts.en:
Meena baji is the wife of A. S.. ( Baji is an Urdu term meaning "eldest sister".) The couple has nine children; five daughters and four sons. Her oldest two sons have a paint and sewing machine shop. The third eldest son is in the 8th level of school. The two eldest daughters are in the 9th level at school. The next child is in the 6th level and the younger is in the 3rd level in school.

Meena baji successfully completed her first loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan and is now requesting a second loan for her son so he may expand his paint shop.

She has four other women in her loan group. Kaneezan baji wants loan for her sweatmeat business; Mumtaz baji is requesting a loan to expand her vegetable business; Akbaran baji wants to purchase a sewing machine and Manzooran baji wants to buy an auto-rickshaw.

The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of a paint shop

loans.name: Norma Lizeth

texts.es:
Norma is married and has two children who are very important to her. Therefore, she and her husband decided to start a hardware store, which now is very well stocked and is well situated in the city. She started this business to provided additional income because she and her family only counted on her husband's salary and they children were getting older and they were the majority of the household expenses. She began the business more than a year ago with her and her husband's savings.

She needs a $1,000 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to restock her merchandise and to add new products. With your help, Norma will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Norma es casada y tiene dos hijos que son los mas importante para ella es por eso que entre su esposo y ella decidieron poner un negocio de ferretería el cual esta muy buen surtido y tiene muy buena ubicación en la cuidad. Inició el negocio para tener un ingreso adicional ya que solo contaban con el sueldo de su esposo y los hijos estaban creciendo y eran mayores los gastos de la casa. Comenzo el negocio hace mas de un año con los ahorros que tenian ella y su esposo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1,000 que pagara en 6 meses para resurtir mercancía y también para meter nuevos productos en el negocio. Con tu ayuda Norma hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and restock her hardware store.

loans.name: Happy S.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is thirty-year-old Happy S.. She is married and has one child, aged fourteen. She also has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2002, Happy established her rice selling business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about 100 USD every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Happy requires a loan in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, Happy plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Halimabi

texts.ru: Холова Халимаби жительница района А.Джоми.Возраст 30 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование средние.Клиентка занимается сельским хозяйством.Она  имеет небольшой участок земли на котором выращивает овощи. Собрав урожай излишки она реализует на рынке или обменивает на другие продукты питания,такие как мука, рис и масло. На кредит планирует закупить семена и минеральные удобрения.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 4месяцев.
texts.en:
Halimabi H. resides in the Jomi region. 30-years-old, she is married and has two children. She attended secondary school, and works in agriculture. She has a small parcel of land on which she raises sheep. After gathering in her crop, she sells the surplus at the market or barters for other food products such as flour, rice and oil. With the loan she plans to buy seed and fertilizer. She intends to repay the loan within four months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción es una mujer emprendedora que ha sacado adelante a sus 5 hijos, inició el negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos debido que el padre los abandonos por que no podía encontrar trabajo. Ella comenzó el negocio hace 5 años vendiendo tacos de canasta y a través del tiempo logro poner un negocio sobre la carretera que poco a poco ha hecho crecer y ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para dar mantenimiento eléctrico a su negocio por que el local que adquirió requiere mantenimiento. Con tu apoyo Ella continuara con su negocio.
texts.en:
Concepcion is a very enterprising woman who has brought up her 5 kids. She started her business as she needed to support her kids as their Dad abandoned them as he couldn't find a job. She started selling tacos 5 years ago and as time has gone on she has been able to put her business on the main road which has meant that it has grown and she has moved forward.

She needs a loan of $425 which she will repay over a period of 6 months which will supply electricity to her business as the store she has needed maintenance work. With your help she will continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for her store/dar mantenimineto a su local

loans.name: Mauricio Jose

texts.es: El señor Mauricio José P. Martínez tiene la edad de 31 años habita en el reparto Juan Ramón padilla en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijo. El señor P. trabaja como ebanista en un taller de su papá desde hace 10 años  por lo cual solicita un monto de C$ 5,000.00 córdobas para compra de zinc y cuartones para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, los sueños de este señor es llegar a tener su propia mueblería y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio Jose P. M. is 31 years old and he lives in the neighborhood of Juan Ramon Padilla in the county of Ticuantepe with his wife and child. Mr P. has been working as a cabinet-maker in his father's workshop for 10 years, and he would like the loan of $5,000.00 cordobas to buy zinc and timber to improve the business' infrastructure. This man's dream is to have his own furniture store and to give his family better living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make furniture/Comprar materiales para hacer muebles

loans.name: Naseem M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a 33-year-old woman who lives in Shah Rukn, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 22 years. Her husband, M. R., has a busiiness selling animals. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 

Naseem baji works in a cotton factory where she packs cotton in sacks and earns $2 each day. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to resell for a profit. 

She is the leader of a 5-person loan group. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) for her animal business. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy tools, mirrors, and chairs for her barber saloon. Fatima Mai baji wants a loan to buy an ox cart to fertilize her land. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to sell

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal “El Alto Mayo”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia y distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida tipo menú vende de manera diaria, da pensión a quienes lo requieren y desarrolla su negocio en su propia casa. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará los insumos como arroz, azúcar en saco, aceite en galón, fideos, verduras y carnes  y otros insumos que necesita para la preparación de sus platos a ofertar a sus clientes. 
La señora Marilu tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 03 hijos, dos de ellos aún estudian y dependen de ella, además son la razón para luchar cada día. Más adelante quiere arreglar su casa y ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Marilu belongs to the "El Alto Mayo" Communal Bank and lives in the San Martín Region in the Rioja district and province. She earns a living by preparing and selling menu-of-the-day type food. She offers food and accomodation to those needing it and carries out her business in her own house. With this loan of US$350 (S/. 1,000) which will be paid over six months, she will buy ingredients such as rice and sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, pasta, vegetables, meat and other goods that she needs for the preparation of the meals to offer to her clients. Marilu is 41 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children. Two of the children are still studying and dependent on her, and moreover are the reason to keep pushing onwards every day. In the future she wants to fix up her house and expand her business further.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, sugar by the sack, oil by the gallon, pasta, vegetables, meats and other goods

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y su único hijo. Ella es profesora en una institución educativa de su región, también estudio el arte de las manualidades con piedras, perlas y otros elementos, y en su casa, en sus momentos libres se dedica a confeccionar zapatos y sandalias con estos materiales, que luego lleva a vender a sus colegas y amistades dejándolos al contado o al crédito. Le gusta cada día ir perfeccionando su técnica lo que ayuda la práctica constante de este tipo de trabajo manual. Además puede obtener ganancias extras a su remuneración como maestra y esto es por lo que se siente satisfecha y motivada para seguir haciéndolo. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, con la cantidad requerida comprará más materiales de bijouteria, y también una vitrina para mostrar sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Milagros is 28 years old and lives with her husband and one son. She is a teacher at an educational institution in her region and is also studying jewelery art to shape stones, pearls and other elements. At home in her free time Milagros makes shoes and sandals featuring these items which she then sells to her colleagues and friends who often pay at a later date. She would like to perfect her technique and constant practive helps with this type of manual labor. She also obtains extra income aside from her job as a teacher and this makes her feel satisfied and motivated to continue. This is the first loan that she has requested with Microfinanzas PRISMA and with the amount required she will buy more materials for finely crafted jewelery and also a window showcase to display her works.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to produce jewelery, shoes and sandals

loans.name: Peit

texts.en: Peit S., 27, is pictured here with her husband. They have two young children. Peit sells groceries in the Bati district of Takeo province. On average, she typically makes USD $2.50 of profit every day. Her husband earns about USD $5 a day by working as a driver. Currently, he purchases grocery items in bulk and transports them to the province market, but since this business make very little income, he has decided to change his truck into a tourist truck. He wants to transport passengers from place to place instead of delivering goods.

loans.use: To change the truck

loans.name: Aderina

texts.en:
Aderina A. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Aderina is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Sarah Grace

texts.en:
Sarah Grace put a small piggery in her backyard. She likes pigs because it helped her address the growing needs of her family. She is 37 years old, married to a farmer and has four children studying in school.

She is planning to start a sari-sari store someday. She thinks that aside from pigs, she needs to venture to another line of business to augment their limited income.

Sarah is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets for her piggery and feed for her pigs. The loan will truly help Sarah grow her business more and to start her plan for sari-sari store.

CEVI helps Sarah sustain her pigs. She receives credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services, which CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: Purchase feed for pigs and additional piglets.

loans.name: Alexa Doris

texts.es:
Alexa Doris, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. Apolonia S/Nº - Caserío de El Porvenir, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos depende de ella.Con el apoyo de sus padres inicio su negocio de Venta de Jugos y refrigerios en el Mercado Central con un capital de  S/. 800.00 con los que mando a confeccionar un andamio para acondicionar sus servicios, mesas y banquitas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 que cancelará en 06 meses,  comprará  frutas como papayas, naranjas en cientos, manzanas en cajas, plátanos en racimos; útiles de repostería como vasos, jarritas, platos pequeños, cucharitas, envases de diferente tamaños, e insumos para la preparación de sus jugos como algarrobina y miel de abeja, así como para la preparación de sus refrigerios como kekes, empanadas, papas rellenas. Nos cuenta que hoy en día y gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos se siente muy tranquila con lo que hace, responsable en sus cuotas y con las acciones de su vida diaria, en un futuro desea implementar su juguería en un local más amplio y céntrico.
texts.en:
Alexa Doris belongs to the Virgen del Rosario Community Bank. She lives in Jr. Apolonia S/Nº, El Porvenir village, Bellavista district, San Martín department. She lives with her partner, is 30 years old and is mother to three children, all of whom depend on her. With the support of her parents, she started her business selling juices and snacks in the central market with an investment of 800 soles with which she ordered scaffolding for the the construction of tables and stools. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will purchase fruit such as papayas, hundreds of oranges, boxes of apples, and bunches of bananas, as well as necessities such as glasses, jars, small plates, spoons, containers of different sizes and ingredients for the preparation of her juices such as algarrobina syrup, bee honey, as well as for the preparation of her snacks like cakes, empanadas, and stuffed potatoes. She tells us that today, thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos, she feels very content with what she does. She is responsible with her payments and with her daily tasks. In the future, she wishes to establish her juice store in a bigger, more centrally located space.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and accessories for selling her juices.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna A. N. is the 40-year-old mother of eight children. The oldest is 22 while the youngest is eight. Right now, she cannot afford to send all of them to school. She is married to a fisherman and they live in Dunga, a small fishing village just outside of Kisumu. For added income, Lorna sells fruits and vegetables in Kibuye market, which is Kisumu's largest open-air market. She purchases the fruit from Busia and Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy fruits like mangos, pears, oranges, lemons and plums. The profit will go towards paying back the loan and paying school-fees for her children.
Lorna recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (which is a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: In

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. In H. and her husband. They live in Kompong Cham Province. In H. is the 47-year-old, married mother of three children, two of whom are married and living independently. In H.'s husband is a local primary school teacher. In H. currently cultivates rice and vegetable crops, and she will be using the loan money as capital to begin selling grocery items.

loans.use: To begin selling grocery items

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y es madre de 04 hijos y uno por llegar, está embarazada.  Tiene estudios de educación superior (profesora) y vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal.  Inició su negocio gracias al primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles.  Eugenia se dedica a la compra y venta CDs (discos).

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de flores, para ello requiere de un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de flores, punteros, cordones, cintas, cola de rata, telas, etc.

Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio en una tienda grande y bien surtida.

A ella le gusta el trabajo solidario del Banco Comunal y sobre todo las charlas de capacitación.
texts.en:
Eugenia belongs to the Niño Jesús de Praga Community Bank. It is located in the Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 34 and in a common law marriage. She has four children and one on the way; she is pregnant. She has a college education (teacher), and she lives in the Santa Bárbara neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the foundation of her Community Bank. She started her business thanks to her first loan for 300 PEN. Eugenia buys and sells CDs (compact discs). She currently sells flowers, and for this she needs a loan for 3,000 PEN. She will use the loan to buy flowers, card holders, cords, ribbons, elastic, fabric, etc. Her biggest dream is to expand her business and make it into a big, well stocked store. She likes the Community Banks’ supportive work and, above all, she likes the training talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flowers, card holders, cords, ribbons, elastic, fabric

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 44 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Ella es abogada de profesión y hace 10 años decidió abrir su propio estudio jurídico donde también vende cosméticos a sus colegas y clientes. Vende por catalogo y en ocasiones también ofrece prendas de vestir. Norma se siente satisfecha por las actividades que realiza, ya que con las ganancias puede solventar sus gastos. Además está muy contenta de poder ejercer su profesión, ya que es muy difícil, ella misma conoce a personas que han estudiado la misma carrera pero se dedican a otras actividades debido a su situación económica, pero ella con mucho esfuerzo y profesionalismo ha logrado la estabilidad de su estudio y la venta de cosméticos y ropa son ganancias adicionales que no quiere dejar de lado. Es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal donde se compromete nuevamente a seguir impulsando un trabajo coordinado dentro del grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de mercadería en cosméticos y ropa que le han solicitado recientemente.
texts.en:
Norma, 44, lives with her parents in their house. She is a lawyer by profession. Ten years ago she decided to open her own legal office where she also sells cosmetics to her colleagues and clients. She sells by catalog, and on occasion she also sells clothes. Norma feels satisfied with the activities she does because she can pay her expenses. She is also happy to be able to exercise her profession because it is very difficult. She knows people who have studied the same career, but they do other things because of their economic situation. With much effort and professionalism she has achieved stability in her office. The cosmetic and clothing sales are additional earnings that she does not want to leave aside. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to belong to her community bank, where she promises to continue encouraging coordinated work within her group. The money she is asking for will be used to buy cosmetics and clothes that have been recently requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida F. lives in the village of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Nida makes a living by selling fish. She has been in this business for over a year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has applied for a new loan of 2000 PHP to expand her business. This loan will be the first taken out by Nida from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Janet is single. To make a living, Janet owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Janet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Janet is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Janet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Karina es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Karina viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, producto que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de bebe.
Los sueños de Karina con tener una tienda de ropa y surtir con mas productos.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank which means “Let’s Grow” in Quechua. Karina is a common-law wife, 23 years old with 1 child. Karina travels to regional markets where she sells a variety of clothing acquired in the city of Lima. Karina is requesting a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to buy baby clothing. Karina’s dream is to have a clothing store, stocked with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth América

texts.es: Elizabeth América H. D. F. vive en el departamento D. La Libertad junto su esposo don Jose D.  71 años D. edad, que a pesar D. su cansancio por la edad aun sigue trabajando como seguridad D. un rancho D. la zona. Elizabeth también cuenta con el apoyo D. su hija Anita D. 18 años D. edad, quien ayuda en el negocio, donD. todas los días se elaboran tortillas y a su vez se encuentra la tienda con productos D. consumo diario; el anhelo D. Elizabeth es hacer crecer su tienda; ya que su poca variedad D. productos hacen que sus ventas no incrementen, con la ayuda D. este crédito Elizabeth podrá surtir su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth América H. D. F. lives in the province of La Libertad with her husband Jose, who at 71 is an active worker in spite of his age, holding down a job in security at a local ranch. Elizabeth is helped by her daughter, Anita who is18 and helps her with the business of making tortillas and attending to daily meals; Elizabeth's greatest wish is to grow her small store's business, as currently the limited variety of products constrains business growth. With the help of this loan, Elizabeth expects to better stock the store and obtain better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Stock and Product Variety in Store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 43 years old and she is already a widow. Her husband passed away eight years ago. She lives in the village of Roxas, Naguilian, Isabela. They only had one child, Jilbert Lui, who is 8 years old. She serves as a father and mother to her son. Luisa aspires to give her child a complete education, which he could treasure for his whole life. This is the reason why she never loses hope.

Luisa is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to obtain additional capital to improve her general store. She is planning to purchase more business commodities to display and sell in her small variety store. She hopes that her business will be maintained and grow continuously so that she’ll be ready to send her son to a higher level of education in the future.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Erina's Group

texts.en: N. Erina is a determined and friendly lady with three children ages 12, 7 & 4 years. She also helps to take care of other orphans. Erina has had a business selling charcoal from Namataba trading centre for 11 years and she is able to make 70,000/= as profit because she uses loans and has good customer care skills. In Namataba, almost everyone sells charcoal and one needs to be good and have good quality charcoal to be able to make enough sales. She has hopes of becoming a supplier of charcoal herself so that she could be able to earn at once and be able to build a residential house for her children. She needs a loan to be able to buy more sacks of charcoal so that she can have a steady supply and pay school fees on time.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Alipasa

texts.en: Alipasa R. is currently in the business of selling maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to buy sorghum and millet to sell. Alipasa is 22 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children do not yet go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for cereals. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy sorghum and millet to sell

loans.name: Rowna Farahnaz Group

texts.en:
This is Rowna Farahnaz group, made up of three members. Ahmad Jawad is the group leader.

Ahmad Jawad is about 55 years old and is married with five children. He has a general store and all the family members benefit from its income. He wants to expand his business and to attract more clients.

The second member is Rowna. She is a tailor and works hard to earn money for the completion of her family’s requirements. She needs to buy a new sewing machine for her business because she has lots of problems with old one while sewing. Besides that, she wants to hire a student to support him in her business and to enlarge her business.

The last group member is Farahnaz and she wants to take a loan for her brother’s bakery shop. With the loan, her brother wants to expand his business and buy required materials.

They have together requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani to change the status of their businesses and their lives. They admire this effective process.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Chamreourn

texts.en: Mrs. Chamreourn S. lives in Cheung Prey Bei village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 0.5-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. She is also breeding pigs at her house. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Khan Kheourn, helps her with the current business. Mrs. Chamreourn S. has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en:
Peter M. is separated from his wife. He lives in Nairobi. Peter was introduced to KADET by existing clients and has no previous credit or loan history from any other microfinance institutions. 

Peter has been running a laundry service for six years. He also sells DVD's and operates an M-Pesa (a mobile-phone based money-transfer service that allows users to deposit, withdraw, and transfer money, and pay bills, at very affordable rates without visiting a bank). Peter operates his businesses in a residential area of Nairobi. Peter intends to use the loan to add credit to his M-Pesa business. He anticipates extra profits that he will invest in a new laundry machine. 

Peter hopes to own several M-Pesa branches and outlets. He believes he is a hard worker he knows he will accomplish this task.

loans.use: To add credit to his M-Pesa business.

loans.name: Waukae Group

texts.en:
Mwashambani G., age 42, is married and has three children, ages 8, 9, and 29 years old.  She has a café where she sells local foods, such as tea, mandazi (a donut-like pastry), chapati (a flat bread, like tortillas), chips, wali (rice) and ugali (a hot, sticky dough made from maize flour). She earns a monthly profit of around $210.

This will be Mwashambani’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes to obtain a loan to expand her business.
	
Mwashambani will share this loan with her loan group, Waukae, which has 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable when repaying the loan. In the photo, Mwashambani is in the back row wearing a blue dress.

loans.use: To make traditional foods for a small cafe

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Julia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hija, Julia junto a su esposo tienen una librería en un local alquilado ubicado a una cuadra de la plaza principal de Ayacucho, vende libros, artículos de escritorio, juguetes, mochilas y por época de carnavales venderá talcos, globos. Además los días sábados y domingos vende ropa en las ferias.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de globos, talcos.
Los sueños de Julia son que su hija sea profesional y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Alborada Community Bank. She is married, 49 years old and has one daughter. Julia, along with her husband, has a bookstore at a rented site located one block from the main plaza of Ayacucho. She sells books, written articles, toys, backpacks and, during festivals, she plans to sell powders and balloons. Furthermore, on Saturdays and Sundays, she sells clothes at the regional flea markets. Julia is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles (approximately $525), which she plans to invest in the purchase of balloons and powders. Julia's dream is for her daughter to be successful and to own her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balloons and powders

loans.name: Mrs. Phally Eang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally E. is a 43-year-old silk weaver. Her husband, Mr. Dy Cheng, is a driver who owns a truck for transportation. Mrs. Phally E. is the mother of four children: one is employed in a garment factory, another is a driver, while the others are students in the local school. 

In order to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Phally E. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. She is the village bank president for this group of 15 people located in Chumrov village in Takeo province.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Sana'

texts.en:
"My son loves birds. It started as a hobby and now he has a small bird shop. I want to help him fulfill his dream," Sana' says.

Sana' a mother of 10 children, all of whom are younger than 21 years old. Her son started catching birds, breeding, and selling them. Then he used his small capital to buy larger numbers of all types of birds. By the time he became well-known, he started a wholesale birds distribution business.

This small business is now an additional source of income for the family. The father is an employee of Karitas Hospital in Beth Lehem, but despite his fine salary, providing for the needs of a 12-member family is not easy nowadays.

loans.use: Purchase and breed birds

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is the 50-year-old single mother of four children aged between 19 and 26 years. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with six people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Resty works in a semi-urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells secondhand clothes in Najjanankumbi Stella Zone and buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.

Resty has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for eight years. She is servicing her thirteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

Resty is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start importing directly from the U.K.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Love Grace's Group

texts.en:
Love Grace P. is from the village of Quiling. She is 26 years old. Love Grace is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Love Grace P.'s Group.

Love Grace is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Love Grace owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Love Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Love Grace joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Love Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Love Grace is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Love Grace from ASKI.
