She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun A., 53 years old (in the picture), and her husband, Mr. Choem Cheav, 49 years old, have been married since 1986 and have one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is married, but lives in the family home and the other two are in school. They live in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Mrs. Sokhoen A. just started a business of producing hammocks, while her husband has been selling piglets for more than thirty years. She is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law to carry sugar palm to sell. She also will use a part of her loan to help provide capital for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law to carry sugar palm to sell.

loans.name: Bushenyi United Group

texts.en:
A determined and very ambitious lady, N. Catherine, aged 28 years, is a single mother with one child.

Catherine has operated a retail shop business for three years in Bushenyi town and at the end of every month is able to fetch a profit of 40,000 Ugandan shillings. Her main drawback has been having a small amount of stock in her business that cannot match the consumption rate of her customers.

Catherine is seeking a loan that can help her to stock more goods that will satisfy her customers’ high demand and also transform her business into a wholesale operation.

Being very committed to her business with good customer care, Catherine hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a fundamental change in her business and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for her family requirements.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Matha

texts.en: Mrs. Matha M. is a farmer who lives in the village of Thecho. She owns a piece of land on which she grows green vegetables which she sells in the local market every morning and evening. She uses her income to pay for her daughter's education, and is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. Mrs. M.'s husband Raj is a laborer who builds houses; their daughter is in the 10th grade.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama K. trades in African art works, Her business is located at the central business district in the capital city of Sierra Leone.  She is 41 years old and has spent 20 years in business. She is married to Lamin Kargbo who makes his living driving in the city.  They have  two children, one of whom is now in senior secondary school. Adama has five other dependents who live with her. She is very determined to succeed in business and is looking for a loan to buy more goods to meet the growing needs of her customers. She hopes to use the proceeds from the loan to set up a business for her husband.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda J. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and sandals at her shop and is requesting a loan to stock dresses and pairs of trousers. Roda is 41 years old and is married to a nurse. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy two sewing machines and employ two tailors. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock dresses and pairs of trousers

loans.name: Husna's Group

texts.en:
Husna has lived with her family in Borewala, a city of shrines, for the past twenty years. Her husband is a goldsmith and runs a shop in the market where he sells gold jewelry. Husna helps her family financially by doing domestic sewing. She receives orders from her neighborhood clients and generates money by fulfilling them.

Husna has four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are getting their education while the oldest son is also a goldsmith. Husna is a very kind and supportive woman by nature. She enjoys her sewing business and the income from it encourages her to earn more for her family. She has applied for a loan from Asasah to purchase an electric sewing machine for her business. This will help her to sew more clothes in time.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 23 year old borrower from Lebanon. Ayman is a dedicated construction worker. In order to improve his business, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy tools for his business. He hopes that with his loan, he will be able to support his family and work on bigger projects.

When he first started his business, he had some financial issues buying the necessary tools for his work. But thanks to his previous loan, he was able to supplement his tools and improve his work. This is his second loan from Al Majmoua. He hopes for the future, to keep on improving himself and growing in this field of industry.

loans.use: To buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. is thirty-five years old, married and has two children aged sixteen and six years old. Her business is located at Taveta Road, in a very busy street in the city centre of Nairobi and is well known by the name Royle Enterprises.

She sells skirt suits, trouser suits, ladies tops, jeans, skirts, shoes and shawls to the customers within the city centre.  Most of her customers are walk-ins although she also has some loyal repeat customers. She has been in this business for the last five years and she says the business is profitable. She says that the business is very good and the only major challenge she has is changes in fashion. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that her business is doing well.

She is taking a loan of 50,000 KES to up her stock of clothes to meet the needs of her customers. In future, she sees herself building her own house and will have opened more boutiques. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and outgoing.

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in farming for over 20 years. She also grows piglets for fattening and sale. She hopes to acquire additional pigs to raise.

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. She also plans to buy feed for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers and feed for the pigs

loans.name: La Bendicion 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group La Bendicion 1, 2 & 4 (Bless). She makes her home here in a simple home with 4 of her 9 children and her long time partner. She says that her most difficult challenges is to raise and provide for her family.  She plans to continue enjoying visiting the church and singing to the Lord.

Ana is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. She has had her business for over 7 years, starting after she realized the need to earn extra incoming for her family. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, shirts, underwear and shoes. She will use the profits to buy some school supplies her children and to invest in her business. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because a family group was formed in her community and invited her. She was in need of money to improve her sales and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican  clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, underwear and shoes

loans.name: Jennifer Ichela

texts.en:
Jennifer Ichela R. is 50 years old and is married to Steven R. who is a farmer and who also contributes to the income of the family. They have five school-going children and live in Kapsoya.

Jennifer has been operating a general store for twelve years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 25,000.

Jennifer learned about KADET through marketing awareness done in her area and is applying for her first loan of Kshs 50,000. She intends to use the loan to buy six boxes of cooking oil, five bags of sugar and any other stock which needs to be added. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand her shop business.

In the future, Jennifer wishes to have more dairy cows since both businesses have proved to be very profitable in her area. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy six boxes of cooking oil,  five bags of sugar and other stock

loans.name: Ayi

texts.fr: ayi est un homme très dynamique, il a appris la couture. en 1996 il a ouvert son propre atelier de couture, il est marié et c'est grâce à cette activité qu'il subvient aux charges de son ménage. pour accroître son revenu, il confectionne des habits à partir des tissus qu'il achète et les revend à sa clientèle. la demande actuelle est élevée, il veut satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de tissus de diverses qualités. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
texts.en: Ayi is an active man and he learned to be a taylor. In 1996 he opened his own tailoring shop. He is married and thanks to this business he is able to cover the household expenses. In order to improve his revenues he makes clothing from fabrics he purchases and then resells the products to his clientele. He has seen a rise in demand and he would like to fill his clients' requests. He requests a loan from WAGES (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase various kinds of fabrics. His clientele is made up of all types of people.

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily E. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old. Emily is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emily dreams to be a successful businesswoman someday.

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emily is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four low-income people who live together in Siem Reap province. Sao S., age 24, has been selected to be the leader of the group. Sao S.'s husband is a local fisherman. This couple has been married for many years, and they have only one child who is still studying in school. She and her husband have been living O. a fishing boat O. the river for a few years. They always get up every morning, drive their boat towards the middle of the river, and then fish. After fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the busy market and sell to the regular buyers. Sao S. will use his loan to purchase some fishing implements for fishing.

The other three borrowers include: 
Mrs. O., a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to repair her broken house.
Mrs. S. will use this loan for repairing her broken house.
Mr. M. is applying for a loan to buy housing material for mending his old house.

loans.use: To purchase some fishing implements for fishing.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha L. is from the town of Surallah. She is 62 years old and married. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Editha also raises pigs for fattening. She sells pork meat at the market.

Editha joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Editha is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase 6 sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia M. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Oguis, Danao, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two businesses: a pig fattening operation and a farm. Her husband, Jose M., who is 51, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's businesses. They have three children, who are between 17 and 31 years old. Anesia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anesia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use to purchase additional pigs and feed so that she can continue to saving for the future. Anesia M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day, to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking on the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase extra pigs and feed

loans.name: Cosoltepec Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama Cosoltepec que significa cerro del Paisan y han llamado su grupo así porque todos los miembros son originarios de esta comunidad, ellos se reúnen cada semana en el domicilio de su representante la señora Lorenza Narahulda  L. C. que se encuentra ubicado en la colonia “Agrícola” que pertenece al municipio de “San M. Soyaltepec” en el estado de Oaxaca este grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y este es su préstamo número 6 con FRAC.
La señora Lorenza Narahulda  L., "Nara" como la conocen en su comunidad tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos 2 mujeres y 1 hombre. Ella tiene una taquería llamada "La mixtequilla" ubicada en la carretera a Temazcal en la comunidad de Cosoltepec. Ella desea su préstamo para poder comprar carne, refrescos, tomates, chiles, cebolla, tortillas, refrescos, servilletas y bolsas para la preparación y venta de sus tacos. Nara nos dijo que ya tiene 3 años con su negocio y que gracias al apoyo su negocio ha crecido poco a poco. Ella espera darles estudios a sus hijos para que en un futuro sean profesionistas y no les tengan que sufrir.
Don Mario P. S. también es miembro del grupo Cosoltepec el tiene 44 años es casado y tiene 3 hijos 2 mujeres y un hombre. El tiene una pequeña carpintería en su hogar en la calle niños héroes numero 16, el  necesita el crédito para poder comprar madera, clavos y barniz para poder realizar sus muebles y posteriormente venderlos. El espera que con las ganancias pueda invertir en mas material, darle estudios a su hija la más pequeña que tiene 12 años y superarse para lograr el bienestar de su familia
Los otros 8 integrantes son:
Magdalena C. N. cría de cerdos
Michel López Ramírez siembra de maíz
Emiliana S. Hernández venta de antojitos mexicanos(tamales)
Leonor González Pérez tienda de ropa (sabanas, cortinas, toallas, pantalones y blusas)
Arcelia M. E. venta de ropa de cama y ropa típica de la región
Mara Iveth Ramírez L. venta de dulces y aguas frescas
José Alfredo M. M. tienda de ropa dama y caballero
Alicia R. E. venta de abarrotes
texts.en:
This is a development unit called Cosoltepec which means Paisan Hill.  The group decided on this name because all the members are from this community.  They meet once a week in the home of Mrs. Lorenza Harahulda L. C. who lives in the "Farming" colony that belongs to the town of "San M. Soyaltepec" in the state of Oaxaca.  The group is comprised of 10 members and this is their sixth loan through FRAC.

Mrs. Lorenza Narahulda L., known as "Nara" in the community, is 42 years old, married, and has two daughters and a son.  She owns a taco stand called "La mixtequilla" located on the road to Temazcal in the town of Cosoltepec.  She is requesting the loan to buy meat, softdrinks, tomatoes, chiles, onion, tortillas, napkins and bags for the preparation and sale of her tacos.  Nara told us that she's had this business for three years and thanks to the support she has been able to grow her business little by little.  She hopes to be able to provide an education to her children so they may become professionals and not live in hardship.

Mr. Mario P. S. is also a member of the Cosoltepec group.  He is 44 years old, married and has two daughters and a son.  He owns a small carpentry shop in his home in Niños Héroes Street, number 16.  He needs the loan to buy lumber, nails and varnish so he can make furniture and then sell it.  He hopes to invest his earnings in more material, and provide an education for his youngest daughter who is 12 years old.  Hopefully in this way he will improve his family's living conditions.

The other 8 members in the group are:
Magdalena C. N. who raises pigs
Michel López Ramírez who grows corn
Emiliana S. Hernández who has a Mexican tamales stand
Leonor González Pérez who has a clothing shop (bed sheets, curtains, towels, pants and blouses)
Arcelia M. E. who sells bed linens and typical regional clothing
Mara Iveth Ramírez L. who sells sweets and bottled water
José Alfredo M. M. who has a ladies' and gentlemens' clothing store
Alicia R. E. sho sells groceries

loans.use: To buy corn, lumber, groceries, clothing, sweets and pig feed

loans.name: Nsiimya Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Forty-year-old Martin N. has for the last five years been making common cause with Nsiimya Development group-Jinja. Martin traces his roots in his current business to agriculture. It is from his small agricultural business that he got money to start up his vegetable stall in Kakira market. Before all that, he was involved in a second hand clothes sales business. Around Kakira, most people associate Martin with diligence and determination. The happily married father of five says weekly this business generates him 80,000 shillings. Martin says that with this loan he is going to rejuvenate his business operations. In essence, that means buying more vegetables to resell at his stall.

loans.use: The purchase of more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie J. is a 24-year-old mother who dreams for the betterment of her family. She is from Villar, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines.  She is married to Orlee J. and they are blessed with two children: Gwen Ashley – five years old, and Steven – two years old.

In order to provide for their family's basic needs, they work very hard to earn an income. Rosenie is engaged in hog fattening while her husband works as a driver and a fish vendor.  With their limited income, Rosenie tries to budget for her family's needs, repay her loans, and also keep a little savings for their future needs.  She has started personal savings through the initiative of ASHI.
 
She joined ASHI in 2010 and has fortunately already fully repaid her first loan.  She is requesting PHP 9000.00 for her second loan. This amount will be used for her piggery project.  These projects really help them address the big and unexpected expenses for their family.

Rosenie's greatest dreams are to give her children the right education and to have their own house and lot.  If she has access to a bigger loan in the future, she wants to open up a variety store to earn extra income.

loans.use: To use for pig farm

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. John has a stationery business, which he has run for over ten years.
To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stationery items, such as books and photocopier paper, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, John hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to own another business.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery items (such as books and photocopier paper) for resale

loans.name: Elcarte's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Primitiva E., 57 years of age, is married and is a resident of Purok 3, Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Primitiva is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Primitiva E.’s Group.

Primitiva is married to Lerio E., a motor cab driver. They are blessed with five adult children, two of whom are married.

To help her husband, Primitiva decided to engage in a micro-business operating a sari-sari (variety) store in addition to doing some farming activity. For a year, she has been able to maintain this business activity and is now earning an average net income of not less than P3,500 a month, which is very helpful to her family.

Primitiva joined the Cooperative in 2009.  She is an active member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program of Paglaum MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor.  Primitiva is requesting a loan in the amount of P10,000 for her 4th loan from PMPC. Part of this loan will be used to purchase commercial fertilizers and the remaining amount will be used for motor maintenance.
                                                                                                                                                                 
The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for Primitiva’s family, to meet their basic needs, to repay loans from PMPC, and to use for possible business expansion. 

About Group Loans:  In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farm and maintain motor for cab business

loans.name: Las Americas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Americas está formado por 6 mujeres y 1 hombre que son amigos y viven por distintas comunidades de la ciudad de Cuenca, lugares en donde se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, también laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades que las que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares. Nuestras socias son mujeres trabajadoras, amables y carismáticas quienes en su lucha diaria ayudan a sus familias.

La Señora. Rosa Q. vive por la comunidad de Tutupali Chico, se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada  por su prima quien  pertenece al grupo. Tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 19, 17, 16, 14, 12 y 11 años de edad, sus cuatro primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del  hogar, sus 2 últimas hijas estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el trabajo y sacrificio de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia. 
Doña Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y hortalizas las que son para la venta y consumo, también cría animales como: gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, vacas y borregos que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es tener una tienda en su casa.

La Señora. Sandra A. vive por el sector del Cruce en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un bebé de 8 meses de edad. Vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive cuidando una casa.
La Señora Sandra hace 2 meses labora como empleada domestica y en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes. Se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su prima, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes. Su sueño es  tener un taller para confeccionar ropa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Americas is made up of 6 women and 1 man, who are friends and live in different communities in Cuenca city. They work in agriculture and raise animals, and also work in the city in various activities which allow them to contribute to their household costs. These members are very hard working, friendly and charismatic women who strive each day to help their families. 

Señora Rosa Q. lives in the Tutupali Chico community. This is her first loan with the communal bank and she was invited by her cousin, who also belongs to the group. She is 40 years old, is married and has 6 children - 19, 17, 16, 14, 12 and 11 years old. Her four oldest children work and help with the household costs, and her two youngest study in a local school. Rosa's husband is a builder, and with both working and making sacrifices they have managed to build their own home.

Rosa works in agriculture, sowing vegetables and garden produce to sell and consume. She also breeds animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, cows and sheep, which she sells when she needs to. Rosa will use the money from this loan to purchase chickens. Her goal is to have a shop in her house. 

Sandra A. lives in the Cruce district in the Cumbe parish. She is 19, is single and has an 8 month old baby. She lives in her mother's house and they share the household costs. They don't have their own home as she looks after a house. Sandra has been working as a domestic employee for 2 months, and she also breeds guinea pigs in her house. This is her first loan with the communal bank, and she was invited to join by her cousin. The money from this loan will be used to purchase more guinea pigs. Her dream is to have a workshop where she makes clothes.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Cinthia Yovanna

texts.es:
Cinthia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz  en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.  Su comunidad es pequeña y fue formada hace casi 6 años. Actualmente cuenta con luz eléctrica, pero aún no tiene agua potable. 

Desde hace 2 años, brinda servicios de tipeos e impresos desde su domicilio. Cuenta con una base de clientes establecida y fiel. Adicionalmente, trabaja como secretaria para la Municipalidad de Cañaris. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de suministros de oficina para complementar su negocio de tipeos. También planea ofrecer en venta los útiles a sus clientes para generar otros ingresos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 soles.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 27 years old, single and does not have any children. She lives with her parents in the District of Jose Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque Region. Her community is small and was founded about six years ago. Presently it has electricity but not running water yet.

She offers typing and printing services at her house. She has a base of fixed and faithful customers and also works as a secretary in the Municipality of Canaris. The loan will be used to buy supplies for her typing business and to sell them to her customers to increase her income. This is the reason for her requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her typing business.

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul S., 33, is the leader of this group.  She resides in Kochkor. She is married to a general worker and together they take care of five children, the oldest of whom is fifteen. For five years Jazgul has been selling women clothing.  During the warm seasons she also runs a second business selling vegetables.   Both businesses generate between 6,000 and 10,000 soms a month.   She plans to use this loan to invest in both her vegetable selling and her clothing retail business.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits/vegetables and clothing to resell

loans.name: Beldine

texts.en: Beldine is 33 years old and is married with three children.  She operates a poultry farm with one employee.  Through the training offered by Faulu Kenya, she has been enlightened on book keeping, time management and saving money.  This has helped her to run her business well.  She hopes to become a successful business-lady in the future.  With 20,000 KES, she will buy chicks to raise.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is 31 years old and is married with one child of his own and two more whom he takes care of. Fidel owns a paper mill where he sells different kinds of books. His business is well known, as well as organized. He employs one person as a helper and has two years of experience in this work. 

Fidel has requested his first loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more kinds of books to sell. This will help him to satisfy his many customers. Fidel will be able to earn more profits, which can be reinvested in his business, and he will save for his future.

loans.use: To expand his paper mill.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto, tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del cultivo , ellos tienen cuatro hijos , todos trabajan y son independientes , los planes hacia un futuro es poder  proteger de animales su pequeña y humilde finca cercado todo el perímetro que cobre el terreno ya que estos le dañan el cultivo , don Roberto desde hace veinte y cinco años labora como agricultor de piña , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta en no poder contar el capital suficiente para darle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo .El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para realizar aplicaciones y obtener producto de muy buena calidad
texts.en: Roberto is 49 years old and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife who helps him care for the crops.  They have four children, all of whom work and are independent.  His future plan is to be able to protect his small and humble farm from animals that damage his crops by installing a fence around the perimeter of the land.  Roberto has worked as a pineapple farmer for 25 years and the greatest difficulty he faces is not having enough money to provide good maintenance to his crops.  He wants the loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies to apply to his crops and obtain a very good-quality product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la señora Roxana que pertenece al banco comunal María Auxiliadora de la Asociación Arariwa que cada treinta días se reúnen con sus compañeras en la casa de una de las socias en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco. Roxana nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú), tiene 37 años edad y vive en la misma donde nacio, ella está feliz porque está sacando adelante a sus dos hijos y le estan correspondiendo estudiando. (Cusco se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística y comercio).

Roxana nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropa y fruta, ella viaja a la ciudad de Arequipa a comprar mercadería y otras veces su hermana que radica en esa ciudad le manda la ropa. Desde hace varios años que ella se dedica  a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo casacas porque hay demanda en este epoca del año pues en los meses de Mayo, Junio, Julio y Agosto hace mucho frio en la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
We met Roxana at the communal bank meeting.  She is a member of the María Auxiliadora Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association.  They meet every month with their colleagues at one of the member's houses in the San Jerónimo district in the city of Cusco.  Roxana was born in Cusco (Perú).  She is 37 years old, and she lives in the same zone where she was born.  She is happy because she is getting her two children ahead, and they are going to school.  (Cusco is known for having beautiful scenery and for being a tourist and merchant zone).

Roxana tells us that she sells clothes and fruit.  She travels to the city of Arequipa to buy merchandise.  Sometimes her sister, who is from this city, sends her the clothes.  She has been in this business for several years.   It has gone very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

At this time she needs the loan to buy more merchandise like, for example,  jackets because there is a demand for them during this time of year.  It is very cold in the city of Cusco in the months of May, June, July, and August.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like jackets, for example.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Maribel has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy t-shirts, blouses & underwear to sell.
Maribel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maribel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses & underwear to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: The picture above shows Beatrice. She sells cloth, dresses, underwear, and so on by hawking in the vicinity of Besease near Elmina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is an electrician. She wants to expand her business and so needs a loan to buy more of the above mentioned items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 52 years old. He comes from the village of Tsitelkhevi, West Georgia. 

Merab is married and lives with his wife, Mariam, their 19-year-old daughter and his 76-year-old mother. 

Merab trades in grocery products. He buys them in Kutaisi and takes them to the nearby villages with his car. The family also owns a 1-hectare plot where they grow watermelon. Also, the family has 250 nut trees on their plot. Merab sells harvested nuts and watermelons in his village and nearby. The total average income of the family is 800 GEL per month. 

Merab requested credit for purchasing fertilizers. After fertilizing the plot, he will get a better and higher-quality harvest, which will bring more income to the family. The family hopes that the increased income will be enough for house renovations. It was renovated a long time ago and needs some additional work to become quiet and comfortable.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers.

loans.name: Mahoutin-Lobozounkpa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUTIN-LOBOZOUNKPA est composé de trois personnes,  qui vivent toutes dans la même maison. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ambroisine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ambroisine est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Ambroisine est mariée à un maçon du nom de Théodore. Le couple a deux  enfants tous scolarisés set ne vivant plus avec eux. Ambroisine a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour assurer convenablement le rôle de mère de famille, Ambroisine mène comme activité la vente des mèches, des sachets et des produits cosmétiques. A côté de cette activité, Ambroisine vend des articles de merceries. Ambroisine mène cette activité depuis un an. Ambroisine achète ses produits au Togo et aussi au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son revenu, Ambroisine sollicite un second crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUTIN-LOBOZOUNKPA.
texts.en: The Mahoutin-Lobozounkpa group comprises three people who all live in the same house. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ in order to to raise the level of this businesses. The group representative, named Ambroisine, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Ambroisine is 31 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a mason named Théodore. The couple have two children, both in school, and neither of whom live with their parents. Ambroisine attended school up to the secondary level. To properly fulfill the role of mother of the family, Ambroisine runs a business selling hair extensions, bags, and cosmetics. Along with this activity, she also sells haberdashery items. She has run this business for a year and buys her supplies in Togo and also in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales and income, she is seeking a second loan together with the other members of the Mahoutin-Lobozounkpa group.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, bags, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marta Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Marta Albertina está casada, tiene 24 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual aun no estudia, se dedica a la confección de tejidos como también al comercio, inicio este negocio gracias al tiempo que estuvo como trabajadora para  otro negocio, y hasta el momento cuenta con 10naños de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un dinero como prestamos a ASDIR para ampliar su capital de trabajo, trabaja en la confección de camisas y playeras, va a comprar telas e hilos para confeccionar mas y poder vender más de su producto. En el futuro quiere que su pequeño negocio sea una empresa.
texts.en:
Sra. Marta Albertina is 24 years old, married, and finished her elementary school education. She has one son who is still not in school. Marta produces and sells woven articles. She started this business as a result of working at another business. As of this moment, she has 10 years of experience.

Marta decided to request money through loans from Asociación ASDIR to increase her operating capital for making shirts and beach shoes. She is going to buy fabrics and thread so that she can produce and sell more of her products. In the future, she wants her small business to become a larger enterprise.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving.

loans.name: Houenoussou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUENOUSSOU est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Estelle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Estelle est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Estelle est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Séraphin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Estelle a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Estelle prépare du pâté (fait à base de la farine de blé) qu'elle vend à son domicile et de façon ambulante. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus l'aidant ainsi à assurer les diverses charges de la maison, Estelle vend du charbon de bois. Estelle mène cette activité depuis cinq ans. Estelle s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Estelle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group HOUENOUSSOU is composed of three persons who live in the same district. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Estelle, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 39 years old and married to a wood worker by the name of Séraphin. They have four children, who are all in school and in their care. Estelle did not have much schooling. To support herself and her children, she makes pâté (made from wheat flour) that she sells out of her home and door to door. Aside from this, she sells charcoal, a business which generates the revenues helping her to ensure the various household expenses are covered. She has been in this business for five years. She is supplied from one of the markets in Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Pascaline and the other members of the group HOUENOUSSOU are requesting a third loan. The two previous loans have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and charcoal

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana earns a living through hog raising and “tuba” (coconut wine) vending. She has a backyard piggery where she fattens pigs to sell at the market. Ponciana sells her “tuba” to retail stores in her town.

Ponciana requested this loan to purchase piglets, feed and containers for tuba. She hopes to have a better income and be able to improve her house.

loans.use: purchase piglets, feed and wine containers

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc is a 39-year-old single woman who lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Truc earns an income to support her family by running a food stall in front of her house. She has been running her food business for the past 19 years.

Truc would like to receive a loan to buy new furniture for her food stall and buy more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her food stall and more food to sell

loans.name: Alina Elizabeth

texts.es: Alina tiene 59 años de edad,  es soltera y tiene 2 hijos independientes. Hace 20 años Alina se dedica a la venta de comidas, donde alquila un local, ya que por el momento no cuenta con un local propio, Alina es una mujer trabajadora y fuerte, que tuvo que sacar adelante sus hijos, haciendo el papel de padre y madre para ellos, ya que nos manifiesta que es madre soltera, aunque eso no fue impedimento para ella. Alina se siente feliz ya que nos manifiesta que con su esfuerzo a logrado hacer estudiar a sus hijos y de mejorar sus casa. A futuro le gustaría comprarse un carro, para brindar servicio de transporte. Con el crédito solicitado lo va invertir en su negocio (restaurante) para comprar insumos como arroz, fideos, pollo, leche, entre otros productos. Alina está muy agradecida con la ayuda brindada ya que le ayuda seguir avanzando.
texts.en:
Alina, 59, is single and has two independent children.  For the last 20 years Alina has been selling meals.  She rents a space because she currently does not own a place of her own.  

Alina is very hardworking and strong.  She had to raise her children being both father and mother for them because she states that she’s a single mother although this was not an obstacle for her.  Alina feels happy because she states that with her efforts she’s managed to provide education for her children and to make improvements to her house.  

In the future, she’d like to buy a car to provide transportation services.  She will use the requested loan to invest in her business (restaurant).  She will buy ingredients like rice, noodles, chicken and milk, among other products.  Alina is very grateful for the support provided because it helps her to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, chicken and milk.

loans.name: Hermione

texts.fr: Hermione vit en location avec son mari et ses 3 enfants, tous scolarisés. Les dépenses du foyer reviennent à son mari mais elle y participe aussi. Hermione vend des produits cosmétiques, des mèches, des produits alimentaires et des boissons. En cette période  de la rentrée scolaire, elle y a associé la vente des fournitures scolaires. Ses clients sont constitués des habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle effectue ses approvisionnements dans les marchés du Bénin. Hermione souhaiterait une augmentation de son fonds de commerce afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, raison pour laquelle elle a sollicité et obtenu son 8ème renouvellement de micro crédit à FINADEV. L'intérêt généré par le micro crédit lui permettra de faire face à ses charges personnelles et familiales.
texts.en: Hermione lives with her husband and her three children who are all in school.  Her household expenses fall to her husband but she also helps out.  Hermione sells cosmetics, candles, food and drinks.  During this back-to-school period she sells school supplies. Her customers are residents of her area and surrounding areas.  She buys her products in the markets in Benin.  Hermione would like to increase her business capital in order to better satisfy her customers.  For this reason, she has requested her eighth loan from FINADEV.  The profits she makes from her micro loan will allow her to cover her personal and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy thirty boxes of exercise books and twenty boxes of biros

loans.name: Jose Darwin

texts.es:
José,esta soltero, es agricultor, el negocio lo inicio con su padre de quien recibe ayuda en el trabajo, todos los dias  de lunes a sábado trabaja a tiempo completo.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como semilla mejorada y abono, entre otras cosas, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar sus cosechas y mejorar los ingresos.
La aspiracion de José es trabajar, mantenerse en el negocio para recibir mayores ingresos para mantenerse y colaborar con su familia.
texts.en:
José is single, and a farmer. He started this business with his father, who helps him with the work. He works full time, every day from Monday to Saturday. 

He is applying for a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies, such as hybrid seed, fertilizer, and other things. This purchase will help him improve his harvests and income.

José's ambition is to work, and stay in the business, in order to earn more income to support himself, and contribute to his family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seed and fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es: Ester Maria tiene 49 años, ella tiene su negocio que es una pulpería que ofrece jabón, detergente, granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, pan, papel higiénico y enlatados.  Desde hace 5 años se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos trata de cubrir todos sus gastos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.Ha solicitado un crédito para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio sea más grande y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Esther María, 49, has a grocery store where she sells soap, detergent, basic grains, soft-drinks, juices, bread, toilet paper and canned goods.  She’s been selling staple goods for the last five years.  With profits obtained from her sales she tries to cover all her expenses and to improve her family’s quality of life.  She has asked for a loan to buy more merchandise so that her business will be larger and she can have a better stock of merchandise available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ziorsi

texts.es: Ziorsi, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, le gusta los negocios. Es soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres y sus dos hermanos menores de 13 y 6 años de edad, habitando una casa que es de propiedad de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Ziorsi, es la venta de ropa de variados modelos y de buena calidad, vendiendo solo ropa para caballeros, que le envía una tía  desde la ciudad de Lima, cada 15 días, para venderlos entre sus amistades y conocidos al contado y en ocasiones al crédito a 10 días- También trae a pedido el modelo que le soliciten, dedicándose a esta actividad hace dos años, y realizándola sola en lo relacionado a la venta de los productos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico, con el cual pagará sus estudios, y apoya en ocasiones a sus padres en algunos gastos del hogar, así como el tiempo libre que le deja, con el cual ella lo dedica a sus estudios superiores, lo que no le gusta  es la impuntualidad en el pago de algunos créditos otorgados, pero no le ha traído problemas con sus compromiso de pagos. Además considera rentable su negocio porque tiene una regular clientela que en su mayoría son su compañeros de estudios, amigos y familiares. Desea en un futuro abrir una tienda de venta de ropa en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de  contar con un crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas, y tener acceso a más créditos. Con el monto solicitado de 1,300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropa en mayores cantidades a menos precios, y así tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Ziorsi, 22, is a hard-working, enterprising woman who enjoys business transactions.  She is single and lives with her parents and two younger bothers, ages 13 and 6.  They live in their own home.  Ziosi sells different styles of top quality men's clothing, which an aunt of hers in Lima sends every two weeks.  Most of her customers are friends and acquaintances and she sells on a cash or 10-day credit basis.  She also brings in clothing on an order basis and has been in business for two years.  She handles the selling aspect of business on her own.  What she likes best is having her own income to pay for her education and sometimes help her parents wtih household expenses, as well has having free time to study.  What she likes least is the lack of payment punctuality on the credit she gives some customers, but this has not interfered with her loan payment commitment.  She feels her business is profitable because she has a regular customer base comprised of colleagues, friends and relatives.  In the future she wants to open a clothing store in downtown Pucallpa.  This is her first loan through the MFP institution and she is grateful for the opportunity to grow her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time so she can have access to more loans.  The 1,300 PEN loan will be used to buy bulk clothing at lower prices so she can increase earnings.

loans.use: To buy more clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children.

Maria has a shop that makes and sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is 27 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, Uganda with her husband and three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the last two years, Maureen has worked hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, soap and other products for the home. To help expand her business, Maureen has applied for a loan for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to buy more food for her family. Her goal for the future is to someday own a wholesale business. Maureen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that are too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more sugar, soap and other home supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from the village of Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Merlinda is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Merlinda owns and operates a business raising crops, planting, and harvesting for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, fifty-one, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.  She is an ice cream vendor.  Her husband is a rice farmer.  Her children are garment workers. 

Pov is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike to carry her ice cream to sell.  In the future, she would like to run a food store at home and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 39, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store at home for over five years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a truck driver. All of her children are still in school. Chenda requests a loan of USD 700 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to rent a store at the market to sell groceries, build a new house, and support her children to study until they get their bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to generate more income

loans.name: Luis Anibal

texts.es:
Luis es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y siempre querer ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Luis es un padre soltero de 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, quienes han sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Luis anteriormente trabajaba como mecánico de reparación de motos, actividad que ha desempeñado gran parte de su vida y con la cual ha estado vinculado a un empleo. Luis, al ver que su empleo estaba muy mal remunerado, decidió montar su propio negocio de reparación de motos. Debido al poco capital con el que contaba Luis en el momento de montar su taller, no pudo conseguir un local y tampoco pudo conseguir gran parte de la herramienta. Es por esto que Luis aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de herramientas de mano que requiere para poder desarrollar adecuadamente su actividad y no tener que pedirlas prestadas cada vez que hace un trabajo.

Luis espera poder conseguir estas herramientas sin que sus ingresos mensuales se vean afectados, además, espera que su negocio le genere buenos ingresos con los cuales pueda ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Luis espera que su negocio le brinde la posibilidad de adquirir un local, pues actualmente desempeña su actividad a domicilio, lo que hace difícil que muchas personas lo reconozcan.

loans.use: Compra de herramientas de mano que requiere para poder desarrollar adecuadamente su actividad y no tener que pedirlas prestadas cada vez que hace un trabajo.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de granos secos como maíz, lentejas y frejoles.La socia está logrando salir adelante,  con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación aporta en su hogar, el deseo de la socia es ampliar su negocio y ahora que se acerca fin de año , la socia necesita aumentar su mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes mas alternativas de compra.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar maíz, lentejas y trigo
La socia Bernardina está contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella y en su negocio.

loans.use: maíz, lentejas y trigo

loans.name: Masooda

texts.en:
Masooda, who is 23 years old, lives in a household of 5 in District 5, Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is married and  passed 4 years of her life in a difficult situation before she started to take a loan from AFSG.

Masooda and her husband Ghulam Mohammad are doing a share business of grocery shop.
Masooda is cleaning the dried fruit and package them and her husband sells them in the shop, in the winter time she makes jam and pickles and vinegar for her husband shop.

She helped her husband and took a loan through AFSG so that her husband can buy lots of goods for his shop. Right now she passed the 1st cycle loan and is continuing with a 2nd loan cycle. She believes that taking a loan and spending it  on thier business will create benefits  and grow fast.

After 30 years of war in Afghanistatn, an additional challenge was that the war had left its mark on women in Afghanistan. Even after that, many women continued to be restricted to their homes and doubted their ability to cope in the outside world or to run a successful business. Many women who were part of a small home business had no idea of the value of their work or of their products on the market.
So AFSG started to focus and lend only to those women who can be at least a part of the business with the male member of thier family.
Masooda is one of those women who is not allow to go out side of her house but still she is trying to help her family, due to all those problems she AFSG is not able to post her photo on the site but perfer to have her husband on his working.

loans.use: To buy Goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lety would like to buy machinery to help her plant the next rice crop on her rice farm

loans.name: Gloria Angelica

texts.en:
My name is Glora N.. I sell spare parts for bicycles like tires, inner tubes, breaks, chains, oil, pedals, bolts, screws, and steering wheels. I've had my business for 4 years and it's going well because where I live, the majority of people go on bike since it's too expensive to buy a car or go in taxi. At this moment I need to increase my inventory because sales are good due to the extra month of salary paid to private and state employees this month. People take advantage of this to repaid broken things.

With the profits I will make, I will pay for household expenses and for the schooling of my two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Gloria N. me dedico a la venta de repuestos para bicicletas como ser llantas, neumaticos, breques, cables de freno, cadenas, aceite, pedales, tuercas, tornillos, timones, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, el cual es muy bueno ya que en donde vivo la mayoria de la gente se transporta en bicicleta porque es muy caro comprar carros o pagar taxis, en estos momentos necesito mas inventario porque estos dias son muy buenos para las ventas ya que a los empleados privados y estatales lesdan un suelo de mas en este mes, y la gente aprovecha para arreglar las cosas que tienen malas.

Con las ganancias que obtenga poder pagar los gastos alimenticios de mi hogar y pagarle los estudios a mis dos hijas.

loans.use: to buy spare bicycle parts: tires, repair kits, chains, brakes, and break cables

loans.name: Noy

texts.en: Mrs. Noy K. is 57 years old and lives in Phnom Penh. She stays at home to look after her grand-daughter. She has one son, who is married and who would like to run a motor-taxi business. Noy K. would like to take out this loan of $400 so that she can help her son start his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to run a business

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
I am a poor woman with seven children whom I could not educate due to our underprivileged financial status. We started operating a restaurant six years ago; my two eldest sons and my husband also assist me in this business. Additionally, my other three sons are laborers.

The income from all these sources is just enough to meet our living expenses. My restaurant has high turnover, however, we have a reputation for making quality food, especially tea. To increase the restaurant business and include more items on our menu, I need to invest 175 USD. With the additional income, I will repair my house and improve our living situation.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Talalelei Merita

texts.en: Talalelei is a lady of 49 years old, married with four children. She is very good in making pork buns which she has made for five years now. Her loan is for buying ingredients such as flour, salt, yeast, drippings (fat) and meats. She sells them at school and at the village five days a week, and makes a net profit of 120 Tala ($48) per day, which ishe thinks is good. She said she is very happy about her business because it helps with family financial obligations and especially school fees for her children. And she is thankful for the loan program.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pork bun business

loans.name: Odilonia

texts.es:
Odilonia is a single mother of a beautiful daughter. She lives with her parents and owns a small convenience store where she sells groceries such as soft drinks, fruits, vegetables, canned goods, noodles, flour, etc. This summer season, the products that are sold the most are cold drinks. She also plans to sell homemade ice cream next month.

She is currently requesting this loan so that she may purchase soft drinks, juice, mineral water, and beer because those are the most popular items this season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Odilonia, es madre soltera una hermosa hija; vive con sus padres y es propietaria de un despensa donde vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad y de consumo.

Entre las cosas que vende podemos citar gaseosas, frutas, vegetales, productos enlatados, fideos, harina, etc. En esta época de verano lo que más vende son las bebidas bien frías, más adelante desea vender helados de su propia elaboración.

El proyecto de venta y elaboración de los helados lo concretará en el mes siguiente. Hoy ella solicita un crédito para poder surtir su despensa con bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, agua mineral y cerveza ya que son los de mayor venta en esta época.

loans.use: Purchase of beverages—soft drinks, beer, mineral water, juice

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret K. is married with 6 children, is 50 years old and hails from Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells charcoal in her community. She has been in business since 2003 and has been a client of LAPO for the past 2 years. She needs the loan of $275 to buy more charcoal to be sold.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Damirali

texts.en: Damirali D. is a 55-year-old farmer who keeps a cow and sells milk and yoghurt in a small village of Saatli region. He has more than ten years of experience in  this business. He is married and has four children. Dairy products are in high demand all across Azerbaijan. Damirali decided to increase his income and has applied for $1100 USD. With this loan, he is going to purchase two baby calves for $200 USD and two calves for an estimated cost of $300 USD each and fodder for the rest 100 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two calves and two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: K. Mahbuba lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan.  She is divorced and has one child.   A client of MicroInvest since 2007, she has established her credibility as a borrower and has opened a trade outlet selling food products.  Over time she has expanded her business and now sells food products, towels and furnishings, perfume and toys. She works with suppliers from China so she trades in low prices and has repeat customers. She is now applying to Kiva for an 8 month loan of $775 which she will use in expanding her business.

loans.use: Expand sales areas.

loans.name: Gavino

texts.es:
Gavino sells groceries in the mobile markets on Virgen de Lujan avenue and Virgen de Cotoca avenue also. He also has a space in his home for selling cakes and snacks.

Gavino lives alone with his two kids who are older and have their own incomes.

He has been deciated to these businesses since five years ago and the competition in this business is raised due to the quantity of people selling the same things. His time in the business has allowed him to form a fixed group of clients who search for him to acquire the products that they need.

The current loan is for the acquisition of more merchandise. The prices vary on the type of the product and the market prices. This is his fourth loan with this institution and he has always proven to be a responsible and punctual person in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Gavino vende abarrotes en las ferias móviles de la avenida Virgen de Lujan y Virgen de Cotoca también cuenta con un puesto de pastillas y gaseosas en su domicilio.

Gavino vive sólo con sus dos hijos que son mayores de edad y cuentan con ingresos propios.

Se dedica a estos negocios desde hace mas de 5 años atrás y si bien la competencia en este rubro es elevada por la cantidad de personas que venden los mismos artículos, su antiguedad le permitió hacerse de clientela fija que lo buscan para adquirir sus productos que son de la canasta familiar.

La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de mayor mercadería y los precios de la misma varia dependiendo del tipo de producto y sobre todo de los precios que fija el mercado. Esta es su cuarta secuencia con la institución y siempre demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yuli

texts.id:
Yuli has been a seamstress for 10 years. This business is her only income source, therefore she develops it diligently. She sews shirts, linens, etc. She usually purchase fabrics in advance and then sewn into finished product and sold to a garment wholesaler. Her profit was barely enough to cover daily living expenses. She hopes for funding help to continue her business, recently the price of fabric is increasing so she is facing financial constraint.

Translated from bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sudah 10 tahun Yuli menjalankan usaha sebagai penjahit. Usaha ini sudah merupakan sumber penghasilannya, sehingga dia sangat tekun menjalankannya. Adapun barang yang biasa dijahitnya adalah baju, seprei dan lain-lain. Biasanya, dengan modal yang dia miliki sekarang ini, dia membeli kain di garmen lalu dijahit menjadi berbagai macam produk, dan nantinya dia akan menjualnya kembali ke garmen. Keuntungan yang dia dapat hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari. Dia mangharapkan diberi bantuan untuk membuat usahanya tetap berjalan, karena saat ini harga kain naik sehingga dia kesulitan untuk bisa membelinya.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mary M.. She is married and has three children aged between 5 and 11. She has two dependents who live with her because they are in school in the area. In 2004, Mary established her poultry business. She opens her business 6 days a week, 12 hours a day. She is assisted by her one employee. Mary has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan to purchase additional chicks and feed. This will help her increase her monthly income. In the future, Mary plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Betman

texts.es:
Betman is 25 years old. He works as a taxi driver and in agriculture with the help of his wife. They have a small child and both work hard in order to give him all the necessities, especially an education. Betman is the driver of a mototaxi, which is having mechanical issues. As a result, he is relying on you to provide him with a loan so he may repair his mototaxi, as well as invest in his farmland for a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Betman tiene 25 años, trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros, y en la agricultura con la ayuda de su esposa, tienen un pequeño hijo, y ambos trabajan duro para darle lo necesario, en especial para los gastos estudiantiles. Betman es dueño de un motocarro, el que está presentando fallas mecánicas, por lo que recurre a ustedes para que le brinden un préstamo con el que pueda reparar su motocarro e invertir en sus tierras de cultivo para una mejor cosecha.

loans.use: Repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: Kiba A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Kiba M.. She is married and has two children aged 2 and 9. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2005, Kiba established her genge business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Kiba requires a loan in order to buy more home needs in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Genge The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy more basic staples in bulk

loans.name: Nong

texts.en:
This is the third time Mrs. Nong S. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity.  She is a villager in Ponlai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price.  Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, which is why she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice.  

Mrs. Nong S. is a 58 year-old widow with two children who are both attending school.  Previously, Mrs. Nong S. had obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business.  She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Anner

texts.es: La venta de pescado fresco es la actividad diaria de Anner, trabaja duro para seguir adelante. A sus 55 años es padre de 2 hijos que estudian y son sus ganas de seguir surgiendo para brindarles lo necesario, su esposa Faustina es su mejor apoyo.  En el futuro quiere ser exportador de este producto a las diferentes ciudades de nuestro país. Se levanta muy temprano para comprar el pescado en el puerto, luego lleva a venderlo por los diferentes lugares de su zona.  Anner es un hombre muy decidido, amable y jovial con sus clientes.  Para incrementar el capital para su negocio, es que solicita este préstamo y espera, pueda obtener, con la promesa de ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The salea of fish is the daily activity of Anner, who works hard to get ahead. At 55 years of age, he is the father of two children who are studying and it is his desire to forge ahead so he can provide the necessities of life for them. His wife Faustina is his greatest supporter. In the future, he would like to become an exporter of this product to the various cities of our country. He rises very early to buy the fish at the docks, later taking them to sell in the various areas of his zone. Anner is a very decisive, friendly and jovial man with his customers. He solicits this loan in order to increase his working capital and he hopes he can receive it, with the promise of being punctual with his payments.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased working capital for his business selling fresh fish.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La señora  Mónica, socia del B C El Abiseo, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos que aún dependen de ella. Tiene una cabina de Internet bien implementada, el cual está ubicado en el Jr. Triunfo C–05, es la casa de sus suegros. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal, el cual le ha permitido crecer en el negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará repuestos para sus computadoras, así como también lo implementará con accesorios como cámaras, audífonos que ya tiene que cambiarlos porque ya están malogrados por el demasiado uso, de esa manera podrá dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. 

Mónica manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y para su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras. Trabaja duro cada día porque quiere crecer en su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mónica, a member of “El Abiseo” Community Bank, lives in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres province in the San Martín region. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two young children. She has a well-equipped internet café located at C-05 Triunfo Lane, in the home of her in-laws. She has been working with the bank for four years and this has enabled her business to develop. With this loan of S/3,000 (approximately US $975), which will be repaid in six months, she will buy parts for her computers. In order to provide better service to her clients, she will also purchase accessories like cameras and headphones (which need to be replaced due to overuse). Mónica attests that Manuela Ramos is a great support for her and for her family, as well as for other entrepreneurial women. She works hard every day because she want to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase parts for computers as well as accessories like webcams and headphones.

loans.name: Kroeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Kroeurn U. is a villager in the Ta Prass Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Kroeurn U. is 51 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in different businesses, while the youngest one is attending the local school. 

She is a farmer who usually gathers a small percentage of rice revenue to support the household. Her husband, Mr. Keo Touch, is a duck breeder. Since his duck business is doing well, he wishes to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Kroeurn U. has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy more ducklings for her husband's breeding business. Additionally, she would use the rest of the loan to buy duck food for her current business. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more ducklings for her husband's breeding business.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn K. lives in Press Leu village in Takeo province. She is a 46-year-old widow with three children. One of the children is working in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. She is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Although she and her children work hard, they still do not earn an income which can provide decent living conditions for the family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Morn K. has decided to ask for a loan of $450 to buy a cow to start a breeding cow business.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start breeding cow business.

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
